description:
I had a fantastic time eating here.

The atmosphere is excellent even if the crowd is a little touristy. The bread got to me cold, but it didn't make too much of an impact because the waitstaff was one of the most friendly I've ever encountered. It made my night to interact with them.

The arugula salad I got was delicious, as was the ravioli primi and ala ban rum (forgive me if I butchered the spelling). The portion size on the entree could've been a little bigger and the dessert did need a little more cream, but overall I walked away feeling satisfied.

I definitely recommend Piazza.
author: Brian L.

description:
I just ordered delivery of the Pizza Margherita with extra sauce because the pizza in their photo looked dry!  I added Arugula for $2.00 and requested it on the side so it wouldn't be wilted.

Additionally, I ordered their Fried Calamari and Shrimp requesting extra sauce on the side.

First the Calamari and Shrimp is nice and crispy, so two stars for that.

However, wilted steamed arugula, no extra sauce, a dry pizza with a few sprinkles of basil and a couple of swishes of sauce is not worth $17.
author: Sandi L.

description:
I'm originally from Atlanta, so I was just in town. I had met my friend in the city for lunch, but didn't have anywhere in mind and ended up choosing this place because it had outdoor seating and it was a lively day. this place wasn't terrible, but it wasn't exactly very good. 
We were seated immediately, and someone filled up our waters. The server seemed like he did NOT wanna be there. Kind of just hovered and looked at us expectantly for our orders and not really asking for it. We wrote it off as he was having a bad day, but it was seriously annoying when he just was being rude and there wasn't a single good interaction. 
You do get complimentary bread, but that's something every Italian place should have anyway. I ordered some pasta and the noodles came out way over cooked and the sauce wasn't anything out of the ordinary. The portion sizes were pretty large though, so that was a sorta a plus. I just expected waaaaaaay more with the prices that they set their food at. I could get better service and quality of food at Olive Garden for cheaper. 
Honestly, wasn't really impressed and when I'm in down again I probably won't go out of my way to come eat here again.
author: Judy L.

description: My wife and I stopped by at 10pm on a Friday night, an hour before they closed, and asked if they had dessert. We were handed a menu, and then proceeded to sit at an outside table. A moment later a manager walked over and gruffly said they were only serving people for dinner. This was surprising, as more than half the restaurant - at least a dozen tables- were empty. We will definitely not be returning.
author: Jim B.

description:
We grabbed a table here after deciding against waiting for five years to get a table at Italian Homemade. 
It was pretty quiet, so service was pretty quick. We were STARVING - so the round of complimentary bread was very very welcome. We ordered the calamari, bruschetta, gnocchi bolognese and a smoked salmon pizza. 
The calamari was really good (and came with a tomato sauce that was delightful) - and the portion was pretty generous. Everything else was okay - it was tasty, but nothing THAT special. At $19 each, I felt like it wasn't great value for money - but there were no real complaints. 
We shared profiteroles for dessert - which were filled with gelato instead of the traditional whipped cream. I could have eaten ten of them (but my wallet would never allow). 
Overall? Good, but 100% could have made a tastier meal myself for half the price.
author: Poppy C.

description: Happened upon this spot randomly. Late lunch/early dinner situation.  Good pizza for the kids, Peroni on tap, incredible Dungeness crab cioppino (pictured), delicious fettuccini a la matriciana, and about everything else you could need. Excellent service and a stellar patio in the heart of Little Italy in SF.
author: Michael L.

description:
My boss recommended this place when I went on vacation and I can say that this was some amazing Italian food. The chicken pizza was light and crispy. This pizza did not slide down or needed an extra hand from toppings falling over which I definitely appreciated. 

Also, ordered the gnocchi a la gargonzola. If you're not used to the differing cheese like how I was, it's okay. The taste gets better but that cream sauce is to die for. Best sauce I've ever tasted. Definitely would recommend to anyone visiting SF.
author: Jannat C.

description:
"On the corner of pizza and poverty"

This place will draw you in with their nice location across from the park and plenty of outdoor seating (with umbrellas!). Definitely a good spot to chill and enjoy a sunny day.

The menu is limited, but it is a cafe. They do have my favorite staples though: pizza, gelato, desserts, and more. Portion size was refreshingly on point. I ordered one scoop of gelato and I must say it was quite the hefty scoop (See exhibit A in the pictures).

The ambience is serene, partially due to outdoor setting and the no smoking rules. The live music on the other hand... at first I thought: "Great, who doesn't like music!". Once I started listening, I thought "This guy! He hates music! What is he doing to that song???". I didn't know such public mutilation was legal.

Only other downside was that this is a hotspot for older homeless people. Two separate older homeless ladies came by to eat leftover pizza around us and ask for empty bottles. It's SF. It is what it is. One of the trade offs for an outdoor location I guess.

Protip: Come for the gelato. Stay for the people watching.
author: Joel L.

description: This is probably my favorite place to eat here in San Francisco, great service and great food.
author: Rachel O.

description: Definitely not bad but not great.  I had an arugula salad with salmon which was very tasty.  My husband had the roasted chicken which looked pretty good.  The other people in our group had a pizza which was enough for them to share and had a nice crispy thin crust.  The spicy olive oil was truly so spicy!  Don't think I'd return but enjoyed our meal just wasn't wowed.
author: Kelly M.

description:
AMAZING. Such a cute location and best food I have ever tried. We came in and were seated immediately, staff was so kind and friendly, got our food fast and it was so so good. We got the fettuccine with chicken and broccoli and the angel haired pasta. Probably one of the best meals of my life. I'm normally not the type to leave a review but this place deserves it! The dessert is a bit pricey but so worth it. Personally I would recommend the creme puffs. The ice cream inside is amazing. 
Absolutely in love with this place and would totally go again!
author: Tanya O.

description: Food is meh. The server forgot about us, it took us 15 min to get a flat soda. Salads apparently have only 1 extremely citrusy dressing regardless of the salad you order. Only good dish was the overpriced crab ravioli.
author: Sagi G.

description:
Good Italian cafe on Columbus with sidewalk seating.

Good service.

Mista salad was nice $8.95

Fritto misto (calamari with 2 shrimp appetizer) was ok $14.95

Gnocchi gorgozol was good $18.95

Capellini pomo was good $15.95

Squash ravioli was good $18.95

Special dungenous crab Cioppino was vey nice however the crab a bit dry $29.95

Profiterole dessert was amazing and a must try $10. This dessert was fantastic!!!!

Budino di pano dessert was very good $10

Cappuccino very good $5.

House Sangiovese wine was decent $10

We've eaten here before over a year ago  and were treated the same and the food was basically the same ... very nice overall.
author: Vic M.

description: This meal we had tonight was better than the food we had in Rome! Service was prompt and friendly. They had a specials menu handwritten for today. We started with the fried calamari and shrimp appetizer which was fresh, not greasy, and lightly breaded. I had the parpardelli with the short rib ragu and my husband thoroughly enjoyed a chicken, spinach, prosciutto, and gnocchi dish off of the specials menu. Highly recommend!! We found it affordable at approx $20 per plate as the portions were large.
author: Jerica D.

description:
We were deeply disappointed with our experience at this restaurant. Arriving for a late lunch at approximately for 4:00PM, we were informed there were no available tables in the dining room. We thus receded to two seats at the bar in the back of the restaurant. The first course consisted of a putative Caesar salad. The lettuce used for the salad was bagged and browning. No leaves were used in preparing the dish; rather, we were served only the brown stalks. The dressing was heavy and appeared lumpy and devoid of flavor. We then ordered a margheritta pizza with arugula, increasing the price of the pie an additional $2. The dish arrived as a margherrita pizza, which appeared to have a family-sized bag of arugula unloaded on the top. We then ordered gnocchi, which was nearly drowned in pesto. 

Underpinning all of this was an environment which seemed to disintegrate before us. Half-opened boxes of supplies populated the bar, bread pulled hastily out of an aluminum crate was re-circulated to customers, children would screech and wail, making the environment unsettling and impossible to hold a conversation.  As a gesture of apology, our server gifted us a bottle of wine upon our prompt exit.
author: A L.

description:
Terrible.

We waited a long time to get to the pizzeria and it was terrible. Even after we finally got our seats, were unattended for the next 20 mins.

First, a manager came and tried aggressively sell us something pricey also obviously lying about pizza size so we will be buying more. We ordered pizza for two, salad, and garlic bread, but the manager said: "Continue to study the menu." and left us. We assumed he was frustrated because we are not buying what he sells.

After another 15 minutes of waiting for a service, a waiter finally came and received our order. The food was fine, pizza is more bread than pizza really. Garlic bread was tasty.

The culmination of the evening was the dirty plates with some tomato leftovers they served, so check your dishes before you eat.
author: Oleg S.

description:
Nice staff, good pasta at reasonable prices 
Also the wine in bottles were acceptable priced
author: Pellson B.

description: Food was amazing. Ambiance is great too. Server seemed a little overwhelmed. Would definitely come back when in San Fran.
author: Michele F.

description:
The service and food were absolutely perfect. The lobster ravioli was amazing. The server recommended the arugula salad, and it was delicious. The server was attentive and our food kept rolling to the table as you would expect. 
The only downside was the reservation process. We were double booked because of similar names. Maybe next time it would be useful to take more information than just the first name.
author: Milla H.

description: We love this little restaurant in North Beach. My favorite is the Fettuccine Al Gamberoni.
author: Teri F.

description: This place was amazing!! From start to finish. Food and service!! We had the specials of the evening which were the Pizza Burreta with Prosciutto and Cioppino. DELISIOSO!!
author: Kelly P.

description: Horrible food, most of the food we ordered was left on the plate because of how bad it was. The calamari didn't even taste like calamari and the sauce was horrible. For a prime location in North Beach this place did not live up to its standards.
author: Shay S.

description: We often go to Taverna Pellegrini in Orinda, CA.  We stopped at their sister restaurant  Piazza Pellegrini in North Beach recently to see how it compared.  Their location is right outside of the main area of North Beach closer to Fisherman's Wharf.  Nice quieter location than in the heart of North Beach - it felt very relaxing.   It was cold outside so we sat at the window table inside the restaurant.    They have heaters and some nice tables outside which would be a great place to just chill with wine and food on a warm day.  It was a very homey atmosphere inside - service was a bit slow at first but once the server came by, it was all fine.   I They served us lots of bread and we just ordered soup and salad  and a half carafe of house wine since we were making multiple stops.  The soup was excellent as was the salad.  I look forward to returning when the weather is nicer, siting outside and getting some nice pasta - the selections looked great as I passed by the other tables.  Our server was really nice and very attentive!
author: Ginger O.

description:
A group of 4 friends and I headed out to dinner at Piazza Pellegrini tonight after a day at Folsom Street Fair. It was a neat evening so we sat outside. Out waitress was fantastic and a very sweet young lady from Illinois name Danielle. She took great care of us and did a fantastic job

I started with the Minestrone soup. Full of veggies and very flavorful. I then had the Lamb Ragu Gnocchi. It was great. Lots of meat and very tasty. Others in the group had ravioli and fettuccine with bolognese sauce. No one had a complaint about their dinner. 

It was a very nice evening with friends at a great location with awesome service.
author: David S.

description: Stopped by for a quick appetizer and beer on the patio. Good fast service, complimentary bread basket with oil and vinegar on each table. We shared a Fritto Misto di Pesce with a beer and it was scrumptious. Great location for people watching.
author: Amy R.

description: Delicious homemade pasta. Good service. A great spot for Italian food in the heart of North Beach.
author: Patrick S.

description: I love going to eat in Little Italy because of all the great pasta you could have. But THIS place was my absolute favorite. I had the Ragu Lamb and it was phenomenal! The service by Antonio was amazing very helpful and knowledgeable of the food and wine they had to offer. Cannot wait to go back and eat dinner their again!
author: Zak H.

description:
We were here in 2011 and had great memories and great food. Unfortunately it didn't live up to our memories. 
We were there on a Sunday night and ordered a margarita pizza, eggplant parmigiana, and a fettuccine with a arrabiata sauce. The pizza had lots of cheese and no sauce. Pretty disappointing. The eggplant didn't appear to be freshly made and possibly re heated. The fettuccini was our favorite but just so so.  
Staff and service was very good. 
The biggest issue was the people next to us had a bug in their tiramisu; and then when we got up to leave there was a cockroach on the wall. 
Unfortunately we probably won't be back.
author: Charlene T.

description:
The food and service weren't awful, but it wasn't the delicious Italian food experience we were hoping for.

We had a reservation and arrived a few minutes late. The table wasn't set for us, but it was available. While we ended up getting a table by the window, it was a very difficult walk to it since the tables were cramped in and we could barely squeeze through.

It took a while to get bread, and when it arrived we were sad it wasn't garlic bread, but rather fairly average bread. The oil and balsamic containers on the table were so sticky, and it was too much of a hassle to try to go wash our hands in the bathroom.

My pappardelle was delicious, but my friend's pasta, which the waiter recommended, completely lacked flavor.

Overall it was a little pricey for a fairly average Italian meal.
author: Ariana R.

description: Our server, Esteban, was excellent. He was patient, considerate, attentive and humorous. The food was just so-so. Location was good, it's decent people-watching if sitting outside. Grade B!
author: Jeff R.

description: We were walking by here as we looked for somewhere to stop for lunch and we ended up choosing piazza's. The service was excellent and we had the meat lasagna and fettuccine all' amatriciana that was delicious. Plus, the view when you sit outside is very touristy. Definitely recommend.
author: Alan H.

description: Visiting San Fran and this was the only place open where we happened to be. We were starving so we decided to try it. The food was delicious and the service was great. A little pricy but still good.
author: Annie R.

description: Outstanding service!  Outstanding food!  Our waiter answered all our questions with cheerfulness and truly enjoyed having a conversation with us.  The prawns were the best I've ever tasted!!!  A bit pricey but they were in a tasty sauce with button tomatoes and feta cheese.  My spaghetti n meatballs were good, not the best I've ever had, but still good.  My friend had a sausage dish that tasted wonderful.  I wish I had ordered it.  I certainly want to visit this place again.
author: John C.

description:
I really enjoy this place. I actually discovered it with the SO on UberEats, and then we walked by one day and decided that we had to come in, sit down and give it a try. 

I'm fond of the venue because it reminds me a lot of Italy with the open / outdoor tables. Admittedly, it's not super optimally located because when the cable car runs by (which it does), it can be kind of loud outside, but beyond that, on a nice SF day, it's really lovely to sit outside at this place. 

My favorite dish here is the conchigliette with salsiccia and broccolini. It's so delicious on both eats and in person. I will say the most impressive thing about this dish it that it tastes just as good delivered as it does in the store. It's got a super addicting and tasty sauce, and the size is quite generous as well. 

My only quip with this place is the prices, but I supposed that's the reality of SF these days. It's close to $20 for a bowl of pasta, which I know is SF prices. I do like the conchilgliette a lot, but it doesn't strike me as craft pasta like Cotogna or Central Kitchen, which is why I have an issue with the high price point. but it does taste good. 

Overall, service when we were in the restaurant itself was fine, nothing outstanding to report. A wonderful small neighborhood joint that I could see as a cute date night spot.
author: Jasmine X.

description: The food was excellent. The service? Well, it left a lot to be desired, at least for us. When our server finally came to our table, he did not speak a single word, just looked at us. I made the first move and gave him our order. The only time he spoke to us all night was when I tried to order the chicken Marsala and he told me they were out of it. We had ordered a caprese salad, which never came out. He didn't even offer an apology. Seriously, the ONLY time he spoke was to let me know I couldn't order the Marsala. It was very, very weird. (He spent plenty of time chatting up another table. So, I know he can speak!) The other servers appeared to be very attentive and personable. I'd give it another try, just would request a different server.
author: Amy B.

description:
I've been here several times, the food was amazing as always. The vegetarian pizza, spinach ravioli & white sauce gnocchi in particular were delicious. 

However, this is the first time we weren't greeted half as warmly as the other times. The host/server was rude, curt in his responses & clearly not too pleased to have us around. It was 6-7°C outside, and when we asked him if he could shut the door as everyone at our table was freezing, he rudely refused & walked off. At about 9:45pm, we were also informed that the kitchen is closing, even though the restaurant shuts at 11pm. So don't expect to be served here if you walk in post 10pm.
author: Mansi D.

description: The food here is delicioso!!! Service was amazing and loved the waiters who were handsome Italians
author: A A.

description: Omg! This place is soooooo good and the customer service is outstanding!!!! I've always wanted to try real Italian food and this place was true. Thank you
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
I have not eaten here, but have made quick stops for a quick shot of caffeine. The outside area that has a big TV is primed for sports fans who want to watch their favorite game, enjoy the weather on a good day, and perhaps have some food.

Back to the caffeine, the espresso is done just right! One of these days I will have some food and report back right here! :-)
author: Afshin A.

description:
Nothing but high praise for these absolutely lovely folks who were so welcoming to our very large group that piled in with no reservation...plus we'd all been on a commercial fishing boat for 10 days and must have looked like hell and smelled like the cat's dinner. They quickly got a bunch of tables together and treated us like welcomed guests until after closing time.

There were, I dunno, a dozen or so of us, and I think everyone loved everything they ordered. The menu is quite diverse and there were also lots of specials. Despite all of the tempting options, I went with my yardstick dish at Italian restaurants, pasta arrabbiata. It was outstanding--spicy and smoky and tomatoey, and the perfect amount. And hats off to the carafes of house red wine...I can't recall what variety it was but it was ~$30/carafe and it was great table wine.

For dessert, I had the crostata di mele, which was a small tart with apples, apricot glaze, and a scoop of vanilla gelato. In my mind, I imagined that I was slowly savoring each bite, but I probably more or less just teleported it straight into my tummy. It was spectacular.

The staff were all smiles and very quick but completely relaxed with everything. The decor and ambience were great too...the restaurant seems to glow with a low, golden light that makes everything feel warm and peaceful.
author: Chris H.

description: Good Italian food with pleasant outdoor seating. We stopped here for lunch on a stroll through North Beach and had a lovely lunch. The Caesar salad was full of flavor. We both had the gnocchi -- one with pesto and one with the lamb ragu. The gnocchi were light and fluffy perfection. And all that with good people watching from our sidewalk patio table.
author: Scott C.

description:
Service was extremely slow. I don't think our waiter listened to our order because he came back to our table three times to make sure he took it correctly. 

For the price of the food, I don't think it's worth it.
author: Yvonne L.

description: Pizza was good but not great. Bit more American that I thought it would be. Too cheesy and dough was thick. Atmosphere and service were great.
author: T M.

description:
I work a block away at the WSI bed & breakfast. I will not be referring guest here anymore. If you decide to eat here watch out for the EXTRA CHARGES AND RUDE SERVICE. 

Today, I was shocked to have the worse customer service. I ordered for pick up over the phone for a salad with a side of chicken. They never asked for a name, number, or even told me when it would be ready. When I arrived to pick up my order, everyone was super confused. To top it off they tried to charge me $18 for a roasted chicken when I ordered a side of chicken for $5. When I brought up that there was miscommunication the server (hoping he wasn't the manager) argued with me about it and was extremely rude. He never apologized or anything. When he fixed my order he decided to charge me extra. When I called him out on this he said I was wrong, even though I order the same thing all the time. I also told him that the price was different from the menu. I even had other customers calling him out about him charging me more. I ended up leaving because I couldn't believe how disrespectful he was.
author: Gavrielle D.

description: Never again. My wife and I have come here multiple times over the last 5 years. It's usually very good. The last visit we made during the summer was just ok. Service was good but food was a bit sub par.  This evening was by far the worst example of service I have seen. As we were greeted the server directed us to sit where we liked. 20 minutes later the server comes back and asks what we wanted. My wife and daughter ordered and he walked away. I flagged him down and asked if I could order dinner and he tells me I guess so. My wife ordered a margarita pizza and he brings a cheese pizza. I ask if they had changed the recipe recently and he asks me what's wrong with the pizza. I described the ingredients and he takes the cheese pizza and has the kitchen put Basil on top. Service was rude and arrogant.  Never again will we waste time here.
author: JOAQUIN M.

description: Delicious food! Very cozy setting. The waiter was very attentive. The bathrooms were very clean. Nice place for a good dinner.
author: Megan H.

description: The food did not taste authentic. The gnocchi was squishy and tasted closer to tofu. I would give it a better review if it was like a place that was cheap but we paid atleast 20 dollars a dish and I got better Italian food in Berkeley at the $8/ plate food court
author: Siddhant P.

description: This place has great ambiance. I love the outdoor seating (they have heaters to keep you and your food warm) and a very nice street view. Friendly service and yummy food!
author: Hannah M.

description:
Excellent Italian Food , Great Atmosphere 

We had a party of 4 , great service , Chicken Parmigiana , Gnocchi Alla Gorgonzola , Cioppino , Grass Fed Ribeye was scrumptious
author: Oscar D.

description:
Good pizza and great service. Really enjoy the place and the waiter's attention! 
The restaurant is not as noisy as others in the area.
author: Romain B.

description:
My family of 4 stopped in for dinner after spending the day touring. Attentive and friendly staff and a very nice selection for dinners. Portion sizes were perfect and the value of the food was good. The linguini and clams was excellent, with great flavor. The gnocchi and Gorgonzola was good but a little bland. Our kids split the spaghetti and meatballs and they were very happy - still a good sized meal even with growing kids. The meatballs were a little soft for my taste but still very flavorful. 

The only real negative was price for the soft drinks and iced tea we ordered. $4 for a Sprite and $5 for an iced tea? And no refill - maybe you get free refills but we did not get a single one for any of our drinks. 

Overall I do recommend stopping in for dinner. Just stick with the wine and water instead of the soda and tea.
author: Erik O.

description: We arrived for a late dinner, thinking they might be closing, but they were happy to have us there. The service was fast, the staff was friendly and the food delicious!! Plus they have parking right behind it.
author: Anna Paula R.

description: Loved the pizza.  Such a crisp crust.   Meat ravioli was incredible.  Service nice and very Italian.
author: Eric H.

description:
If you have ever visited Italy and had the good fortune to have a dining experience in a true family owned restaurant, this place will take you back there!
Fresh homemade pasta, authentic table service with attention to detail and valuing you as a customer and making sure that your meal is equally as delicious as pleasant.  
Relaxed, authentic, delicious Italian food and atmosphere.
Have been here for lunch and dinner and if I had more days in San Francisco I would definitely eat here again.
Pizza Margherita, Meat Ravioli, Lasagna, spaghetti carbonara, crostini, caprese salad - ALL EXCELLENT!
House wine is nothing to disregard and definitely go for the zabaglione  with berries - DELICIOUSLY ON POINT!
Stay away from the tourist traps in little Italy and come eat here - you will. It be disappointed.  The price is right the food is awesome and the service is perfect.
author: Maria V.

description: Good food, good service, good atmosphere. Not overly fancy, but nice and authentic feeling.
author: Shaun E.

description: I'm usually very picky work gnocchi but this place is on point totally worth a try and service is !!
author: Sandra R.

description: Stopped by for a slice as I wandered the town. This site is a food truck with a great patio area. Grabbed a slice and iced tea ($8) and sat outside in the fabulous weather for a while. Pizza was thinking crust, good flavor. Not the best, but definitely did the job. Staff was courteous and friendly. Great people watching, too!
author: Despina P.

description: Wow. I was skeptical of this place because of the negative reviews. Let me just say these people are ridiculous! This restaurant was fantastic. My waiter was nice and recommended a really good white wine, I asked him to recommend a good pasta and I got the pesto chicken and it was great! My husband ordered a pizza and he rated it an 8 said that it was good. These people with nasty reviews probably were in a bad mood. Will come here again
author: Alana S.

description:
Pains me to write this but here it goes...

Piazza Pellegrini has been one of our go-to places for years. Wonderful food, ambience & service. Our dinner this past weekend started out great...Burrata appetizer, fresh lobster ravioli, wine & some alone time with my husband. Just as I was looking over the dessert menu, a roach was scaling the wall inches away from me. Ugh. When the waitress came to take our dessert order (which we passed on), my husband pointed to our 6-legged friend. She then grabbed a napkin & squished it with a nice firm push of her finger. She apologized and said there has been a roach problem for days due to the space next door. 

I get it...you're in the city & yes there are bugs, insects and rodents. It will be some time before we head back there though.

Noticed someone else wrote about a roach on the wall about 2 months ago.
author: yvette c.

description: Pasta is amazing! We enjoyed everything about our meal. Our waitress accidentally spilled a glass of red wine on my sister... but they gave us free wine, free dessert, and 50% off of our meal. The inside of the restaurant is pretty loud, so sit out on the sidewalk if you can.
author: Sophia B.

description: Dont bother.  Looks charming and seems crowded but its all tourists.  Food is nothing special.  Says $$ but dishes are moderately expensive.  Don't they know they are surrounded by like 50 other Italian places?  They could try just a little bit harder.
author: Dan N.

description:
My experience here has been late evening stops to sit outside and enjoy a lemon-pinenut torte and a coffee while I relax and people watch.

Like a number of places in North Beach...I really feel like I need to learn some basic Italian to be polite here :-)

Great service and great location.  Buonasera.
author: Jim W.

description: The pizza must have been from Chuck-E-Cheese. The bread was stale. The service was so slow. I don't mean like leisurely dinner, I mean like asking for the check three times. The food was the quality that you got in the tinfoil trays from a crappy pizza place as a kid. This place survives on clueless tourist foot traffic.
author: Ken K.

description: This might have been my favorite restaurant we ate at in San Francisco! We split the house made gnocchi with lamb ragu and the pepperoni pizza. I have never in my life had better gnocchi. The texture was PERFECT- light and fluffy, fresh, and so flavorful. The sauce went with it perfectly. The pizza was also out of this world! My kiddo loved it and we each had a slice as well. Our server, Antonio, was attentive, friendly, and made helpful suggestions. We shared a half carafe of the house red and it was very nice as well. Outside seating was a bit loud due to street traffic but it was nice. I looked inside and I really liked the layout of the open kitchen. Very cool place, super delicious food.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
The Caesar salad was made with iceberg lettuce, please! 

The carbonara was soupy. 

The pomodoro sauce was homemade and awesome. 

Gear service and atmosphere though. Loved the big tables.
author: Dann V.

description: This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city. The service is great, the food's amazing, and the deserts are delicious. I love that we can sit outside on nice days and enjoy the beautiful city. Molto bene
author: Cherry W.

description: Great place to enjoy some of North Beach's Italian.  We scouted Yelp and bounced options for which long-lined Pizza place could offer a nice authentic meal.  We finally saw Piazza Pellegrini, which was nearly packed.  I asked a waiter if they could fit us in and we were immediately given a nice heated  patio table.  Food and wine were very good and reasonably priced.  Highly recommend!
author: Andrew W.

description:
BEWARE OF THIS PLACE!! 

The waiter was nice the entire evening. But, his true colors came clear end of the night. He tried to getting away with NOT giving me an itemized receipt. When I asked for it, he's kinda panicked. The total was incorrect and not in my favor.  The food was decent; yes. Could it had been a mistake?  He said he confused the tables.  Yet-when I asked him for the cancelled over charge credit, he said he modified the only receipt.  There was no other confused receipt. I looked at my credit card statement and sure enough. The over charge was still there. He'll try to pull one over on you. You've been warned.  It a shame when one person shines a bad light a nice place. BTW, i didn't get his me name, but he wore thick black framed glasses.
author: David F.

description:
Girlfriend and I got a table outside for dinner because the weather was nice and the sun was still out!

We ordered the Spinach Pesto Ravioli ($17.95) as our appetizer and the Conchile Brocoli ($18.95) and the Fettuccine Gambe ($19.95) for our entrees. Our two entrees were very good. Full of flavor and the pasta was cooked perfectly. What I really wanted to rave about me was their pesto ravioli! IT WAS SO GOOD, best ravioli I have ever had. I am a big fan of pesto sauce, and the pesto sauce on top of their ravioli was absolutely fresh and delicious. none-of-that-premade-stuff.  The waiter told me they make their raviolis fresh in house as well!

I loved their service. The head waiter was very welcoming and made sure we were comfortable throughout our meal. We had a glass jar of water brought to our table, so that we could self-serve ourselves during the meal. The assistant waiter sometimes would come over and refill our water glasses himself. Our pesto ravioli order was a serving of six raviolis. I liked that the waiter took the initiative to divide up our order into two separate smaller plates, before he brought them to our table. 

Prices were little expensive for the food. But the food was fresh and the atmosphere was a knockout, so it made the price justifiable! I can't wait to come back and try their lobster and dungeness crab ravioli with aurora sauce!
author: Philip M.

description: Pretty good place to eat atmosphere is warm and inspiring music playing to relax you while you eat. Will definitely come again when in the bay area. Lovely decor and great staff.
author: Joey S.

description: Update review:  ouch. How unfortunate. After many, many years of coming here, I wrote a review just 22 days before my birthday about how amazing this place is and my plans of dinning there on my birthday....On my birthday we went there, and I started this review right after, but never finished it, so here it is about a year and a half later and I'm still not over it....THE FOOD WAS STILL AMAZING and most of the staff was great. We had a server, whom we had not ever seen before. He told us he was French, when I asked for some bubbly to celebrate my birthday with my mom and tried to school me on the origins of champagne (which I'm quite familiar with) explaining to us that this is an Italian restaurant not a French one so they don't have champagne. So I brushed it off and corrected myself, asking for sparkling wine instead.... He continued to act like an ass and was rude and aggressive to the point that we had to ask for another server and I actually CRIED out of frustration. After which, the service was wonderful as usually, if not better. However, the French server continued to walk around us and make weird comments under his breath, throw things around while cleaning up tables, and just stand there staring at us. Our new server and the rest of the staff apologized to us many times and tried to make us feel better... Unfortunately I have not been back here since then, one bad experience really messes things up. I used to come to this restaurant every single time I visited San Francisco, which is like every month. I hope he's not there anymore, and I hope the food is still amazing...
author: Julia A.

description:
This is a quaint restaurant located in the North Beach area of San Francisco. The menu has a variety of items. I ordered the eggplant polenta appetizer. It was amazing!!! I also ordered the pellegrini salad. It was good but the items in the salad were cut in huge pieces making it difficult to eat. I ordered the gnocchi for my entree. It was really good. Perfectly flavored.

They also have outdoor seating which is perfect on a nice day. 

The service was was excellent and they were extremely attentive. 

This would be a cute date place. 

Certain items are a little pricey but it's San Francisco!!!
author: Laurina S.

description: Loved this place! I took my family who were visiting from out of town, and they said it was their favorite meal. I highly suggest the Gnocchi and the Fritto misto de pesce (fried calamari & shrimp).
author: Jenny H.

description:
Had the seafood pasta and bottle of red wine, was/is lip-freakin'-smackin' good. Will return again and highly recommend. If ya want to see the short foodie film of Piazza Pellegrini - click below. ty ben

https://vimeo.com/214571584
author: BenYamann S.

description:
Overall,  this restaurant is just so so.

The Fettuccini All Amartriciana was supposed to have onion, Pancetta and in parenthesis a 2009 award winning boss's meatballs.   I did not taste any Pancetta, the meatballs was really not very good.  We left two meatballs on the plate,  and the pasta was too soft, like the noodles in the chicken noodle soup.

We also ordered the marguerite pizza.  That was okay.
author: Doris A.

description: This is my favorite place to fulfill my pasta cravings, the consistency of the food and the wonderful staff always have me coming back. It's also a great spot to people watch in north beach!
author: Shaikha A.

description: Awesome sourdough bread and yummy pizza! Just walking by and looked like a good local spot near Fishermans Wharf
author: Jenny T.

description:
Stopped on our way home from fisherman's wharf. Not dressed for dinner but that wasn't a problem. We were seated straight away and giving bread with olive oil and really nice balsamic vinegar. I ordered the seafood pasta and my other half had the meatballs in smoked Pancetta sauce. We asked for extra bread which was no problem and I also asked could I have some olives to pick also not a problem. Only $3.50 for the olives and I got a huge bowl. Our pastas were really very good my only negative is that I only got one prawn in mine. Plenty of mussels clams and some fresh light fish but only one prawn. His was just as good but very filling he couldn't finish it. Bill came to $85 including a bottle of house wine.
Staff very friendly but not in your face like a lot of places around here.
author: Meaghan H.

description:
Great place ask for Antonio. 
Had such a great experience, Antonio made the experience great with his  friendliness and hard work. The beer was great the food was great. If you can try to eat out doors when it's great weather it will be well worth it. I will come back soon
author: Matt E.

description: We got off a tour bus and there it was. Italian and fresh seafood, made everyone in our party happy. It wasn't busy, we were seated promptly. Bread was good, love the olive oil/balsamic... we ordered the fettuccini, carbonara, lasagna, and de mare seafood platter. Everyone was happy wi their food. The portions are big. I got a half order and it was perfect. Others left behind a lot of their full orders. A bit pricey but we felt it was worth it.
author: Cheryl K.

description: We were a very large group, it was lightly raining.  These guys are awesome.  The service was great the food too.  It is a small, traditional restaurant.  The pizza, pasta, excellent we thought.  The waiter suggested we try some flavored "hot" olive oil, it too was a treat and yum!   Everyone enjoyed.
author: Robert B.

description: A friend and I walked in here on a whim the first time I visited North Beach. I fell in love. Classic but varied Italian fare in a cafe atmosphere. The staff makes you feel like you are at home. This restaurant is certainly under-appreciated in the area.
author: 0 R.

description: What a great find!!  A friend recommended this to us, and she was spot on; it was wonderful.  I had the squash ravioli (YUM!!!) and my husband had meat ravioli (also YUM!!!).  Place was packed, so we ate at the bar; had some delightful conversations with diners waiting for tables.
author: Louise K.

description: My friend and I came here after our concert was postponed. We drove up from SJ so thought we might as wel enjoy dinner in the city while we're at it. As we walked up a young man greeted us. We weren't sure we wanted to eat there but looking at the menu we were sold. I love lasagne and the outdoor seating reminded me of Italy. We sat in the front as we peoole watched and we were quickly served our bread and drinks. The food came out a bit later. It was fresh and delicious. My friend ordered a pasta dish with chicken, he enjoyed it a lot.The serving sizes are generous and the food was tasty! Our server was great too, very attentive by coming by often to refill our water or bread. I enjoy finding hidden gems like this especially Italian food. I would recommend!
author: Evangelina B.

description:
Can't speak for all the food, but pre-fab pizza dough = no reason to return.
Eaten and made enough to know pre-fab.
author: Jason L.

description: Pizza was mediocre at best. Tasted undercooked and arrived somewhat cold. Would not try again.
author: Lydia N.

description: One of my favorite places when I go to san Francisco. Their caprese and chappino is out of the world.
author: Teri C.

description:
Wandering around San Francisco after a very long day of travel, we happened upon this little joint right across from Washington Square park.  The sidewalk tables with warmers beckoned and we sat down to people watch and enjoy some good food. Both were awesome!

This was the best italian food I've had outside of Italy.  Minestrone was simple and delicious, pizza was crispy with very light crust, and we ordered a gnocchi special with lamb ragu that was out of this world.  House wine was great, and they had Peroni on draft.  

Great meal, great service and a relaxing spot to lounge and watch the people of San Francisco go by.  Thoroughly enjoyable.
author: Jen A.

description: First of all they told us it was a 15 minutes wait, then had us wait for an hour. Then we went in. It took about another hour for our food to come out. The bread was cold, and came out at the same time as our food(?). The bathroom was dirty, with the trash cans overflowing onto the floor. Also the silverware and napkins were dirty so we had to keep returning them. I ordered the squash ravioli (for nearly twenty dollars). When it came out, there were 5 raviolis on my plate. They were bland and flavorless. The squash ravioli from Trader Joes is better. Overall a disappointing experience, I do not recommend this restaurant.
author: Madison W.

description:
This is my favorite neighborhood Italian restaurant! The ambiance is excellent, the energy is high, and the servers are friendly and quick to your attention. I'd recommend making a reservation if you plan to go Thursday - Sunday night as they fill up quickly.

You'll love any dish you order, but here's some of my favorites:
- Salsicce e Funghi Pizza
- Spaghetti ai Frutti di Mare
- Gnocchi

A lot of the dishes are large enough to share with another person. Though if you want to try more than one thing, you'll have extras for leftovers :)
author: Emmy Q.

description:
Oh no no no.

I have to say that if you like good food, & you don't like wasting time or money, you should definitely not dine here.

After going to the Sunday matinee of Beach Blanket Babylon (which is fabulous & everyone should see), we made the unfortunate decision to eat here.  Actually, when I say we, it was really him, because he loves rabbit & they (allegedly) sometimes have rabbit on the menu.  Since I happen to love the guy, I acquiesced.  Let the man eat rabbit.

When the waiter informed us they did not have rabbit on this day, we should have hightailed it out of there.  But that's not our style.  After we've been seated & perused the menu, it's not right to get up & leave, right?  It's a matter of principle.  So I thought then.

The result?
We had a painfully mediocre meal, though our principles were in tact.

I don't think it was worth it.

No, I KNOW it wasn't.  If you did not have a table reserved, & you've perused the menu, & the server informs you they do not have the dish you were anticipating, it's perfectly reasonable to, politely, get up & go elsewhere. 

The sad details...

He went w the veal scallopini.
I went w pork piccata.

Both were beyond bland.  My piccata "sauce" was not dreamy, lemony, buttery lusciousness, but instead thick & tasted like it came out of a can.  

Our server was painfully slow.  

While the restaurant was almost empty.  There were only 2 other people.

We left full of restaurant regret.

1 star.
author: Veronica M.

description: After exploring the Bay area the entire day, we(a group of 8 ppl) stumbled upon this restuarant in the evening. The food was good. The service was excellent. I am a vegetarian and ordered a dish with meat by mistake. They happily took it back and brought out a complimentary veggie dish for me. Also, the veggie pizza we ordered was great!
author: Prerak P.

description:
Not a bad little place in the North Beach area - if the truth be known we were looking for somewhere quick, cheap and outside to take a load off after a busy day at work and this place ticked a lot of boxes. 

With amazing views across from the church and close to Columbus ave, we perched outside on a table and got settled in with a local bottle of fine Sauvignon Blanc while perusing the menu. There were some great looking pizza's but my friend and myself both went for pasta and with him having the lasagne and me taking on the lobster ravioli. 

The ravioli was ok but I've had much better and the sauce became a bit boring with it swimming in it. Personally I'd have preferred more pasta and less sauce but that's personal.

Service was a bit slow and their heat lamp outside didn't need to be on at all as it was a lovely summer night - saying that, we may have just found that from being weather battered Europeans, maybe this was a cold night for SF!
author: Jonny Q.

description:
This place is really good for its pastas and ambiance along with some people watching! If you can et a window seat or sit outside, it's a great place. Service is good, response time is good as well as wait time for the food.

We have tried the pastas which are made to perfection. From the sauces, to the perfectly cooked pastas, and all the fixings that come with them, the pastas never disappoint. 

The reason for no 5 stars is the pizza. It's bland and too crispy at best. They're consistent on these errors with their pizzas as well. Avoid the pizza, order anything else and you will be delighted.
author: Blake C.

description:
I've been joining friends on Friday nights at this restaurant. The foods are excellent
And their menu is very complete. They have excellent waiters who are strictly old school. It's very much like going to the best restaurant in Rome. The Owner, Dario is always present and there's sort of a dignified quality to the place. In any event,
It's well worth a visit as the foods are well prepared.
author: Alexander M.

description:
With so many 4 and 5-star reviews for this restaurant, I was disappointed by the experience we had.  There were three of us and we showed up around 2:30 in the afternoon, not a busy time.  We were promptly seated and given water and bread with butter by the hostess and thought this would be indicative of the rest of the visit.  Sadly, no.   

What bothered all of us about this restaurant was that we saw three tables of visitors who came in after us get their orders before us.  In fact, one of them was finished by the time we were able to get the server's attention and ask where our food was.  He came back with the explanation that our original server had "disappeared" and he was sorry and we would be getting our food in about seven minutes.  In other words, we were forgotten.  

When the server brought us our bill, we asked to receive a discount for the poor service we received.  We were politely told "no".  So, for the first time since I have been going to restaurants, we left no tip.  It didn't feel good, but neither did our experience.
author: Glenda P.

description:
I live a block away and brought a group of friends to try Piazza Pellegrini.  We got to sit outside, we ordered clams and mussels to start, it was a good dish.  The bolognese fettuccine was pretty good too.  Service was decent in terms of timing, checking up on us to see if we needed anything.  

The waiter wanted us to try a couple of wines, I asked to see the label and he refused to show it.  I asked a couple of times and he made a point not to respond.  He was strange and made dinner uncomfortable.  It wasn't nice having a potential conflict during dinner.  

After the waiter, I'm sure I won't go back.  Shame since it's an easy place to bring a group and I have visitors pretty often.
author: Eve H.

description: I had dinner here on a busy Monday night with a group of friends. We were given a table right away but within seconds of looking at the menu our server started hounding us to order. He came back to our table every 30 seconds to see if we were ready to order, so we finally ordered appetizers under pressure. We asked for bread more than 3 times, were ignored each time. For dinner we ordered the smoked salmon pizza, fried calamari, onion soup (soup of the day ) which were all delicious. We also got a prima vera pizza which was bland. They serve a delicious house made balsamic vinegar. Had it not been for the poor service they probably would've gotten a better rating from me.
author: Reema B.

description: Very good resturaunt !!!!!! Goodish food , !!!! The ICECREAM taste like hazelnut !!!  You get seated extremely quick !!! The waiters are Italian and if your not vey understanding of accents maybe it would be difficult for you , over all it's very very nice , just not my favorite . The bathroom is beutiful ! The water is clean BEST WATER  EVER TASTE SO GOOD !!!!!!!!!!!! SALT AND PEPPER SO FINE , BEST FOOD EVER
author: Lucy C.

description:
A friend, acting as an intermediary, recently texted asking for recommendations on where to dine in North Beach, two nights from now, on a Saturday.  While in the midst of trying to pull that rabbit from my hat she informed me that a reservation had just been made and I groaned a little to learn where we'd be meeting:  Piazza Pellegrini, a place I've passed by hundreds of times without once thinking of stopping.  

With its red awning, quaint outdoor seats and Columbus fronting location, it's fair to categorize Piazza Pellegrini as a red-sauce Italian tourist trap.  Locals don't much dine here as confirmed by the dearth of Bay Area yelp friends who've reviewed the place.  

But then...

The last time I tried to park for free in North Beach on a Saturday night I wound up parking on Lombard, west of Franklin and if you just said "that's not in North Beach" you're exactly right.  Neither was a parking spot.  Shortly after being alerted to where I'd be dining another text came through:  "complimentary parking behind the restaurant, on Filbert".  

I arrived half disbelieving the offer of free parking but there it was:  A small unmanned lot with a handful of spaces reserved for patrons.  The Golden Unicorn.  

Dinner for four here (4 glasses of house wine, fried calamari appetizer, 2 pizzas, gnocchi, eggplant parmesan, and free parking) ran $30 apiece including tip.  The food was decent, the value superb.  We all walked out with doggie bags.  

At the end of our meal and desiring a nightcap elsewhere we briefly discussed moving our cars to the pay parking lot (next door on Filbert), asking our waiter if it'd be okay to leave the cars, and leaving the cars but saying nothing.  Risking the final option we returned a couple hours later relieved to find our cars right where we'd left them.  

If you're looking for ease of parking rather than evidence of your foodie pedigree Piazza Pellegrini is a worthy choice.  That they're not policing your post-meal whereabouts is a bonus, but let's just keep that little secret between you and me.
author: Tracey A.

description: Nice atmosphere, but very mediocre food. I was surprised because it seems like they make everything from scratch. They definitely need to amp up their sauce recipes. Every person at my table (6 people) said that their food was incredibly bland. The marinara with EXTRA parmesan on top is tolerable. That's about it.
author: E S.

description: This place was one of the highlights of our Spring Break trip to SF. We had a party of six, including two tween kids. I had made a reservation so we didn't have any problems getting seated and our table was ready when we arrived. The service was EXCELLENT! The waiter was friendly and accommodating. One of the kids had food allergies and he even went as far as bringing the ingredient label of the bread out for the parent to read and make sure there were no allergens. The food was exceptionally tasty. I had the Risotto Fruiti Di Mare and it was heavenly! It was cooked perfectly and had a generous amount of mussels, clams, and salmon. My husband was talking about his Osso Bucco days afterwards. The location was convenient and in North Beach, as I wanted. It's a place we'll be going back to when visiting the city again for sure!
author: AP C.

description:
My family and I weren't looking for a specific place, just Italian, and we decided to pop by this place. The outside tables were full and so were the inside table near the window. Ultimately my mom chose this place after seeing the spinach raviolis.

Our server was very upbeat and entertaining. He had a cool accent too. He always tended to our requests as soon as he could.

We ordered the mushroom palenta, and it was absolutely delicious! I could not get enough, slightly sweet sauce but creamy and just amazing.

Then for mains we ordered:
- spinach ravioli with pesto
- gnocchi
- lamb shank
- sausage and mushroom

I took a (more like several) bites of each and I was glad I did. I don't usually eat pesto outside of my family's kitchen because my nonno's recipe is the best I've tasted. But this one passed my test! The pizza was very good also. Our server gave us this sort of spicy olive oil and according to my brother and dad, it was very yummy. The gnocchi was amazing. The lamb shank was seriously tender and the sauce paired with the palenta was brilliant. 

Lastly, I had just a sip of the wines. The moscato was like alcoholic apple juice but even better. And there was another one I can't remember the name, but it was fruity and soft. I loved both! Overall, it was a great experience.
author: Kacey A.

description:
OMG We absolutely love the food at this place, it's super authentic, very flavorful, great atmosphere, and people are genuine.
My wife and I have every time we visit San Francisco and I feel like it's become a tradition. It's now one of the Staples for San Francisco when we are in town! Please try the lasagna and the penne pasta.
author: George A.

description: This was out first visit to Piazza Pellegrini, and we liked the food. We had the Penne all´ Arrabbiata with Italian sausage and the pepperoni pizza, with the house chianti and sprite. The place has a roadside cafe feel to it, with lots of indoor and outdoor tables with a view of the street. The waiter was friendly and attentive. We look forward to returning to this place to explore other items on the menu.
author: Bali P.

description:
Best Italian food I've had in San Francisco, the Osso Bucco is to die for. 

We came here with a group of 8 guys on a bachelor weekend at the recommendation of one of the guys in the group who frequents this place with his wife. 

Best food we had all weekend and even outdid our dinner the previous night at Ruth's Chris at a fraction of the price. 

The service was excellent - we were served by all friendly and attentive Italian natives. 

The appetizers were excellent, particularly the Antipasti Italiano, which offered a spread of delicious sliced meats, grilled veggies and delectably fresh and flavorful mozzarella. 

I got to taste a number of the other guys dishes, but the hands down winner was my Osso Bucco (lamb shank not veal here). The meat was beyond fall off the bone tender, and the marinade was sublime. The polenta is came with was rich and creamy yet light, and the vegetables had soaked up all that sublime marinade. Every bite was heaven. 

We sat outside and the ambiance was beautiful on a gorgeous sunny day with a late sunset, and the people watching was great. 

If you're ever in the area, give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.
author: John R.

description: If you have eaten here it is a must. The service is the best and food is off the hook. Not a chain restaurant privately owned and you can tell
author: Tj L.

description:
This is a quintessential Italian restaurant. Its' quaint, adorable, and located directly across from washington square park - great people watching for the sidewalk diners! They have a hand-written daily menu with the Chef's specials. The staff is extra friendly and accommodating. We dined here with 2 toddlers and they made things easy by storing our stroller and bringing the kids their own little spaghetti plates with just 1 meatball each :)

Not only is this place cute, but the kitchen surprised me with a particularly daring dish - the lamb ragu over gnocchi. I certainly wasn't expecting something so creative and delicious, but WOW, that was an outstanding flavor combination. The richness of the lamb with the sweet sauce was a perfect balance and their gnocchi had the perfect consistency - chewy and melty without being gummy.. Color me impressed!!

Had to deduct 1 star because my wine was just off, I ordered a glass of Chianti, but it tasted more like a table jug wine of some sort and I was charged $12.99 for it!!! I mean, if I call out my wine, fine I will pay a lot for it, but at $12.99 a glass, I should see a bottle at the very least. Their food is amazing, but somethin' up with dat wine tho ...
author: Colleen J.

description: North Beach is a wonderful Italian enclave. In the North East such communities are very common, no so out West, one has to search for the rich cuisine of the Italian culture. Pizza Pellegrini has that charming traditional Italian look and feel. The decor is charming and the service fantastic. This alone gets three stars, but the food, o my simply amazing. the Spaghetti and Meatballs are so full of flavor, the sauce is perfect the meatballs absolutely delicious. A sure hit.
author: Jimmy L.

description: Chicken Parm had a huge bone left in the chicken. Waitress claimed this was normal. Bread was stale. Fettuccine alfredo LACKED FLAVOR
author: Victoria T.

description:
We sat outside because of the dog. It was noisy with traffic, but thank goodness for the heat lamps! You never know about the weather in the city...cool - cold - warm. 

We ordered the margarita pizza for our appetizer and skipped the salads. We were very happy with that as it came out quick and was tasty. He had the pasta putanesca which he enjoyed. I had the pasta carbornara. Meh. It was fair. It was a little on the runny side plus it was room temperature (not hot) so I'm guessing my dish sat for a bit. Boo.  And IDK if this is related, but I had the poops when I got home. Double boo. 

There was a guy (maybe the owner) who wasn't dressed as a waiter that offered to bring my dog a bowl of water. How nice/cool. 

Observation: the waiters were not wiping tables down after clearing off the dishes. I sat there and watched them do it over and over outside.
author: San D.

description: Tried this place today as my regular haunt burned up.  The ambiance is fine.  Waiter was helpful and attentive, altho we were the only people there at noon. The gorgonzola gnocci and zuchinini soup were delicious, as was the garlic bread.  I noticed later...when more customers arrived...that they received a basket of bread.  Hmmmm....something I'll have to look into.  Overall pleasant experience.  The prices are HIGH but the portions are generous.
author: Susan V.

description: This is a pretty good Italian restaurant in North Beach. Service is great, I really liked my waiter. I also really loved the balsamic vinegar they used.
author: Peter K.

description:
Service: Rude. I can't comment on the food or the wine.

I went there this past Saturday with my friend around 6p and told the wait staff that we wanted to sit outside and have drinks. They went ahead and seated us at one of the many empty tables outside.

A few minutes later the waiter/maitre'd came by and asked us what we wanted to drink. I asked what kind of wine was the house white. He rudely said "white," so I asked again. Once again a rude non-response. Finally the third time he said that it was pinot grigio. We went ahead and ordered the half-carafe.

Then he came by and asked what we wanted for dinner. I said that we were there for a glass of wine only, as I told the person who seated us. He informed us that the tables were only for dinner and rudely told us to leave. Mind you there were several empty tables around us, they are the ones who seated us, and they had already taken our wine order.

Perhaps if he asked nicely, I wouldn't have been so annoyed. I've lived in North Beach for 15 years, this type of service is NOT common for the neighborhood. Please don't let this place ruin your impression of N.Beach. Pellegrini failed on so many levels that day.
author: Mukul K.

description: Very bad service! Upon arrival we were greeted very coldly by our waiter. We were not given any water until our main meal arrived and the bread we were given was stale. After we paid the waiter had the cheek to tell us to move to the bar because he had a line of but 6 people waiting outside!Definitely a place not worth going to!
author: Nr R.

description: Excellent gnocchi's, truly homemade. I also enjoyed the side of meatballs. The minestrone soup was OK, although I've had better. However, I'll go back for the gnocchi's!! Server was also very attentive and helpful.
author: William D.

description: Terrible. Made a "reservation" only to arrive and have the hostess tell us they don't accept reservations on a Saturday (although I had an email confirmation and two text messages telling us our reservation was confirmed.) The hostess seated us at an outdoor table and told us we would have a 30 minute wait for a table. We asked to speak to the manager and the hostess would not get him for us. Luckily our waitress at our outdoor table stepped up and got us a table immediately when we told her what happened. Why the hostess couldn't do this, who knows. Once we were seated at a table the experience was better. Although I'm pretty sure the "fusilli" I had was straight out of a box. I would absolutely not recommend this restaurant.
author: Kim S.

description:
It must be one of their off nights as I see some people really like this place. When my friend's meat raviolis arrived,  the presentation was so horrible that it looked like someone just dumped a can of Chef Boyardee on the big plate, and could care less about how it looked. One of the stuffing had fallen out of ravioli, swimming in the most unappetizing looking meat sauce. How is that acceptable in any restaurant I do not know. I would have sent it back but my friend was hungry and didn't want to wait any longer. As for me, I ordered a shrimp appetizer and the whole thing was so salty that I couldn't finish. The only thing that was decent that night was the wait staff was very pleasant. It was his fault that the food was horrific so we still tipped accordingly.

It's amazing to see such drastic differences in reviews here. Consistency is the key to a successful restaurant. But I suppose being in a tourist filled area, they do just fine. But there are many North Beach restaurants that the locals go to. I personally have been to quite a few of them and they were excellent. I regret to say this was one of the worse Italian food experience I have had. With so many good choices within the area, I won't be back to give them another try.
author: Teahuis H.

description: We have been to Piazza Pellegrini every time we are in the city.  The food is great and the environment is incredible. It is like eating at a cafe in Italy!  Wonderful service and reasonable to boot.  We LOVE it!
author: James M.

description:
I'm Italian. And I swear to god this is by the worst place I've been. Price are damn high and food is not good at all. 1 water bottle costs 8$. The cheapest dish around 30$. 

Last but not least, when the waitress noticed I left only 15% tips he run out the restaurant.

P.S.We paid also the bread they served at the table. 5$. Ridiculous.
author: Leonardo F.

description:
It was raining so we picked a place in a hurry.  Lousy choice!

Prices seemed high even for North Beach.  Later we realized how ridiculously priced those $30 entrees really were!

The service was friendly and genuinely nice.

But it was the worst Italian food we've had anywhere!

First, the bread was partly stale and certainly a day old.

Second, the Caesar Salad was prepared no effort and had forgettable dressing.  We asked for extra anchovies, but they were low quality, unpleasantly salty, and from a can.  The lettuce was fresh, so score there!

Third, the shrimp was so salty that it was almost inedible.  (The waiter later agreed and gave us 50% off the shrimp entree.)  The shrimp seemed good quality, so why they marinated it in a saline solution overnight is a mystery.

Finally, and worst of all was the meat ravioli.  It was an unsightly mess of red sauce poured haphazardly over ravioli that had no redeeming qualities.  The cheese was dry and chalky, the pasta was so overdone the meat and cheese stuffing was falling out.  It was as if an untrained pre-teen was put in the kitchen to prepare a food that he had never tasted.

Funny thing is, it is really easy to find great or good Italian food in any neighborhood in major cities.  Since these are nice people, I hope they hire some quality supervision in the kitchen.
author: Edvard N.

description: Since I moved here a year ago I've came to Piazza Pellegrini a handful of times already, mainly because my family and I agree on how delicious the food is here! The service is great and the outdoor seating is icing on the cake on a sunny North Beach day. Definitely will continue to come back when I am craving good Italian cuisine.
author: Leonora H.

description: Stopped in with a few friends while touring North Beach. The antipasto was fantastic! So was the spaghetti and meatballs and the eggplant parm. Next time I'm in San Francisco I'll stop in again.
author: M B.

description: Was threatened by an employee when I asked for tap water. One of the worst establishments I've ever been to.
author: Raj S.

description: Stopped in and got a table for one along the street. Ordered a glass of wine, it was really good! I order the fuscilli with chicken and tomato sauce and it was pretty crappy. For the price, it was a really good portion, but it was just so basic. I can cook something at home way better and way cheaper. Then they tried to charge me $2 more for my glass of wine than the menu listed it. Was really disappointed to have wasted a meal at this place.
author: Lauren F.

description:
My husband and I have enjoyed eating here in the past (although truth be told, it has been a while) and we were in the neighborhood so we thought we would give it a try last night. We were fully expecting a wait given all of the events going on in the neighborhood and we were more than willing to wait for a table. (Within reason, of course, since we had our 3 year old daughter with us.) 

As expected, the restaurant looked busy when we walked up. My husband approached the host who was standing out front and asked if there was a wait. He wouldn't even let my husband approach. He rudely pointed at the curb and barked, "wait there." We both thought it was rude but we gave him the benefit of the doubt since we could tell he was really busy. We stood there for few minutes and the host eventually came back and told us it would be a 20 minute wait for a table. That seemed reasonable given how busy everything was so we agreed to wait. This is where it gets ridiculous. I asked the host if it was possible for me to use the restroom while we waited, and he told me that I should go and use the public restrooms in the park across the street. At that point, we turned and walked away. I'm glad we did, because we ended up having an amazing meal at a place down the street. 

Looks like  we were not the only ones to notice the rudeness because someone else just posted about it. (I'm wondering if that person witnessed what happened to us...)

There is no excuse for piss poor customer service, especially when neighboring restaurants have better food and friendly service! We will never return to Piazza Pellegrini again and we will tell everyone we know to avoid it too.
author: Darcy S.

description: Best Italian resturant ever if you want to experience a real Italian resturant you must visit this resturant I recommended to friends and family.
author: Kamyar J.

description: Absolutely amazing the muscles, the squash ravioli, tortellini and broccoli chicken fettuccine amazing great wine selection of wines were excellent. Waitstaff top-notch will be back
author: Robin F.

description: If you are not white they will ignore you and take forever and give you poor service. Truth.
author: Cristela R.

description: I drove by and saw much table traffic within, so I figured it must be a very good place. And it was. The prices and food portion was about right. The service was decent. The atmosphere was nice. Everything was good, but for some reason I could not justify it as 5 stars. I would come back again and recommend it to others.
author: Ed G.

description:
We ordered on Uber Eats. The gnocchi tasted like cold tater tots and the lasagna even worse. Two stars because the garlic bread was okay, but also a bit weird tasting. 

Quick delivery though! Under 30 minutes.
author: Pete W.

description:
It's really hard to review Italian restaurants in north beach because they all have the same price range and I havnt tried many other places. We decided to try this place because of the cute little patio outside and the decor was nice.

Sat down and was promptly given complementary bread with balsamic vinegar/olive oil. Wish the bread was a little warmer and that the dip was given on a shallower dish so we didn't get only oil and then only balsamic.

Menu is extensive with appetizers being $14.95 and pastas ranging from $18.95-$24.95. I decided on the pappardelle with the short rib ragu because I am a sucker for fresh made pappardelle noodles. The dish was $19.95 and was surprisingly a good portion size! I never eat Italian food out usually because I feel like portions are small and prices are high. I was really full after the meal and the ragu was flavorful and you can tell it had stewed for a long time. My only small criticism is that I wish the noodles were slightly slightly thinner.

My friends ordered the carbonara and the seafood linguine. They enjoyed the food a lot. I thought the carbonara was a little flavorless in terms of it just being heavy with cream and truffle oil. It didn't have enough of the pancetta flavor

Overall, amazing food and experience. Service was excellent - very fast, efficient, friendly. Also told is exactly what would go well with each of our pasta dishes. Loved this place :) if you ever wanna splurge (a little) on a dinner come here!
author: Isabella L.

description:
I love the vibe of North Beach. Sure, nearly everything is a tourist trap -- but there's something special about all those tourists walking down Columbus looking so happy.

The first thing that you'll notice about Pellegrini is the friendly staff, who are either all from Italy themselves, or part of the hiring process is imitating an Italian accent. 

Each time I've come here they've been slow, giving it an almost romantic vibe as long as you don't notice the TV quietly playing at the back bar. 

I'm a big fan of the bruschetta and the gnocchi, as well as the cheap Italian wine and complimentary focaccia. The pizza is fine, but Tony's or Calzones are better alternatives.

Pellegrini is a good place to rest your legs, drink wine, and rationalize that those pesky Parrots of Telegraph Hill just *aren't* out this time of year.
author: William M.

description: Situated near the financial district, this restaurant looks to be a great place to find pasta dishes with fresh seafood from nearby Fisherman's Wharf.  Not so much. The decor is old. OK. Let's give it the benefit of any doubt and say that it has "charming" ambience. The service was rushed. It was crowded, sure.  But, when the service doesn't accommodate the number of patrons, well that's the restaurant's decision to sacrifice service for profit.  Not good.  I order the seafood pasta di mare.  Not much taste to the sauce in a dish that was very skimpy on the pasta.  Pasta is the least expensive element in this dish and the restaurant portion controls the pasta.  THE PASTA.  My goodness.  I compare this restaurant to Tadich, where you want to slurp the sauce because it's that good.  Here, you just feel confused as to why the chef could have such lack of love for cooking Italian dishes. The prices for these dishes are comparable to the better restaurants in the area.  Please skip this joint. The owners want your hard earned cash for cheap, not your respect.
author: Anthony K.

description:
Wow! Definitely a 5 star establishment. We sat outside and enjoyed the local traffic walking and driving past. 
The food was really nice - super impressed with everything we ordered!
Pizza base deserves special mention - nice'n'thin crust but thick enough to not flop when you hold it out to eat it. Service deserves extra special mention and made the night much more enjoyable. Server / Maitre D very friendly and works hard to make sure you're all set for a great meal. 
Can't wait until I can come back again.....
author: Andrew S.

description: Everything was excellent! Highly recommend this place. Their wines, pastas, bread, and even their olive oil tasted extremely fresh and hand crafted. DELISH
author: Samantha M.

description:
Came in after a night at Cobb's Comedy Club, party of 4.  I'm always skeptical of Italian restaurants because there are so many and it's mostly just generic, I've-tasted-this-a-million-times-before kinda food.  Not this place.  All 4 of us enjoyed our meals immensely (even one vegan dish, made with no butter).  I had the Fettuccine All Amatriciana and it was fucking delicious.  Don't know what the others had but they had only words of praise for their dishes.  Every member of the staff was very courteous and friendly.  

I'm going to make coming here a post-comedy club tradition.  Thanks Piazza Pellegrini!!!
author: jay j.

description: Good outdoor seating .. 3 stars for accepting Amex and other credit cards .. nasty fermented tasting latte . Umm sorry no taste for fermented coffee .. will stick to starbux
author: Feedback M.

description:
My family and I dined here on June 18th. The service was poor and unprofessional. Our waiter, DOMENICO, was not attentive at all; he did not seem to care as we were literally just sitting there - waiting so long. I swear, I could've taken a walk up the street to Saints Peter & Paul church - walked in, said two prayers; one to speed up the service at Pellegrini and the other to forgive me for my unspoken thoughts floating around in my head as we sat there waiting and waiting.  I mean, it was that bad!  And the hostess... 

Before arriving at the restaurant, we called to ask about parking. Supposedly, we read something about this restaurant offering their very own complimentary parking. Those who know SF, especially North Beach will understand this is very rare. So we wanted to make sure before arriving. This was the short phone conversation: ME: Where is your restaurant parking located? "HOSTESS: "In the restaurant."  ME: Excuse me? I'm asking where to park for the restaurant.  HOSTESS: "Yes, in the restaurant."  No need to carry on any longer with the call. I'm sure you get the picture. And I can assure you... the restaurant is not a drive-thru. 

The food is good. It's not great, but I'd say it's good. We've made it a point to try out a few different restaurants. Now those are great!  But that's a whole different YELP review.  

As always, good luck with your choices out there. North Beach has a good selections of Italian restaurants to choose from; Pellegrini is not the only restaurant in this neighborhood. It's your money so choose wisely.
author: DG B.

description: Unremarkable food. Impressively rude service. Your money is better spent elsewhere. North Beach is full of great Italian spots; this is definitely not one of them.
author: Brendon S.

description:
Went here because my roommates said it was really good. 

Went with some friend and tried the two Ossobuco plates, along with the chicken parm. The Ossobuco plates were both really amazing. The chicken parm was just normal for chicken parm but my friend is dumb for getting it. 

I suggest going here and trying their Ossobuco, it's worth it.
author: Joseph Rebelo R.

description:
Absolutely authentic Italian restaurant. Loved the experience, excellent and attentive staff, food was fantastic (daily specials and menu items).

I went with my wife and 16 and 12 year olds, as well as a set of grandparents. Everyone was raving, not or complaint, and we are not an easy group to deal with when hungry. 

This is not a tourist trap, it is a neighborhood  establishment. The first seating was full house, every table and the decibel level of the place was truly a family affair.
author: Thomas M.

description: The worst service you will ever experience. Food is decent with good sauces but meat items are not fresh and overcooked. When the woman next to me tried to tell the manager that her food was inedible he told her that she would still have to pay even though she only ate 1 ravioli. The staff said he was the manager and that he embarrasses them all of the time, they begged me to write that their service was not at fault and I want to say that the waiters were nice but the manager Dominico insulted a mother in front of her young son. Shameful. I will never eat here again.
author: Gabriel O.
