description: What an amazing dinner I had with my family. The salmon pasta was amazing and the fettuccine de pollo was finger licking. Great wine and awesome service. I would definitely come back again if I lived here. Lastly, the prices are very reasonable and not over priced like others.
author: Anderson C.

description:
Homemade pasta ain't bad but ain't great either.
But in SF this is just dime a dozen. Personally I love mezaluna on clement as my favorite fresh pasta place.

Obviously a tourist trap, real local Italian place at a 1/2 the price elsewhere in SF
Having a seat outside as tourist goes by is really like Rome though.

Tiramisu is much better and like 5 stars
author: David H.

description: In the heart of SF Northbeach is this fine restaurant with authentic food, good service and a casual ambiance. There were 5 of us and it's not easy to get good service and have room to stretch out...but we did. The ravioli was home made and The bruschetta was mouth watering. We all had different pasta and one was better than the next.  The only dish that I didn't like was the pizza. I like thin crust and this was thick and dohey. Some people like it that way.  We will definitely go back.
author: Toni B.

description:
Here for a baby shower I was treated to a several course meal.

To begin, the service throughout the affair was thoughtful, and consistent and while the snack plates were not very large they were quite tasty. The chicken I received was flavored to perfection and the potatoes were fantastic. But the highlight of the afternoon was the spectacular tiramisu and baked ice cream. They were utterly decadent.

The parking next door is helpful as this area tends to not be great for SF drivers but I doubt I'll ever be back unless something else is planned here. It's too far out of the way of my usual stomping grounds.
author: Meg T.

description: As we are playing tourist today in North Beach, we walked past this place. Their billboard outside claimed they have the best pasta and pizza, so we thought of giving it a try. We read that margherita pizza is not great, so we tried their anchovies and tomato pizza. It was unique. Maybe add little bit more anchovies. It wouldn't hurt to put basil on it. We also had their steamed clams and mussels appetizer. It came out good portion for appetizer. Tasty, but a little bit salty. There were about 15-20 clams n mussels. Combination of both dishes we ordered, goes well together. The disappointment was the bread they serve, which was cold. We would like to give it a 3.5, but didn't know how to do that.
author: De W.

description: We really enjoyed this place, the food was great and the service was warm and friendly.  We liked the view of Washington Square across the street.
author: L B.

description: This is the best Italian food I've ever had, sat in the outside patio with heaters overhead, hand made pasta and the best sauce and meatball I've ever had, my husband's food was fantastic too. Also the best gelato I've ever had they make in house apparently, all for cheaper than shitty Olive garden! Loved our waiter too. Worth the wait and money. Can't wait to go back
author: Autumn S.

description:
Average Italian/pizza place in North Beach.

Decent menu with pastas, pizzas and meat/fish selections at average to slightly above average prices for the quality.

Both hubby and I ordered pasta.  I had the broccoli and spicy sausage one which was decent. Pasta was a nice firmness and good blend of flavors. Not too heavy.  Bread service was a mix of regular and focaccia bread.

Service is slower than average and some of the staff are more interested in chatting with each other than in checking in on their customers.

Given the price:quality:service ratios, I'd definitely choose some of the others in the area over this one.
author: Katie F.

description:
Awesome location! I'm not the biggest Italian food fan but this place was very good and so fresh. I think the fact that I left being able to taste each ingredient is great. I emcee up having a rather grab but split it and it was just the right side for lunch. The gnocchi was so delicious and not heavy the marinara sauce was tasty but I almost with wish we splurged on a white sauce! 

Portions are big I think so splitting for lunch was great. My dad had the veal which was so tender and I hate to admit delicious! I do want to go back and try the pizza lots of yummy toppings and combinations.

The bread served right away is not great and better off without!
author: Priya S.

description: Great Place for Brunch. Not to many choices but what they have is So Delicious and big portions. The service was Amazing, made us feel welcomed. outdoor sitting in front of the park was Priceless. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
author: John P.

description: Nausea and vomiting. I asked nicely for a dinner with no onions or bell peppers. There was obviously onion in that carbonara sauce, because I am violently ill. We are locals. We are spreading the word. We were the only patrons you had early tonight. Shame on you.
author: DJ C.

description:
On our last day in San Francisco, we decided to head back to one of our old haunts and have some lunch. Unfortuantely, it was Easter, so there were quite a number of closed restaurants, but we did remember having some good gnocchi here when we lived in the area, so we decided to come back in and have some more.

So we both ordered the gnocchi. We also ordered a bottle of wine and an order of mussels and clams to share to start with. The wine was corked, so they offered us another bottle which was alright, but probably wouldn't have been a bottle we would have chosen. Apparently they were redoing their wine list and only had a small selection of wine available.

The mussels were okay. Some were gritty, and I wasn't really wowed by them. The gnocchi also weren't as good as I remember. I remember more blue cheese flavor. But they were still nice.

All in all, the experience was fine, but my memories are either better than the reality, or things aren't as good as they used to be. Or maybe I've just gotten used to real Italian food, and North Beach isn't the same. I don't know. Either way, the food here is fine, but nothing special.
author: Grant T.

description: Great atmosphere and friendly staff.  Window seating and patio seating looking towards Washington Square.  Enjoy great food and a glass of wine.
author: Chris H.

description: My wife's fav place. . Thanks for the best service and food.. drove down from LA for valentine's just for this. My wife was so happy.... I had the short rib, a must besides the farfalle en vodka sauce
author: Abel B.

description: Came to this place have a lunch! But, truly disappointed and dissatisfied! Food is not good itself and service is bad! Usually, in Italian restaurants they serve bread with olive oil before the meal! Waiter brought after asking them! Waiter did not took out the dishes after eating! I don't want to come to this place anymore and not recommending it for you! You can find other good restaurants in Italian town for the same price!
author: Asel D.

description:
Pros:

- good food. I had the calzone and my girlfriend had a pizza. We also ordered a 1/2 carafe of wine. Everything was fairly good, and the portions were large. 

- good atmosphere. The location (near Washington Square Park) is great. 

Cons:

- horrible service. We had to flag down a waiter in order to have our order taken. The table next to us saturday down later than we did, and had all their needs attended to while the waiter ignored us for 20 minutes. Once we got them, the wine glasses had lipstick on them. Then, we had to ask for the check multiple times. All this while the restaurant was almost completely empty.
author: Zach H.

description:
We had the pizza with cheese, artichokes, prosciutto, olives, and soft boiled egg on top. 
I thought the crust was very average.  It had no chewiness to it and the edges were burnt and tasted like a saltine cracker.  The entire construction felt like a child put it together.  It was clumsy looking, hard to eat and messy.  The flavors were good but the texture was not good.

We also shared their spinach salad that came with candied walnuts, cheese, and bacon bits.  The walnuts were huge and tasty but the bacon tasted old and moldy.

We came here because it was the nicest looking Italian restaurant by the park in North Beach.  We were the only locals there.  

Pizza and salad costed over 30 dollars for lunch.  I think Pizza Moda in Berkeley has much better pizza.

Pros: Friendly service, food was good

Cons: Slow service, dirty knife, food was not excellent
author: Lorissa W.

description: Food was delicious! Hubby had Salmon with Eggplant relish & Potatoes. I had the rich Gnocchi w/Sausage, Asparagus & peas. Yummy!
author: Erika T.

description:
Long story short:

If you want decent food but want to wait foreverrrrrrrrr for service or your food then just don't come.

Granted they were packed, and Esteban (our waiter) was great but it was sooooo slow. The whole experience for our dinner took about 2 hours. Which is insane. 

So there have it. Good food. Kinda expensive. Way too long of a wait.

EDIT: turns out they charged my friend for my meal AND her meal, even though we gave seperate cards on the bill. Yes, she should have checked the amount, but hey, WHAT IS THIS WORLD COMING TO WHERE WE CAN'T TRUST OUR RESTAURANTS???
author: Angie G.

description: Worst restaurant and service in north beach. Don't eat here. They lie about wait times and are out of what you order
author: Alicia R.

description: I went here today during a non busy hour in the afternoon. I ordered a cappuccino and a creme brûlée which were both good but I was overcharged on both ($2 more on the dessert and $1 more on the cappuccino)! Please, please review your check before paying. Unfortunately I checked too late. I'm giving them two stars for their dishonesty and will not be coming here again.
author: Angie G.

description: After a long day of walking around San Francisco, and needing to eat early to get to a Giant game we stumbled upon this place.    We had a great waiter so the service was perfect.  And the food was very very good.    I had the fresh fettuccine with the bolognese and it was perfect and my husband had gnocchi with marinara and he said it was very good.
author: Nicole L.

description: This place is great! Location, food and service was fantastic. I was here for brunch and had the Crespelle di Patata....it was amazing. If your visiting San Francisco or just a local you must eat here. I definitely recommend it and will be coming back.
author: Edgar B.

description:
Service was good, really nice people.
We ordered the pizza. STAY AWAY. Tasted like a cheap microwave pizza. For a 15$ plain margarita pizza it's more the annoying. 2 glasses of white wine were served way too cold and the wine was not good. The pastas looked and smelled really good, but we haven't tried them...
author: Shai Z.

description: Great place to have authentic Italian food! There was excellent service, outstanding balsamic vinegar with the bread, great drink selection and amazing food. I highly recommend going here!
author: Brody K.

description:
Another review where I wish I could give 3.5 stars... 

We sat outside on a pretty chilly afternoon, so thank heavens for the overhead heaters. Our server was pretty absent minded - think we were the only group there at this particular time, but he no doubt wanted to be in the park across the street from his 1,000-yard stare. Regardless, our food was really tasty - the perfect warm carb-loaded gutbomb for a chilly afternoon. Not impressed with their bread at all, though the olive oil was very good. We ordered the lobster ravioli, the gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce, the pasta with prosciutto & peas and a chicken pesto sandwich. ALL of which was very tasty, in my opinion, really no complaints - but somehow I can't say it was the "best I ever had" or anything, although the lobster ravioi was quite delicious as were the gnocchi. I suspect lots of places in North Beach can top it, but it was a pretty tasty lunch overall.
author: Erin F.

description: My family came here for Christmas Dinner... The service was slow, as in it took 15 minutes to get our order. The food was Average at best. Had the caesar salad which was just the basic caesar. And the Veal Parmesan was dry, over cooked and lacked flavor. The veggies and potatoes were boring and bland. Not a Memorable experience and with so many Italian restaurants to choose from this would be the absolute Last.
author: Allie P.

description: Great food, great service, and amazing sidewalk seating! With the huge cathedral down the street, you will think you are in Firenze! Overhead heaters make the experience more comfortable for those who are sensitive to the cold.
author: Mark P.

description: After searching for a place to have dinner for over an hour, we were hungry & frustrated. A friend recommended Piazza Pellegrini and it was just what we were looking for: simple, delicious, non-trendy Italian food. The waiter was attentive and friendly, the dishes were delicious and they were happy to accommodate wheat avoidance. The house wine was sweet and yummy and the meal came quickly! We sat on the sidewalk under a cozy heater and enjoyed the neighborhood!
author: Leslie B.

description: I was craving risotto and salmon but salmon risotto wasn't on the menu, the waiter was nice enough to ask the chef to prepare my special request and it as cooked to perfection. My friend ordered the lasagna and it was one of the best lasagna dishes I've had! Great food and even better service. Can't ask for much more than that!
author: Christy M.

description: This place is a cute hole in the wall. The food is amazing and worth trying. I can tell that the pizza I ordered was hand made. My aunt ordered a pasta and claimed it was delicious. I highly recommend that people try their food. The only issue I had was that they did not have air conditioning and it got too stuffy inside so we asked to sit outside (it was a warm day). I enjoyed my experience and the waiters were great!
author: Nahal N.

description: Best Italian in the city!! Very authentic. Italian family owned. Loved our entire meal. Worth the short 15 min wait
author: Sanda P.

description:
Absolutely awful. Pure tourist trap. I ate there last night and the fettuccini was miserable. The Alfredo sauce was vacant and had no flavor. Everything tasted like it had been cooked three hours previously and was housed under a heat lamp waiting for some poor unfortunate soul to order it. My girlfriend had the gnocchi which was overpowered by an insurmountable amount of sausage. Because when you order gnocchi you really only want to taste sausage. 

I've lived in and around North Beach for eight years and this is the first and last time I'll make it here.
author: KC F.

description: A wonderful Italian dining experience!  Our waiter was extremely attentive.  Our group of six had six different entrées, all were perfect.  They never rushed us, we made an evening of it.  Even though we couldn't finish our meals, we enjoyed the wonderful desserts too.
author: Henk D.

description:
While visiting San Francisco we stumbled into this restaurant.  We were drawn by the sidewalk tables and the amazing food we saw.

We had an amazing meal. Ever thing was top notch. The shortcoming was we never were offered a refill on our water.

 Upon paying my bill, I explained to the hostess that everything was great, except we were not offered refills on water. The young lady quickly snapped at me and stated "you didn't ask for a refill". Interesting... A fellow server overheard her comment and stated that we shouldn't have to "ask" for refills...

A $60.00 bill, a $10.00 tip and attitude from a hostess guarantees that I will never return to this Mom & Pop establishment.

If you are going to charge high dollar for 2 meals, you should consider having a hostess with the families best intentions in mind. Of course, she is not affected by her piss poor attitude, but perhaps the owners are.
author: Joseph B.

description:
Very disappointed with our experience here. Both food and service were lacking. My conchile broccoli with sausage was tasty, but my husband's fettecini alfredo was horrible. The sauce was watery and tasteless, and required a lot of salt. The chicken was very bland, however the 6 little pieces of broccoli were good.  Both dishes were $17.95 each, and this did not include salad or bread.  
Service was slow and lackluster and we were never offered refills on our coffee.
author: Jill E.

description: Service was good, But the food was not worth the price.  I ordered the Chicken Alfredo it was very watery and I had to add salt to give it some kind of flavor and i never add salt to my food. In all honesty the chicken Alfredo tasted the exact same as a Lean Cuisine frozen meal chicken Alfredo. It was very disappointing considering the location of the restaurant is a high traffic area and the service was good. Was expecting much more out of the quality of the food.
author: Ramona C.

description: A quiet, peaceful place to eat. The waiter was friendly. The bread had a great crust. I had the eggplant parmigiana, which the waiter raved about, as it was made from a very traditional recipe and layers of this and that, plus it came with pasta. It was a hearty portion and when I asked for more grated cheese, the busboy stood with the grater, giving me a great amount!
author: Eva UnTiger S.

description: If we ever come back to San Fransisco we will eat here. The wait staff were wonderful. The food was amazing. I had the gnocchi with pesto sauce. They were had made. I know this because they were unevenly cut. Other than my grandmothers, it was the best I have ever had. My husband had the Scallia sausage with polenta. He said it was the best Italian meal he has ever had. I can't say enough good about it.
author: Dighina C.

description: This was my first visit to SF and we stumbled upon this little gem walking around and checking out the North Beach areas' night life.  Boy am I glad we did!!  My hubby and I opted to be seated outside at their cute two-seater tables. We were able to enjoy our delicious drinks while enjoying the perfectly warm weather with a hint of breeze and people watched=)).  Never once did we have to ask for our water/drinks to be refilled. Servers were attentive and very nice.  Food was SUPERB.  If you're lucky, the lobster ravioli will be on the menu's specials.  To die for!!  My husband had the lasagna and that as well was delicious!!  Cant say enough about this place. We had a very, very pleasant experience.  Want to go back already!!!!
author: Amanda K.

description:
The food was o.k. the service on the other hand was really bad...the other tables seemed to be getting good enough service...we were the only 'brown' people in the restaurant, I dont know if that was why,.
It was weird to see our waiter positively hovering over and giving fair service to the other tables .... It took three promptings to get our order in and I clocked it 15 min after we received our menus.....very disappointed.... Didn't want spit in our food so just sat and ate without complaining
author: Kalyan K.

description:
We were walking through North Beach, trying to decide where to eat, when we spotted this cute little gem.  The nice patio area caught our attention, so we gave it a try.  (Unfortunately, one thing I've noticed in SF, is the highest-rated restaurants look like sad little holes in the wall with zero ambiance.  I'm not into that.  The restaurant should look cute or the experience is ruined for me, it's not all about the food.  Just MHO.)

First thing I noticed once we sat down was the awesome service.  Another reviewer said the service was bad, which sounds ridiculous to me considering the out-of-the-norm attention we got.  Our waiter was awesome - friendly and attentive at all times.  I really appreciate that in a restaurant.

The food was definitely above average, and the house wine was good.  They gave us large portions, and unlimited bread, which is definitely a plus in my book.  I did think it was maybe a little overpriced, but hey, that seems to be typical in SF. 

We didn't have a wait, but the place was full on a Sunday night.  I can only imagine how crowded it gets on Friday and Saturday night.
author: Roben A.

description:
Great gnocchi and great service. We found it by accident but were glad we did. Awesome clam
 chowder!!
author: George R.

description: Pretty good food, relatively good ambience, nothing to complain!
author: Rocking V.

description:
The food was ok, but not worth the price and sometimes not what was stated on the menu.  Seems like something changed?  I have been coming to this restaurant for years and always thought it was excellent.  (and my bar on Italian food is high because I grew up eating my Italian Grandparent's cooking.)

- The minestrone soup was all vegetables (no beans or pasta).  It tasted fine, but it wasn't what I was expecting.  Also in the past, it was served with a baked cheese bread stick that was *amazing*.  This time, it was served without those, and with soggy croutons in the soup instead.... pretty gross.
- The fusilli con pollo was served with rotini, not fusilli.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't anything special, and again it was misleading.  If I had known it was going to be rotini, I would've ordered something else.  (Not to sound like a snob, but it is an Italian restaurant, so they should get their pastas right.)
- Service was good.
- The restaurant was otherwise empty, and it was mealtime on Saturday.  In the past it has always been packed.
author: Christina W.

description: Just stumbled on this on the to Fisherman's Wharf on Columbus.  We ate outside In front, ordered Lamb Gnocchi.  Wow!  So very good.  Just a simple Italian restaurant, but delicious.I would go back in a heart-beat.
author: Bill G.

description: Horrible service from the moment we walked in the door. We didn't even know who our server truly was because he never welcomed us or introduced himself. They messed up the order, but tried to blame us. Instead of rushing an order to make up for their mistake, they took their time and the whole party was done eating and still no food. When we asked for the manager, we were told he was busy. When we found the manager he did absolutely nothing and was just as rude as the staff, if not ruder.  The manager never once apologized let alone even listen to what we had to say. I would never recommend this restaurant as the manager showed his colors on how he enjoys having a poorly run restaurant and treating his paying customers as dirt.
author: Whitney W.

description: Loved the food! Loved the service! Loved the prices! This place is amazing I had the bruschetta with melted fontina cheese and sautéed mushrooms for the appetizer! Delicious! For the main entree I had the best homemade lasagne! The prices are great this is way better than the restaurant Five in fresno!
author: Marisa M.

description: Looking for good Italian food? Look elsewhere.  Bland is the word that comes to mind.  Had the pesto pasta with chicken....,sauce bland, chicken tasteless.  Dinner guest had the roast chicken....extremely dry.  Service non existent.  Picked this place on a whim on the way to Fishermans wharf.  Do yourself a favor and go else where, your stomach and pocket will thank you later.
author: Erik S.

description:
I know some reviewers will say the service is always exceptional... but I found it to be terrible. A server took around 15-20 minutes to come around to our table FOR THE FIRST TIME. After that initial wtf the service remained sub par. We had service from a mishmash 3 different waiters who we had to flag down for any help. We finished our meals and we sat chit chatting. 15 minutes passed with no server action at all. I ended up having to actually flag down a server again for my check. 

One of the young servers was especially bad and condescending. In fact he was just plain mean to us, it wasn't even subtle.

Food there was ok. I just don't know what it was we did that they felt it was okay to treat us that way. Tourists will like this spot. I will not be going back.
author: Marc L.

description: One of my favorites and most consistent every time I visit San Francisco.  Friendly staff, great food, phenomenal patio experience and the truffle pizza is outstanding.  Always a great wine selection.  It's my first stop when I visit...and sometimes my last before I leave.
author: Rachael P.

description:
7/26/2014
My family had a baptism at St. Peter and Pauls across the street and had a small party at Pellegrini's. We had reservations, but several more people showed up and they immeidately rearranged the tables. Throughout the meals the server was very attentive and was flexible. They even offered to prepare pasta family-style which is not on the menu.
The prices were reasonable and the food was good.
author: Travois D.

description: Visited for a birthday dinner, one of my SF aunt's favorite spots. A true, classic, awesome North Beach Italian dining experience. The base line menu is already fantastic, authentic, and well-rounded. Add the specials and ya off the charts in my humble opinion.  Had the Caesar Salad, and Black Spaghetti with salmon & Arugula.  Delicious! Add the GREAT and professional service and reasonable prices and I'd say this is a winner worth coming back to. We will!
author: Jeff L.

description: I live in the neighborhood and piazza pelligrini is one of my favorite little Italian restaurants in north beach. The owner and staff are always so sweet and the food is wonderful. Eating here is like taking a short trip back to Italy. Sit outside under the heaters on a cold night, order a glass of chianti and you'll be transported.
author: Lauren D.

description:
All the food is sooooooo good. The pizza really stands out as a winner.
But the hands down winner here was the affogato. Make sure to save some room for that baby because boy is it tasty. The best affogato I have had since Italy!
author: Issy D.

description:
Yum

I love Italian sausage and mushroom pizza with red wine

Boom
author: Nala H.

description:
I ate here tonight for the first time and really enjoyed my meal. I agree with the poster who said it was a 3.5 but not quite a 4. 

 I had the Chicken Parmesean and it was very tasty and generously sized. The pasta with it was alright, but I my chicken was perfectly fried and there was only a slight taste of olive oil, which I found appetizing. I split a prawn appetizer with my boyfriend, and it was light and perfect for a starter (although rather small with only 4 prawns). 

Our service was consistent and attentive. We never had plates stacking up on our table and everything we ordered came out in a timely manner. This cute little place is a good spot for a date as it feels intimate and rather cozy without being homey or divey. Nicely decorated. Our table was way too close to the table next to us, as the man right behind me had his chair up against mine. When busy, this place could get rather cramped. 

My one complaint is the dessert. I ordered the Torta Cabrese and it was a real dud. The menu listed it as a flourless chocolate torte with raspberry coulis. It tasted more like a bitter chocolate brownie that had been made using really cheap cocoa. I've had this dessert before at many other restaurants, and it's usually a very dense cake with a drizzle of berry sauce. Here it was rather slimey and there were nuts in it, which is really odd--a cake of this sort never has nuts in it. The raspberry sauce was really tart. In the end I left most of it uneaten, and that says a lot for a sweet tooth like me.

I'd come back, but would probably skip dessert.
author: Bianca U.

description:
great location, great staff, but the food was so-so.

I went there with the wifey for a late lunch, the place was somewhat crowded (it was a nice Saturday afternoon in the city), and we were able to get a table right away.  Out seating was available.
author: Mike S.

description: The lasagna is amazing and the food didnt take too long to come out. I will definitely be eating here again.
author: Paris N.

description: Great old world italian food. Great service. I had the pappardelle with the short rib ragu which was amazing, my wife had the pesto ravioli and the kids had individual pizzas. All were delicious. They also have a small, but good selection of wines by the glass. We were able to sit outside and enjoy a glass of wine or 2.
author: Art M.

description: We've not had the best luck with finding a really enjoyable meal this trip in the Bay Area. We think it's because we are staying in Fisherman's Wharf where the restaurants serve less than mediocre food. Well on our last evening here this trip we were determined to find a good meal. We found Pelligrini and were so glad we did! My husband had roasted chicken and he said it was very good. I had the squash ravioli and it was excellent! So fresh and delicious. Fresh bread with balsamic and olive oil and flourless tort for dessert. I didn't have my phone and so I don't have photos. The server was professional and we were greeted at the door. Our food was HOT when we got it. We would go again!
author: Robin G.

description: This place was amazing! Service was great and it was true Italian food. The noodles are homemade and delicious!!!!
author: Peaches H.

description: Ate here the other night with my wife while visiting San Francisco. It is a basic Italian joint, nothing fancy, which is fine with us. Our table was uneven and rocked back and forth the entire meal which was annoying and the waiter was indifferent to our plight. My wife had to send here salad back because all the lettuce was rotten. My antipasto salad was not much of a salad for $18. The half bottle of red wine with a twist off cap was not very good and was $22. Everything was mediocre at best and at those prices I would not return.
author: Eric N.

description:
This place is AWESOME. When visiting Frisco, you can't help but notice this one of a kind authentic Italian joint when walking the beautiful streets of north beach. The outdoor seating area is relatively spacious and bodes well with the laid back atmosphere of San Francisco. Reservations aren't always necessary, but large groups seem to be welcome at this joint, so on weekends it might be a good idea.
On to the food... wow. Growing up in an Italian household, I find myself consistently disappointed by places calling themselves "authentic", but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The eggplant is especially exquisite, the pasta is perfectly al dente, and the meats are succulent. Order a peroni, park yourself outside in the cool north beach air and watch the city go by your table. A definite must try if in the city by the bay.
author: VJ W.

description:
Came here with two friends around 8:00pm on Friday. It was pretty warm in San Francisco that night so we don't mind to get the outdoor table. 

The service was ok but kinda slow; especially the food. We waited quite a bit for our appetizer. Then another 20 minutes for the main courses. 

We have ordered: 

Antipasto Italiano (Grilled vegetables, fresh mozzarella, prosciutto, 
sopressata, mortadella, and olives) $19.95 - The portion was huge because it was for four people. Everything was just ok, nothing much to be impressed. 

Cozze e Vongole (Steamed clams and mussels in garlic white wine broth) $11.95 - The clams and mussels were very small and the broth was lack of flavors 

Pizza (Italian sausage, mushrooms) $15.95 - The pizza was thin crust. The pizza was ok but not the great. 

Grilled Scallops w/ Risotto ($26.95) - The scallops were too salty and the rice was too soft.. 

Also the complimentary bread was not good. The bread was hard and cold. 

Overall, the food was ok but not great. Kinda pricy. I would expect more from the price that I paid.
author: Liza T.

description:
Amazing food and desserts. I came with a group of 8 people and we all ordered different plates. They were all great. The pasta and the vegetable risotto were amazing and very flavorful. 

Service was great too. Definitely recommend.
author: Daniella A.

description:
I always like to try local spots in my neighborhood though I'd probably not return to Piazza Pellegrini.  

I'd give this place 2.5 stars.  We sat outside on a sunny afternoon and were not very impressed with the service.  Our server was polite but wasn't really around as we first arrived and were seated and again at the end when we were waiting for him to take our credit card.  

The food was decent, the prosciutto on our pizza seemed high quality but the dough was a little over floured or something and the caprese dish had a lot of excess oil swimming around the plate.  

One tip to the restaurant on their dishware, the vinegar/olive oil tiny "bowl" is kind of silly.  It's impossible to get the vinegar at the bottom of an inch of oil.
author: Janelle C.

description:
It was a cold, rainy night in SF. We were lost, hungry tourists looking for a place to eat. After driving around for what felt like hours, we finally just pulled in to the first open street parking we could find. By chance, that stall happened to be right across the street from Piazza Pellegrini. 

By the end of our meal our party of five were all stuffed. We were seriously happy to have stumbled across this place. We all sampled each others dishes and I can honestly say that I enjoyed everything. I can't remember what the name of my dish was, but I know it was angel hair pasta with a light tomato-basil sauce. It was awesome. The portion size was pretty deceiving, in a good way, though! When it first arrived at our table, I thought, "Oh, this looks kind of small, I might still be hungry."  The joke was on me because the bowl apparently has a lot of depth, (it looked like just a regular plate) so when I began mixing my sauce in, the portion literally seemed to grow right in front of my eyes. It was definitely a good portion to price ratio! I got about halfway through it before I started forcing myself to eat more simply because it was that good. 

For dessert we tried the Hazelnut gelatto filled cream puffs and the Creme Brulee. Both were awesome. The Creme Brulee has a lemony taste to it, so not everyone will like it, though.

All of the servers were friendly and quick. Mix that with great food and you've got yourself a winning combo. I would definitely come back if I'm ever in SF again!
author: Skye T.

description:
Went here recently and had the worst experience I've had at a restaurant. We made our reservation to have time to comfortably eat and go to a show. After an hour we hadn't gotten our dishes so we began asking and let the wait staff know we were running out of time to nicely enjoy our meals. 20 min later we had to leave. I asked our waiter if we could cancel the meal. He then yelled at me, drawing the attention of other diners, then went to my guest ad yelled at them. 

Overall, this was shocking and the worst service I've ever had. They made me feel uncomfortable and no one apologized. Sad because the food wasn't awful, just terrible customer service.
author: Justine R.

description:
If you're looking for good Italian food (or any food, really) then I'd suggest going somewhere else. 

My party of 5 & I decided to eat here after walking by and falling in love with the savory aroma the restaurant exudes. We waited 40 mins to be seated, but we didn't mind thinking the food would be worth it. Waiting outside, we got glimpses of the food of those dining outside & it all looked delicious.

The food here smells and looks better than it tastes. The pasta is bland, flavorless, and slightly over cooked. The pizza is just as bland. The only good thing I was able to try here was their lentil soup. Though it was very thick, the soup was the best thing that came to our table because it was seasoned at least. 

I ordered their angel hair pasta which was supposed to come with basil, garlic, and tomatoes.  Basil and garlic are quite strong flavors and somehow they managed to deliver watery tomato pasta to my plate. It was absolutely bland and disappointing. I thought it was just my plate thinking I ordered the wrong item off the menu, but was told by the rest of my party how disappointing their food was as well. The main issue seemed to be a lack of flavor. One of my friends ordered their shrimp pasta & was given a plate full of pasta and only 4 shrimps. Not worth the $25 price tag. We ordered their Margherita pizza to share & it was just as flavorless as everything else we ordered. Only one of my friends enjoyed his meal saying the meatballs were good and generously sized. I did like that their ingredients tasted fresh. 

I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone as its waaaay overpriced for the quality food they prepare. One can make better tasting pasta at home.
author: Ana V.

description:
Nice Italian restaurant. Perfect amount of seating both outside and in, with heaters in the patio for the cool nights. The food is very tasty with a nice variety on the menu. Good and friendly service. A little pricey
but thats SF. Delicious salmon pasta. Would recommend.
author: Sarah H.

description: Piazza pellegrini is always great. I had the usual capellini and it was amazing. They were so accommodating considering I was with a party of ten. They kept the wine flowing and pasta comming. An experience here is always amazing and I highly recommend comming here.
author: Madison L.

description: Excellent margarita pizza and squash ravioli. Good wine selection. Excellent attentive service. Sidewalk or indoors. Good ,Good, good.
author: Ed H.

description: This is NOT Italian food cooked by Italians. This may be OK for tourists who don't any better, but if you're looking for authentic Italian food, look further up Columbus Avenue.
author: Mark D.

description: Great service and authentic homemade iltalian dishes.  This is one of our favorite restaurants in the area and the fucilli with sausage and sausage is amazing. Leave room for the taramisu as it is to die for.
author: Ryan F.

description:
Atmosphere: Unbecoming
Patronage: Degenerate
Service: Piss Poor
Food: Inedible
Facilities: Unsanitary
Overall: Not Bad
author: Benjamin D.

description: I was among friends and all I wanted was a coffee. When we received the bill I asked the waitress why my coffee was $4 instead of the $3 listed on the menu. She spoke to her boss and came back to reveal that they hadn't yet updated their menus and the real price for a cup of coffee is $4. Umm. Ok. I wasn't going to cry/wait/complain/fuss over a dollar however I thought it was pretty unprofessional for them not to at least offer me the listed price. Aside from the false advertising and outdated menus, my friend ordered the pollo pesto sandwich panini and was quite displeased. The bread crumbled in her hands and she was disappointed by the lack of flavor. The waitress was smiley and fairly attentive however the misinformation and blandness of the overall cafe shall result with my 2 star rating and a recommendation to SKIP this spot and try another. Yep.
author: Kristy F.

description:
A wonderful little place on a corner with outdoor seating. The ambiance and great service made for a very enjoyable experience.  

For starters my fiancée and I enjoyed a great bruschetta for and appetizer. Then I had an incredible Lasagna di Carne. It was everything lasagna should be.  My fiancée had a spicy sausage (I don't remember the menu name).  It was just the right amount of spice. All in all it was excellent, my nest meal in San Francisco.
author: Julio S.

description: Everything was amazing! All dishes tasted very homemade and flavorful. They had amazing balsamic, gnocchi, and service.
author: Audrey F.

description:
After walking around the area for a bit and deciding NOT to go with the hotel's restaurant recommendations, the three of us settled in for an early dinner at Piazza Pellegrini. 

CONS: Basket of bread is meh, even with balsamic. One small bathroom for all of your patrons, really?! AND, if you're idea of good, affordable Italian is on par with Olive Garden then this place is not for you.

PROS: Amazing selection of fresh pastas, seafood, pizza and daily special entrees. Small and comfortable atmosphere that encourages lingering and enjoying your meal and your companions. Excellent, attentive service (which resulted in an uber-tip). 

THE SITCH: My companion ordered the Farfallette al Salmone ($18) and was extremely happy with the creamy, salmony sauce that generously covered a large bowl of little farfallette bows. I was ridiculously happy with my half order of Spaghetti alla Carbonara ($17) that I split with my other dining companion. This was the first time she's tried carbonara so I was extra happy that Pellegrini executed the dish well. Also, half plate is the perfect amount as their portions are quite generous. Add a bottle of wine ($40) and two after dinner cappuccinos ($4 each) and the tab adds up pretty quickly.

We did pass on dessert (between the rich pasta and wine, lots of calories had been consumed), but our waiter went ahead and brought out a plate of tiramisu, on the house. Nice touch.
author: Christine B.

description: Love finding little gems in the crazy city of San Francisco. With so many Italian restaurants to choose from in North Beach, our friends made reservations here. And so glad they did. The place is small but has a great ambiance and the menu had a wide selection to choose from. I had the lobster raviolis and they were delicious. Would definitely recommend.
author: Ava G.

description: I love this place! My husband and I always go there when we are in San Francisco. Great food served by real Italians.
author: Sally T.

description: Came here in a recommendation. .and loved it.. amazing food..me and my girlfriend really enjoyed our time here.. I recommend sitting outside..The view is beautiful. .can't wait to come back..
author: Ray R.

description:
Perhaps it was an off-night, but wasn't very impressed. I ordered the oft-lauded dungeness crab ravioli and while the crab was fresh, the sauce seemed to lack a robustness and fell pretty flat.

I wasn't a fan of the cioppino either, but it has a huge reputation and others seemed to be thoroughly enjoying it so you should probably give it a shot.
author: Phil C.

description: Stopped in here half way through our trip thru North Beach. It's a nice little spot outside with a few small tables that each are able to accommodate 3 comfortably but 4 a bit cramped. I ordered two Italian sodas, one tiramisu and one peach. Both were appetizing, the tiramisu was interesting. Staff was really pleasant, definitely a good place to stop and rest and have a quick bite or drink.
author: Krishna V.

description: My husband and I just left this romantic little spot in North Beach/Washington Square area. We were greeted by friendly Marko and quickly seated. Another sever brought us our own fresh cold water bottle and some bread with olive oil/balsamic dip. I ordered spaghetti and meatballs and my husband ordered the four cheese pizza and both plates were AWESOME. Full of flavor! If we are ever to return to SF (which we will!), this spot is definitely on our list to visit again.
author: Marcela F.

description:
Great street front Italian. Good service not great. Good food.  Great bread. 
Fun to watch people at the park across the street. Homemade pasta was cooked perfectly. 
would recommend going and having lunch.
author: Graham Y.

description: I really enjoyed this restaurant. I ordered an Italian Sausage with Cottage Cheese and it was spectacular. As for the appetizer we had thinly sliced veal and it was delicious and the portions were plentiful. For desert we ordered Tiramisu and it was soft and full of flavor. The waiter was quick to the service and extremely friendly. For the price, I would definitly come back again.
author: JK C.

description:
One of the worst meals I have experienced  for a long while. It was hard to find anything positive about the meal when I received my plate of ahi tuna.... Rotten. I mean literally rotten, it had probably been bad for a couple days. I shared with the three other adults at the table and we all were amazed how far gone the fish was. I asked the waiter to take it back telling him it was rotten. He came back later and insisted that the fish was fine  and that it was not rotten. (I still had the knife I used and it still smelled foul) Afterwards staff avoided us and we had to ask for small things and the check. Other dishes had tasteless veggies and potatoes and meat smothered in so much sauce you could not taste it. I had to beg for three free coffees to make up for their lousy serviTo say the least I do not recommend this restaurant and I caution anyone ordering fish! Especially if it's on special!
(Felt queasy for a long time afterwards)
author: Chloe C.

description: The food was fantastic.  We walked in on a busy Saturday night and sat at the bar.  I ordered the lasagna and my son had the meat ravioli and both were excellent.  Our waiter was very attentive the entire time we were there.  This is definely going on my favorite list!
author: Erika K.

description: I haven't eaten at the restaurant yet, but I decided to try the daytime stand in the train outside of the restaurant. I wasn't sure what meal to order, but I got a meatball sandwich. I thought the sandwich would fall apart, and it did. I just had to use a utensil to poke at the food. I got a lemonade and it was too expensive at $3. I probably won't be back at this stand.
author: Denise C.

description: Wonderful meal for our family a few months ago. Cant wait to go back. Good honest, no frills, local Italian meals.. In North Beach!
author: David G.

description:
The food and service was nice, and the tables out front are great for people watching (especially if you are under the necessary heat lamp).  I wouldn't say it was the best Italian I've ever had, but I can't complain.  We ordered the pasta with clams and a pizza.  I thought the pasta was solid, but the pizza was a bit too papery thin for my tastes.

Prices are a bit steep, but liveable. 

There seemed to be enough parking meters out front.
author: Joan H.

description:
I so regret coming here tonight. I hate when you spend a lot of money and leave a restaurant still hungry. I hate waiting and waiting for food, to the point where you are frustrated and almost angry. You've all been there, I'm sure. Tonight that's how I felt. I hate a restaurant that only has 1 waiter for 20 tables. Yes, my waiter had every single outside table tonight. Yikes. He tried his best I'm sure, but how can anyone give good service when you have so many customers?? I hate feeling ripped off by a restaurant's, i.e. the price to value ratio.

Having passed by this place many times, seeing what a wonderful warm night it was tonight and seeing an empty table outside, my wife and I decided to try this place.

First let me say that the food tasted alright. Maybe because we were starving by the time everything came out. I think we waited 45 minutes to 1 hour for our entrees. 

Appetizer: Insalata di Mare - mixed seafood on toasted french bread. Think bruschetta with seafood. Lightly seasoned, tasted ok, 2 pieces for $12, yipes.

Entrees: Spaghetti carbonara - sauce was kind of clumpy, and a bit on the bland side. But starving so ate the whole thing. Again pricey at $17. 

Petrale Sole with Lemon and capers - nicely done with a mild flavor. Again pricey at $25.

If the food came out in a timely manner and the portions were more satisfying, I would have been ok with things. I would have accepted the SF/touristy pricing. But combining the slow food service with leaving hungry, this was the first time ever that I was tempted to tell people in line to not eat at this establishment.
author: Dom L.

description:
So it was a busy weekend and I'm generally inclined to be forgiving and reasonable about many things when it's crazy. But this was different.  We were greeted quickly, sat outside (nice, but there was broken glass all around the table) and ordered a $35 bottle of Syrah. Our server told us it was a house special, a good bottle, and were were thrilled.  Twenty minutes later he came back with the wine and took our order. Way too long when there were multiple servers and 4 bussers for the small-ish restaurant. After we ordered we had hoped we'd get some bread (like other tables had) but didn't see a server, or the bread, for 20 minutes or so. They brought the bread out with the food, weird and poorly timed but at this point I'm still not super upset. The pasta (house-made they say) was so overcooked it literally just fell apart into mush. It was poorly flavored, and was the most boring pasta with short-rib ragu I've ever had. It was the most boring pasta, period, I've ever had, actually. My friend's food was ok, but looked like it came from Olive Garden.

Now lets get to the really terrible part, the stuff that makes me give them one star. While I was sitting there I twice saw and heard the owner (who is also the host) turn away a dark-skinned person then seat the next walk-up within minutes. He told a black woman they wait was "very long and she should try somewhere else" and he ignored a man (who was maybe Indian?) Both of those people and their group talked about how they were treated as they walked away (hence, by me) and noted that other people seemed to be getting much friendlier service. Seriously, I couldn't believe it, I've never witness anything like it, but it made me eager to get the hell outta that place. He was seating many people during our meal and the difference between how he treated these two individuals, and other people was staggering.  He was all jokes and smiles with everyone else and on these two occasions he was flat-out rude. 

After me and my friend paid the bill we were taking turns using the restroom and while I was away from the table our server told my friend he should get up and leave because he needed that table. We weren't sitting there for more than 10 minutes after the bill came so this was totally unexpected and completely rude. I have no idea how this place stays in business being racist, rude, and having terrible food.
author: Katie S.

description:
So it's my first time back in SF for a while and we wanted to celebrate the anniversary by going to a nice restaurant in Little Italy. After rounds of getting lost trying to look for this one restaurant only to find that we needed reservations, we stumbled across the closest, most attractive dining place we could find - Pellegrini. It had beautiful lights strung across the front and seemed to have a good amount of people waiting outside for seats. So Pelligrini it was. 

The first person to greet us was really kind and told us that we would be seated in roughly 5-10 minutes. BUT, we ended up waiting an hour! I don't think I would've minded as much if we were given seats before the others that came. All the tables were the same size, just some had 2 seats and others had 3. I was really disappointed to find that people who came in 3's later during the night were seated right away when we'd been waiting outside in the cold for an hour. But at least the lady was kind enough to offer us temporary indoor seating for the wait.

The waiter we had was really sweet. He definitely made the night a little better, which was needed because I had twisted my ankle 3 times during the search for the other restaurant (downside of heels!) and was hungry and cold. The food was alright, and each was a bit different:

          Appetizer: We ordered from the special menu and got the non-fried calamari, which was a BIG mistake b/c the calamari tasted really raw. We unfortunately ended up masking the taste with the lemons they provided :/ I guess when life gives you lemons, squeeze them all! (Or just get the fried calamari ;D )

          Pasta: We ordered the penne arrabiata w/ spicy tomato sauce and the shell pasta with spicy italian sausage (yes we're a fan of spice!). I liked my pasta - it had the perfect spiciness level to keep my nose intact, but I liked the shell pasta dish more. The only downside to the shell pasta was that it wasn't left to boil long enough so it came out a little harder than expected. But it was nonetheless good when mixed with the veggies and sausage.

         Dessert: Dessert was (and always is) the best part of the meal. I can still taste the apple pie - just thinking of it makes my mouth water! It wasn't called apple pie on the menu, but it consisted of glazed apple cuts on a really yummy pastry. So apple pie-like. YUM YUM YUM!

I can't say this is the best Italian restaurant that I've been to, but it also wasn't too bad. I just wish we had gotten our seats sooner, but the rest of the night made up for it :)
author: Cindy S.

description: This place had, literally, the worst service I've ever had in my entire life! The waiter was the biggest douchebag to us for no reason at all. The very few times he came over he waltzed over slowly and just had an overall arrogant quality to him. The food was ok, but certainly not worth the money. The waiter rarely ever came over and checked on us. It took me about half an hour to get a hot chocolate, that was the hottest liquid, which burned my tongue off. Avoid this place, it's overpriced and the service is horrendous!
author: Mike Z.

description: i have to give this place a shout out because they were so accommodating over weekend for a group close to 20 people. All the other restaurants in the area wanted a buy in to a set party menu, but Dario (he's awesome) accepted the reservation and everyone had a great time! We got to sit in the patio area overlooking Washington Square Park eating pizzas and dessert. The pizzas were so good! I was bummed that we didn't get the "to go pizzas" that we were going to take home, but we were caught up saying our goodbyes that I didn't realize until we left. Overall, we received excellent service and the pizzas were delish!!!! Thank you for making my birthday dinner a success!!!
author: E.C. G.

description:
Dario, Vincenzo, Eneo - - all make this place home for us!   Terrific food, fabulous service -- inside and out.  We eat here on average twice a month.  Perfect for bringing clients or family.   We live about two blocks away, so have the advantage of being able to eat at so many restaurants within a 3 to 5 block radius -- Piazza Pellegrini is a favorite because of the delicious and fresh food, and the wonderful atmosphere.  
I've hosted parties here, and have come here alone -- any number of people, it's still a wonderful place.
author: Annette B.

description: We visited this popular local restaurant last night in Little Italy and I was impressed. The server was very pleasant and thoroughly explained the menu, made wine suggestions and was very attentive. The food was amazing. I got the Farfallette al Salmone Affumicato which is Salmon and pasta sauté in a delicious vodka sauce. Amazing!! We sat inside but there is an outside heated patio out front which is great for people watching. From our table we got a beautiful view of St. Peter and Paul's cathedral. I strongly recommend this restaurant to all of you foodies. You'll love it.
author: Jermaine J.

description: I wanted to be as to give a higher rating but service was so terrible. Our waiter spent more time having conversations with the cooks, other waiters and ignoring us. The reason I still give three stars is the food was great. Gnocchi was rich  with a chessy sauce, the dish I had had a very tasty spicy sausage with broccoli And the calzone was huge and flavorful. Had to ask for sauce for it. Menu said $3 for coffee and got charged $4 as well as soda that $4 no refill was offered. Had to ask for everything even someone to take our order.
author: Dawn D.

description:
This place only deserves 3 stars. It's not a fancy place so the price of the food seemed a bit much. Service was fine and we were seated right away on a Sunday night even though we were a party of 8. Needless to say, 18% gratuity was already added at the end. The bill ended up being roughly $30 per person with tip included because we divided it evenly.

In my opinion, the food is fine but it's not worth the prices. I didn't feel like eating a lot so I ordered minestrone soup and a cup of tea. The soup was more like a bowl with tons of vegetables tossed in. I was hoping for more soup in there but there was hardly any. The tea was hot water with a tea bag for $4.95. Are you serious? They took away my cup of water and tea bag when I asked for more water and let me choose another tea but I honestly would have been fine with just more hot water added. 

We split a bruschetta as an appetizer. Everyone ended up getting their own pasta dish (except me) and even though the portions looked small, everyone was full enough. The pasta averaged $18-$20 a plate before taxes and I didn't think it was worth it.
author: Connie Y.

description: I had an overall good experience here. Good waiter with an Italian accent always adds to the theater. The prosciutto pizza was good....really great crust. Caesar salad was good but way over priced. Mains were the Veal osso bucco which was tender, flavorful and had a well made risotto as side. The veal Parm was also good but had a slight burned oil taste on the seared breadcrumbs. Not enough to kill the whole deal but there.
author: Dana D.

description:
Enjoyed the food. The Antipasto Italiano was great. The "House made" pasta had the nice texture of fresh pasta. Unfortunately, it needed about one more minute of cooking. And I am going to complain about this every time it happens: the main dish was served too soon after the antipasto. The antipasto plate was less than half consumed when the waiter walks up with two plates of pasta and stands there while we are moving things around to find space for the next course. I guess I'm going to learn to speak up but I NEVER send food back to the kitchen so mentioning it does me no good.  

Anywho, the food was good, North Beach is great and I will definitely return.
author: Roy N.

description:
Second time dining at Pellegrini and second time I would say "Buon Alimento"!

This is a small Italian restaurant on Columbus Avenue, just at the beginning of the lively and vibrant and all senses stimulating, North Beach.  When we arrived this time, the place was packed. I asked if we could eat on the side patio and the maitre d', said yes, thereby getting a table immediately. After we sat down, all of the tables on the patio were occupied within minutes. The patio turned out to be very pleasant, once the heaters were ignited. We were not on the sidewalk but next to it, so that people watching was quite entertaining and the Pelligrini cable car and multicolored lights strung over our heads added to the North Beach effect. 

The food was delicious and excellently prepared. The daily menu is handwritten and extensive.  On this visit we were starving and ordered two appetizers with wine. A  fried calamari and the melon wrapped in prosciutto with fresh basil and a light drizzling of olive oil.   I can not believe we ate all of it!  We then were sensible and shared the risotto pescatore, meaning risotto with clams, mussels, octopus  and shrimp. Perfectly done! 

The Italian waiter was also excellent and made the dining experience unique and special. He was extremely busy but was always there at the right time.  When I ordered decaf coffee (okay, I'm a wimp), the busboy said there was no decaf. When our waiter discovered this, he personally searched and did whatever, because minutes later, a decaf coffee, brewed perfectly was before me. That is great service! 

Dinner was followed by a stroll up Columbus Avenue in all its colorful splendor.  Crowded with people enjoying a meal along the bustling sidewalks, cafes and Gelato shops brimming with happy customers. Gastronomy and humanity stirred together in a funky, quirky and wonderful mix.
author: Marilyn Y.

description: Ok.  The good thing:  its a trattoria in North Beach, so you get to people watch while you eat your dinner.  The outdoor tables are cute. Other good thing:  nice servers.  They smile, are super attentive, and helpful.  As for the food, well...its more than a little uninspired, and reminds me of frozen food with some canned spaghetti sauce.  The fritto misto was tasteless.  The veal was pounded and fried within an inch of its life.  The risotto was missing the texture and the taste was bland. The vegetables were either boiled or steamed with butter with no spices.  This feels like 1950's food.  For the big prices, there are much better choices in the City.
author: Alittle G.

description: Just ate there yesterday and I have to say, this place is pretty bad.  It looks great and is in a great location but sadly does not live up to how it looks.  I've never been somewhere as overpriced as this place. The caprese salad was 14.95... 15 dollars for 4 tomato slices and 4 pieces of mozzarella.  I still can't believe that.  The other salads on the menu were all around 9 dollars.  For 15 I would've thought there'd be a huge portion but no, just barely enough for two people, let alone our party of 4.  The chicken caesar salads we got were good but not amazing. I got ravioli while my girlfriend and grandmother got minestrone soup.  My dad got some pork chops dish.  My grandmother and dad liked what they got but my girlfriend and I weren't too impressed.  There wasn't a lot of ravioli and it tasted a little weird, as if the meat wasn't fresh.  The minestrone was good but didn't have noodles or beans, so it was barely minestrone.  We also got two orders of garlic bread which were 6.95 per order and only came with 7-8 pieces of bread.  Bread is cheap and so is garlic so I'd expect a little more, not as over priced as the caprese though.  My dad also got a lemonade, and we got an appetizer of prosciutto with cantaloupe.  The prosciutto was actually pretty good, and the portion was great!   I felt like we actually got our 15 dollars worth.  Our meal altogether was around 150 dollars, which is ridiculous.  Do not go here unless you have serious money.  Seriously, please don't go here.
author: Joe C.

description: The Lasagne is to die for. Every time we come to SF we have dinner here. We have had many tiger dishes as well you won't be disappointed.
author: Emerson O.

description: The service was great, the staff is friendly and the environment is definitely Italian. But for an authentic Italian place we expected better bread (it was cold and nothing special) and better Parmesan cheese (we had to ask them to bring it and it tasted like Kraft). The food was good but nothing special
author: Ana Cristina J.

description:
We opted to not wait and sit outside on the cold patio. Suggestion - get some heating lamps if you are going to offer the chilly patio to hungry customers. 
I got the lobster raviloli - It was pretty good. My companions got the arugula salad with chicken - delicious, the soup - meh, and the chicken parm - meh, especially for the price,
The server was sweet and friendly.
We were hungry and impatient and I am sure if we had taken the time to find a better place we would have been happier.
author: Kristin T.

description: I had the bow tie pasts with chicken, Broccoli and Alfredo sauce. The sauce was runny and bland. I don't think they drained the pasta correctly. However the people that were eating pizza a table down from us- that PIZZA looked Delicious! Imma get pizza next time.
author: Tess M.

description: Literally the best polenta I've ever had, and I've eaten polenta in Rome, Venice & Florence. Went in on a whim, and will be sure to come back every time I'm back in San Francisco. Thank you for treating me like family and feeding me well after a long business trip!
author: Mandy R.

description:
What a wonderful place.  This is my wife and I's favorite spot.  We found this place years ago while walking through the North Beach in San Francisco.  We love it so much i decided to propose to my wife here.

Every time we are in town, we have to go back and have at least 1 meal here.  The food is always fantastic and service is phenomenal.

Domenico and Vicente are both wonderful servers and take excellent care of us.  We like to dine slowly and enjoy each others company and we never have any pressure to speed up our dining experience.  

I only with that this restaurant was closer to home, i would eat there all the time.

Thank you so much for making our engagement and our dining experiences so wonderful.
author: Bryan P.

description: AMAZING authentic Italian food! We were walking by & decided to stop here. The staff all work together to ensure everyone is taken care of. The food is remarkable & the atmosphere is authentic. You must go here for great Italian food.
author: Jeremy W.

description: Came here many years ago and we had such a great experience.  The food was fantastic and the service exceptional.  We ate so well and came back for a second time with our experience just as memorable.  I always recommend this restaurant to all my friends who visits SF.  Love the ceasar salad.  The anchovies on the ceasar salad was the best bar none.  If I could buy the whole can I would.  I never found anything close to the anchovies they serve there.  Trust me I have been looking.  Can't wait to go back to SF.
author: Maria Y.

description: We were coming to town with 14 moms and 14 girls and were searching for a place that would take us. This restaurant worked with us to come up with a family style dinner of salad/soup, pizza and pasta. The food was spectacular (pesto penne was the best!) and everyone at the Pelligrini's was extremely nice. A great time was had by all! Thanks for helping make our SF excursion so special.
author: Nancy F.

description: Seriously best service I've ever had! Bartender, waiter, owner all stopped by our table to introduce themselves and chat. The seafood ravioli was divine! And the bruschetta was the best I've had!! Great authentic Italian food and atmosphere!
author: Mikell O.

description: Came here for lunch. The food was the smallest portion and over priced! Had the bistec it was around 14.50 for the thinnest piece of carne Asada and a small side salad ! Doesn't carne Asada belong in a mexican restaraunt ??? It was thin and chewy. My boyfriend had the pesto pasta with shrimp it was greasy and had 5 little tiny shrimp and tasted bland ! The waiter was a douchey these girls walked by who looked 17 and he was staring them up and down and was checking them out .... Gross you look like yku could be their dad ! Don't waste your time here at this tourist trap there's much better Italian restaraunts in north beach else where
author: Lisa N.

description: Christmas night and and our crab started to smell at home. What to do??  We ended up at Dario's lovely and welcoming Piazza Pellegrini. We had fresh steamed crab, pasta, pizza, osso bucco and beautiful vino. We could have picked so many places on Christmas night to celebrate but we chose Piazza Pellegrini because it is warm and inviting and family-friendly friendly. I definitely recommend.
author: rosita t.

description:
Okay, i am going to start off by saying that I am not one of those Negative Nancy Yelpers who only comments on places that I have had bad experiences. I don't enjoy writing a bad review, but this one was necessary.

I was deceived by Piazza Pellegrini's prime Columbus Street location with the bistro tables filling the side walk out front and the seemingly charming waiters carrying heaping plates of pasta over their shoulders. Little did I know this place was filled with unsuspecting tourists who didn't know any better. 

I ordered the veal I literally could not even cut into it. The veggies on the side were literally frozen vegetables that had prob been put through the microwave. My boyfriend ordered the lobster ravioli (which was not cheap) and there was imitation meat, which I am pretty sure was crab, not lobster. It was absolutely awful. As embarrassing as it was to do, we ended up sending it back. Our waiter got in a verbal argument with us saying that were insulting him and that we were crazy. As someone who had worked in the restaurant business, I was shocked by his reaction. It was such a scene that we were pretty sure they were going to do something awful to our food, so we just ended up walking out. Horrible service, horrible food. Do not be fooled like I was.
author: Ashley L.

description: I love this restaurant, and believe that it deserves a resounding 5 STAR total here on Yelp.  The place is authentic Italian cuisine with at least 90% of the staff being authentic Italian as well (could be higher).  I ordered for pickup the other night 1) The Roasted Pork Chop; 2) Grilled Salmon; and 3) Roast Chicken.  They were all great, and the Roasted Pork Chop was out of this world.  What's more, is that I could easily park my car behind the restaurant in its lot and dash in for the pick-up. What other restaurant in North Beach has that? I've eaten at the restaurant many times and its great inside, and as noted outside on the sidewalk with the heaters. After our meal, I reflected back on great dishes that I have had in North Beach, and both of them are from this restaurant: 1) The Aforementioned Roasted Pork Chop; and 2) The Broccoli Rabe with Italian Sausage and Parmesan Cheese. That really tells me something. I say, Check it Out.
author: Pat D.

description: Good and service were both quite good. Especially liked the gnocchi with sausage and asparagus and the quattro formagi pizza.
author: Fred D.

description:
We've been here twice.  Location is great right off of Washington Square.  First time here was an unplanned stop here the night we got engaged...so it holds a special place.  Second trip we were in North Beach and wanted to grab a quick bite - got the Antipasta Platter.  Service is good, friendly, quick.  

People watching from the outdoor tables is some of my favorite.
author: Chrissy R.

description:
My parents were in town and they took one of the tour buses around the city while I was working.  The driver, of all people, suggested Piazza Pellegrini as they drove by, and wow, he was right on.

If you like spicy, don't even think twice: order the Conchiglie con Broccoli e Salsicce, which, according to their menue is "shell pasta with broccoli, spicy Italian sausage, garlic and olive oil".  So simple, so spicy, so in love!  The waiter was fantastic, even offering us lemoncello afterwards.

I went back on my birthday and had the pizza with arugula on top.  It was good, even reminding me of one of my favorite restaurants back home, but didn't compare to the Spicy Sausage Broccoli goodness from the first time.  

It was a cute place, and great for conversation.  I'd go back again in a second!
author: Eliza D.

description: Sorry to see the negative reviews here...we had a party of 8 that went to dinner after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon. We all enjoyed the food, atmosphere and the service. A variety of dishes were had for dinner, and we were all happy with our entrees and great desserts. We especially appreciated the Happy Birthday sung to my mom by a group of servers which had the whole restaurant applauding. We would definitely go back.
author: Karen M.

description:
My brother from Hawaii and I decided to park in Chinatown, then walk to Fisherman's Wharf, munching along the way.  

On our way back from FW, we decided to have a late lunch at Pellegrini to share a panini.  People, their porchetta panini was outstanding.  

Porchetta reminded us of Hawaii's kalua pig & in a panini, it did not disappoint.

Highly recommended along with their excellent beer selections.
author: Kimo U.

description:
This is another one of those 3.5 ones but not quite a 4. 

I was with a friend and we had no idea where to eat for lunch so I suggested we just go to one of the other 3 star (for me at least) Italian restaurants in the area. While walking on the way to the other restaurant, we spotted this place, and I figured, might as well play Russian Food Roulette, just bite the bullet and check it out. 

Not a bad spot! 

Service was excellent. Servers were super friendly and very observant. We didn't have salt and pepper on our table, and since we were there early (11:45am) and no one was there yet, I just reached over and stole another table's salt and pep. The server came over right away and apologized for not having condiments on our table. He also helped us make our food selections and made sure we liked what we ordered. 

My Salmone Farfarelle was yummy and I would order it again. Can't remember what my friend ordered (sorry yelpers), but her plate was pretty clean by the time we left. By the time we left, the place starting to get packed so show up 15min before the lunch rush and you will get table of your choice!

Reason it's not a 4 star - Well, I'm not DYING to go back and also, I wasn't a fan of their  olive oil and balsamic that they served with the bread. That's a BIG deal to me. I will definitely go back though, once I have tried all the Italian places in the area!
author: Janis M.

description: The staff is friendly and we enjoyed sitting at the bar drinking chianti and chatting it up like we were goodguys.  We ordered the zablione and it was excellent.  The extra berries made it healthier and refreshing.
author: Steve T.

description:
I came here with my bf on a Friday night at 6:45pm to catch a quick dinner before going to Cobb's Comedy Show. All the tables were taken so we decided to just sit at the bar so we can eat and leave. Complimentary bread basket came immediately with some olive oil and balsamic vinegar for dipping.  For appetizer, we ordered the fried calamari with shrimp for $11.95. We both thought this appetizer was somewhat interesting because we've never had it with shrimp. It actually turned out pretty good.  The batter was light and crispy but both items weren't overfried. Shrimp was delicious but the calamari was a little bland (thank goodness for marinara sauce).  After eating the whole entire plate, we didn't want to eat anymore....until our entrees came out! 
Bf had the meat lasagna, $19.99 and it was soft and saucy.  I had the rigatoni, $17.99, with sun-dried tomatoes, prosciutto and mozzarella.  Oh man, my dish was sooo good.  I loved how my pasta was cooked  al dente, mozzarella was stringy, the sun-dried tomatoes and prosciutto complemented the entire dish. We both ate less than half of our entree and had to just pack it to go.  After a few hours of drinking, I was just craving for my leftovers. I microwaved my box and it pretty much tasted the same as when I dined at the restaurant.
author: Irene L.

description: Last night in SF for my wife's birthday and we wanted Italian in North Beach. After much indecision, we were persuaded by the manager of this cozy old school establishment (in a good way) to come on in. From the homemade pasta dishes, to the personal attention we received, everything was more than expected. At the end of the meal, the waiters serenaded my wife with an Italian rendition of Happy Birthday. If you're looking for a sincere, authentic, Little Italy feel, then don't miss this true find in North Beach. Thank you to all the staff for a special night.
author: David M.

description: I would have given 2 stars but my brother said 3/4, hence the common 3. Seating was very tight and had very little air flow which made it hot. I had short rib ragu pasta which I really did not care for- not bad, just not to my liking. He had lobster ravioli that he really liked. Half bottle of wine was not expensive. Bread was ok- seemed stale? Service was decent & friendly.  Overall, I would not recommend, but I would go back and try something different on the menu.
author: DK H.

description:
Piazza Pellegrini has the most charming waitstaff. Seriously they are over the top friendly yet it seems so genuine.

There are many Italian options in the area, but I was turned onto this place by a friend that owns a business close by. I figure she must have tried them all by now so here we go!

We sat curbside under some torches that were set on "incinerate".  Even the San Francisco fog couldn't touch us.

We ordered a surprisingly good appetizer that involved polenta. I thought it would be simple and hearty but it was presented beautifully and the red wine reduction had just the right tanginess. To really put this place to the test we ordered classic dishes: lasagne and eggplant parmesan. The lasagne was cooked thru perfectly and the eggplant was also very tender. The portions were generous so we had no room for desert. We even decided to skip the cappuccinos which made our server (who had been so sweet) instantly take on the turd face. (He looks like he smells something bad)

I did not take this turn in attitude too personally. I have been to Italy and they dont understand simple things like "coffee to go" or "fast food"
They think if you are out for dinner it should be at least a 2 to 3 hour affair that involves a lot of wine and many courses. 
Dear Piazza Pellegrini, I am not a tourist. If I was on vacation I would have that coffee and then walk off all that pasta going up and down the hills of San Francisco. It is getting late and I need the check. I do not need desert. I would like to loose the baby weight before I send my little angels off to college. Sorry if you find that offensive.
author: Melissa B.

description: Food was fresh, service staff attentive and price par for the course for the area. Chicken Piccata was very good. Ask for the fresh made pasta. Arugula salad with beets was just right with the dressing. Bread was nothing special.
author: Bob P.

description: First time here went on the recommendation of a friend    . Made a reservation and they took us promptly it's very cute inside we had a charming waiter who was attentive.  We shared the fried shrimp and calamari followed by spaghetti carbonara it was very good we were so full we didn't have room for dessert. A fun place in north beach for a tasty meal
author: lyn m.

description:
Sidewalk dining on Columbus Ave with Peter & Paul towering in the clear blue sky backdrop, Italian waiters politely attending to your every need and even cutting your "entrepreneur" (=po') friend a deal on a glass of wine, perfect bread, yummy salmon with eggplant tapinade and tasty spinach, refreshing sorbet...

I may be in love with Franco, but it's really a symphony of influences that lead  me to this 4 star conclusion.
author: Diane B.

description: Outstanding authentic Italian food and environment in North Beach. I had Chicken Parm Panini with salad and Peroni draft beer--- my wife had shrimp and pesto pizza...food was delicious and service was perfect. We went early with our kids and it was quite family friendly. Highly recommend this place.
author: Mark L.

description: Very disappointed.  Ordered the Pizza Americana which said pepperoni and sausage, the minestrone soup, and Cesar salad.  When our order arrived I thought they'd brought me the wrong soup.  I was originally told there were two soups:vegetable or minestrone.  What was served was broth and vegetables.  I'd never had minestrone without beans and pasta.  The waiter told me to, "have an open mind about different recipes."  When the pizza came it was only pepperoni.
