I told the server we had the wrong pizza.  The waiter came to the table and said that pepperoni is sausage not pepperoni and sausage.  My son spoke Italian to him and he told us he wasn't Italian.  Still don't know if our order was correct?!?
author: DeAnna G.

description: So delicious. I had the porcini mushroom & truffle oil pizza.  I was so full half way through, but the pizza was absolutely delicious. I told my husband I was going to cry my way through finishing it cause it was worth it. Then he reminded me about dessert. I white boxed it and never looked back. Food, wine, service, location, atmosphere - thumbs up. A must for North Beach/ Russian Hill
author: Val N.

description: We were restaurant hoping.. Trying all the good places downtown. Had the crab ravioli, it was wonderful. Good service. Patio with a good view of the park & the busy city.
author: Mandy C.

description: Tonight we had a fabulous dinner, one that I will remember for a long time. The tuna carpaccio was superb; the fish light and super fresh, simply and perfectly dressed with baby rocket and lemon. My pomodoro and my husband's eggplant Parmesan were standard chestnuts on the menu to be sure, but done to perfection. The berry dessert and espresso were great, as well as the house wine. Vicente remembered us, and we had loud NY Italians talking food at the next table. What more do you want?
author: Grace G.

description:
Based on reviews here and on Open Table, we decided to give this place a shot, as it was near Cobb's.  After all, how bad can it be?  Well...pretty bad.  We were seated right away, and the service was fine.  The problems with the food began right away.  The bread was tasteless and chewy - more like Safeway bakery bread, than Italian bread.  We ordered the "special" "homemade" crabcakes to start.  They may have been made on premises, but the crab was definitely not fresh.  They were flabby, thin, oily, and consisted primarily of Progresso breadcrumbs.  
On to the pasta.  I make a pretty good Carbonara at home, and was curious to see what a good restaurant version would be like.  I guess I should have waited until we were at a good restaurant. Here, it was absolutely disgusting.  The spaghetti was drowned in a watery, oily, eggy substance, which tasted primarily of raw garlic and green onions.  I have only ever wanted to send back any restaurant dish once before, and if it weren't for our upcoming show, this would have been the second.  It was practically inedible.  I ate it only because I was starving and in a rush to get to the show.  The best part was the semi-cooked bacon, which I picked at to get some protein out of the meal.  I can't recall ever leaving a dish of pasta half-eaten, but I couldn't bear to finish it.
My partner had the Fettuccine all´ Amatriciana billed as "Sautéed onion, pancetta and Gino's meatballs (Winner of 2009 Boss of the Sauce). The sauce had no discernable evidence of pancetta or onion, it did have a distinct metallic taste of canned tomatoes (generic brand, not San Marzano). The fettucine was harshly over cooked, allowing him to only eat about an inch of pasta at a time.  The meatballs had a passable consistency, but the flavor was hidden by the boss of the sauce. All dishes were garnished with what may be finely chopped (dried?) parsley (see other people's photos). 
The $8 chianti was a decent pour and tasty.
We chose not to even bother with desserts, because there was just no hope after 3 fails and bad bread.  
I hate writing bad reviews of places, but this one is well-deserved.  The prices they charge for such mediocre food is criminal.
Service was friendly and we have no complaints in that regard.
author: L. S.

description:
Super friendly food service by Dottore Rosario
Okay Greek salad with chicken
Okay chicken pesto Panini with large, nice green salad
Nice wine by the glass
Didn't like their bread for some reason
author: Rosquete B.

description: Authentic amazing lasagna. Good service. Very good house wine. I would come back here 100 times!!!!!
author: Tracy W.

description: Romantic Lunch Spot in the Little Italy of San Francisco. My hubby picked the place and I was happy he did. I believe we had the anti pasta and some wine. The rigatoni was delicious and we were very well served the entire time we were there. It's quite a large place so seating will be easy. The service was prompt which we liked because we wanted to stop by for a quick lunch and be on our way for more exploring of the city. I highly recommend eating in Little Italy, this just happened to be the place that drew us in (there was a pretty girl outside with a menu so we just went with it). Great Italian Food!
author: Vanessa F.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE. TOURIST TRAP. 

We were looking for some good Italian food in North beach neighborhood and of all the places we ended up choosing this awful place. Worst Italian food (lobster ravioli) I have had in recent times. The thing is since Italian food is based on simple ingredients and simple  cooking process, one can only wonder how they can mess it up so bad.
author: Abi K.

description:
My friends and I decided to try this place out because it was close to our original destination -- XOX Truffles.  Nonetheless, this restaurant was pretty cozy.  The ambience is quite nice, outdoor seating was plentiful, and the indoor seating was tight, but appropriate for a place like this in San Francisco.

The food on the other hand was a bit sub-par in my opinion.  I've tried a lot of Italian at a lot of places all over, but this one was disappointing.  I think this store is a bit more Americanized and catered for tourists.  For the price that was charged, I think it was sub-par.  I would expect better quality and better food for the price.

The parking is hard to find, streetside only, and most likely, you will walk a few blocks to get to it.  For me, if you are in the area and looking for a quick lunch and you don't mind Americanized Italian, then this place is okay.  If you're going to make a special trip, I would not recommend this place at all.
author: Thomas Ticha P.

description: We went here this past weekend for dinner and I remember having a much better experience the first time. We got the veggie platter that they have as an appetizer which is grilled veggies with some meat and cheese - Antipasto Italiano. It was good and expected as last time. My bf got the Cappellini con Pomodorini which was pretty basic. I got a Greca Salad with prawns - this has got to be the most underwhwelming salad ever. I was expecting a lot more and also for $5 extra, I got 3 prawns. Really?? I'm not sure why either but the balsamic vingerette was SUPER thick. The salad was not impressive at all. My friend got the Lobster Ravioli which was ok as well but nothing omg about it. The service was not that great this time either. It took the waiter forever to come and take our order and at some point the water bottle that they have disappeared. For the price, the food was not worth it all.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: I came across this restaurant while walking down Columbus with a friend. We sat at a window seat and enjoyed a delicious meal and appreciated the attentive staff.
author: Andrea R.

description: 5 stars for spectacular pizza.  I am starting to be somewhat of an officianado of pizza and for my personal taste, this place is the bomb.  Went to Tony's last night which was very good, but after a promise of another 1-1/2 hr wait we ended up here.  This was far superior.
author: Mark H.

description: After strolling Columbus Avenue on a Friday night (during the World Series) we settled on Piazza Pellegrini in order to sit outside and enjoy the street life.  We had had a big day in Napa and so wanted to eat a light meal.  We started out ordering the Fritti Misto (to share) and wanted to follow with a salad each and then a pizza to share.  Our waiter was so wonderful -- he chatted with us about how much we really wanted to eat and then suggested that we just go with the salads and pizza, and then perhaps dessert if that wasn'r enough.  Boy,  was he right!  The Mista Salads were very good and the Sausage and Mushroom pizza was more than enough for the two of us.  We finished with another round of Moretti and espresso.  Great conversation with the wait staff and a really fun evening in North Beach.
author: Geralyn H.

description: I ate dinner and breakfast here. For dinner I had antipasto Italiano. It was great! We also had  crab cakes and a spaghetti ai frutti de Mar. All dishes were great! There was no one in the restaurant when I went for breakfast. I the best breakfast I've ever had. It had gnocchi and potatoes with two poached eggs over the top. The eggs were cooked perfectly. I don't recall the name of the dish.
author: Steve M.

description:
I cant tell you...You really need to experience this place. All the wait staff is incredible! Amazing Olive Oil and Balsamic, yummmmmmmay!
Gnocchi-Devine...My sister always gets this!
Pizza Margharita-Manna...sent from the gods...
Caprese Panini-again, Divinity
Crab Ravioli!!!! I almost killed my little sister...I wanted her to try it because it was so good. She went...mhhhh....uhhh, is there seafood in this? You know I'm allergic!!! My bad...she liked the flavor though~
Just go:)
author: Ginger R.

description: Wish I could have given it more stars because the food was really good. That being said the service was the worst I've ever had. I ordered a 1/2 bottle of cabernet and he brought a 1/2 bottle of chianti. I didn't want to make a deal of it so we took it, since he opened it. After he took our order I told him of the error and that it was ok we'd drink the chianti anyway. No biggie. After waiting an hour for our food we decided to see what the problem was. The waiter never put the order in. He came and asked us what we order a second time. We waited. We asked for more bread. Never came. We waited some more. He came a THIRD time to ask for our order. Now they are rushing as we've been there almost 1 1/2 hours waiting for food. So two of the four orders were off... the ravioli was not cooked thru nor the pizza because they rushed it. Too bad the gnocchi were really good and so was the chicken. Too many good Italian restaurants in SF to bother to wait forever here.
author: mariellen g.

description: My stuffed chicken was good.  Wifes get slf was under seasoned.  Good was very very slow.  Even kn San Fran for the $ we expected better service
author: Tom C.

description:
The food is excellent and the smells as you walk by, but there's always something that pops up. We have eaten here before, and they stuck us by the window, which is a tight spot. We were brought stale bread right off, and stale bread just doesn't do the trick of making one feel good about the food, but I knew the food would be good. I ordered the shell pasta with broccoli and spicy sausages (remember I don't like spicy) and it was delicious. The taste was great with garlic. Sis had her usual italian restaurant dish of spaghetti and the meatballs were HUGE and obviously hand-made! She had a dessert though I don't know which one but she described it as four round puff-balls filled with ice cream, covered with poured strips of chocolate, while I settled for a latte espresso. The only bad of this location was that after ten minutes of sitting there initially, I got up and cornered the waiter next to the kitchen to say we were ready to order; he followed me to the table and took our orders. Otherwise, very delicious food and great smells. No parking, only street parking and a garage around the corner....  it was half filled when we entered and when we left it was packed. The outside tables have very effective heating lamps. I give it three stars because I had to chase down the waiter...  

NOTE: Went back two days later with sis and tried the lobster ravioli. The sauce was delicious but the ravioli itself was lacking. it was dry and actually thought it was egg yolk! I covered each ravioli with the sauce and that "fixed" the dryness. 

Looking at their online menu, I remember seeing many groups eating here and wonder if they are aware of the SF-norm of adding "18% Gratuity will be added to parties of six or more"? Something to remember and be aware of - also wonder if they inform large parties of this added expense?
author: Tony L.

description:
House made lobster ravioli was amazingly delicious. The squid ink ravioli skin was a nice surprise. Would drive all the way to SF again just to have this dish.

Service was outstanding as our waiter was very friendly and attentive. We had a very pleasant dining experience here.
author: Eric L.

description: Great wine, great caprese, great seafood, great service, attractive hostesses.  Five stars.
author: Nicholas A.

description: MEDIOCRE food and AWFUL service.  When I go out to eat and spend $78 on a meal I would like it to be better than something I can prepare at home and get a server that tends to my table in a timely and polite manner...Piazza Pellegrini did not measure up.  Chef Boy-ar-dee would have been comparable in taste and more satisfying in service - I could have opened the can myself and gotten my own drinks and not dealt with the server's remarks.
author: Tyler D.

description:
After picking up my boyfriend from his first week on the new job, we decided to go out to dinner in the city instead of cooking at home.  We headed to the North Beach area and found parking quicker then usual, on a busy Friday night.  Since he had more experience with all the restaurants in the area he quickly picked one that he had not frequented.

We where seated pretty quick 10 min wait at most, seated outside.  We had time to look at the menu and made our choices.  We started off with the mixed calamari shrimp.  Calamari was lacking seasoning but with a drizzle of lemon and the home made marinara sauce made the dish.  For my main course I had the risotto and scallops.  The risotto was cooked al dente in a saffron sauce and sprinkled fresh chopped bell pepper.  The sweetness and random crunch of the bell pepper played well with each fork full.  The scallops where huge, plump, and cooked perfectly.  I would of liked at least one more scallop on the plate.  The ratio of scallop to risotto was off.  

The service was great, very friendly but a bit slow.  This place somewhere to come and relax and enjoy the night.  On a warm night I might add.  If in the area I would come back and try some of the other dishes.
author: David P.

description:
My boyfriend and I visited San Francisco this past weekend, and we went to Piazza Pellegrini for lunch on Monday afternoon on our way to the Fisherman's Wharf. We were attracted by the cute outdoor tables (as well as the cute hostess who was luring costumers in) and decided to stop after checking out their impressive menu.

We got the outdoor table of our choice and were immediately served ice water and fresh white bread with balsamic vinegar and oil while we read the menu more closely. I ordered the Insalata Greca (Greek salad) with prawns and my beau ordered the Conchiglie con Broccoli e Salsicce (shell pasta with broccoli and sausage; the waiter was very helpful with our pronunciation). We had to wait a little while, but we could hear the food being prepared in the kitchen right behind us; I could smell the aromas coming from the window! We soaked up the beautiful summer weather while we waited.

My salad was a bit small, but very tasty. It had romaine lettuce with cucumbers, tomatoes, red and yellow peppers, olives, and feta cheese. It came with three grilled prawns on a skewer. I enjoyed it, but wished there had been more! Also, the prawns were a bit oily for my taste, but they were well-flavored. The Conchiglie dish was "stupendous," said my boyfriend. It was classic Italian cooking--simple, but rich in flavor. The hostess had also said that the pasta was homemade, which makes it extra special.

While we were eating, a tour bus passed by, and the driver announced on his PA that this was his favorite restaurant in the North Beach area, with delicious homecooked food and a "bella donna" (the hostess) in front. She blushed, and we nodded in agreement.

Usually we don't order dessert after lunch, but we were curious. The hostess recommended the tiramisú (she said it was the best she had ever had), but we went with the Macedonia di Frutta, which was just fruit salad with a scoop of vanilla bean gelato on top. It was fresh and tasty, a perfect coda to our meal.

With restaurants you usually get what you pay for, and even though you may pay a bit more here, at Piazza Pellegrini, it is definitely worth it. Buon appetito!
author: Kate S.

description: Gnocchi which we shared as appetizer was excellent. I had Risotto seafood special which was gritty and not very flavorful .   My son has crab ravioli which he thought was excellent. Slow service but as long as you're patient I would recommend giving this a try
author: Clayton A.

description:
I have lived in San Francisco for three years and food is really good, Wine is excellent,
service is superb.

what is there to complain about "5" STARS
author: August S.

description: The seafood here is to die for. We had the Frutti di Mare and the lobster ravioli and on another occasion had the petrale sole. I would love to come back for lunch to try the paninis. I expected that our leftovers would be mushy and nasty the next day but they were actually more delicious as the pasta held up great and the flavors had soaked into the pasta without making it mushy. Good stuff I tell ya. My ideal date is to order some seafood and a glass of wine and sit out front and people watch.
author: Beini Q.

description: Great service price was good food was good. I wasn't disappointed best perk free parking in the back! Good portions!
author: Lydia M.

description:
A solid 4 stars.  Great meal.  One of their specialities is raviolis, so at the prompting of our waiter I had the spinach ravioli, which he assured me was not overwhelmingly pine nutty.  I hate too many pine nuts in the same place at once.  Ick.  He was right.  They were delish.  I hear from a friend that the pumpkin ravioli dish is even better.

Amazing staff -- the perfect amount of humor and attentiveness.

Outdoor seating with cute little green mosaic tiles.

The bread was fresh and succulent.  I am usually not a bread eater, but it was sooo good I couldn't resist.  The balsamic/olive oil that goes with it was a unique flavor.  A bit sweeter than usual.  Yummy.

It's a great place to people watch, toss back some delicious food and a bottle of the house red, and enjoy life.
author: Bliss F.

description: The service was excellent!! The waiters were very thoughtful and polite. My family felt extremely comfortable and relaxed throughout the night. I had the special squid ink pasta with salmon and absolutely loved it. Good food, good service= Will definitely return with friends and family again.
author: R C.

description:
We came here because it was advertised as kid friendly.  The service was fine and the waiters kept an eye on our toddler who would run towards the door.
However, we did not think that we got good value for our money. The food was just OK and the portions mediocre.  I ate at better Italian restaurants during my trip to California.
author: Taltul N.

description: Well yet another decent but nothing special fancy so called Italian Restaurant in North Beach's Little Italy. I will say Little Italy really isn't much of anything compared to places I have eaten at in Chicago. I purchased the gnocci. It was good I will say that but it was not nearly as good as it probably should have been. Will I come here again most likely not, I have no reason to eat here again. There was a good atmosphere among the place until I saw that the Television was just a DVD that they had on replay........ Ok I thought we were in a restaurant not a retail store. Either have the TV playing something proper or do away with the TV. The place seemed a little run down and could of used some renovating at the same time.
author: Kyle R.

description:
Don't waste your time and money. I know Italian food and this place serves mediocre food at best. Trust me...you'll end up paying big $$ and will be dissatisfied. My family was not excited about their food either. Pizza was their better plate and it got a 7 on a 1-10 scale. The owner needs to taste the food and see what other Italian eateries around town are serving. 

I won't ever eat here again and I do not recommend it. Sorry but I would have liked to have read a post like mine before I wasted my money here. You've been warned.
author: Jorge S.

description: Not really that Italian and they constanty clean tables with the most awful smelling stuff.
author: Frank C.

description:
Loved our Italian waiter - cute, personable, and full of suggestions on what to eat. If you get the American guy, don't expect to have nearly as much fun.

My Caesar salad was tasty. I only wish they'd let me finish it before clearing the plate. In terms of antipasti, you cannot go wrong ordering the Funghi Portobello con Polenta (grilled Portobello mushrooms in a red wine reduction over soft polenta) or the Timballo di Verdura (grilled vegetables and mozzarella).

I ordered the Osso Buco (braised lamb shank) which was delicious. Served with creamy polenta and vegetables - it was an excellent dish.

Major disappointment of the night - the wine. We ordered the Barbera after a companion who'd been before cautioned us against the Montepulciano. I've had good Barbera. This was barely passable.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Food:
It's a hit or a miss depending on what you order.  My pollo pesto sandwich dish was definitely a miss.  There was no flavor at all so I had to sprinkle some salt and pepper on everything except the salad.  The salad dressing was actually flavorful which made the salad taste better than anything else in the dish. Although my friend enjoyed her Eggs Benedict breakfast dish bc they poached the eggs right, she had to add salt and pepper to it...(lacked some flavor).  So, you may be better off ordering Pastas.  My other friend's pasta dish definitely smelled good and she cleaned her plate.  So I'd assume that Pastas are more of their forte.  Oh!  And before I forget, we found a strand of our waitress' hair in our complimentary bread basket. No one in our group had that strand of hair color but her.  But, we didn't want to make a big deal out of it since there weren't that much bread left so we didn't complain... but,  it's still unsanitary. 

Service:
They were accommodating with adding more seats when more and more of our friends showed up.  However,  we realized that they overcharged us on our coffee order; the menu said $3, but they charged us $4.  They later claimed that the menu was outdated/old and the price had gone up.  And with that said, they did not bother honoring what the menu stated.  Although the matter is small since this is about $1 difference, they definitely did not handle it professionally with great customer service and honor their advertised price.

I don't plan on returning to this place as the are many other Italian restaurants nearby with better food and service.
author: Wendy T.

description:
So I was walking by that same waiter from before who would say stupid shit to people, and I half expected him to tell me that I dropped my glasses or something but all he could muster out was, "You're beautiful." 

They just lost a star.
author: Natasha P.

description:
WARNING: VOMIT/FOOD POISONING ALERT


 Ate here yesterday with my date.  We split an antipasto of carpaccio and arugula salad.

For the course, she ate the dungeness crab ravioli.
I ordered the seafood risotto. It tasted horrible and was buried in tons of butter.  An unhealthy portion of butter in fact.

I had a glass of house Chianti.
She had a glass of Sangeovese.

I tried some of her crab ravioli and tasted some of her glass of Sangeovese wine.

Dinner was served with stale bread and stale oil and balsamic vinegar.

The carpaccio smelled like skunk and tasted very bad from the juice of the lemon.  The salad also tasted bad with a straight lemon juice dressing.

About 4 hours later, I threw up everything.  Apparently food poisoning.
About 30 minutes ago, she vomitted everything.

I still feel nauseous and have had diarrhea all night.  Obviously, the quality was below health standards.  It completely sucks because I have lots of work to do and will be on a plane to NY in 24 hours.

I had a bad feeling about eating here.  I did not want to eat here, but parking was so bad, we settled for this horrible restaurant.

I was reluctant in eating the seafood risotto which had two clams where the shells were not fully open.  Why do I feel I must finish a plate of food when I know that I do not like it?

Cost of vomitting?  $41 per person.   Do not eat here.

This is the first restaurant I have ever eaten at where my date and I go sick of our stomach of our food.

I will be reporting this place to the Department of Health.
author: Tony U.

description:
There are a lot of choices of Italian restaurants to choose from in North Beach -- unfortunately, this is a MISS.  Service was decent, but the dishes were bland and tasteless.  We ordered the following 3 entrees:

1. Fusilli with Chicken (tomato sauce)
2. Fettuccine with shrimp in a chardonnay saffron sauce
3. Angel Hair pasta with cherry tomatoes (tomato sauce)

All 3 dishes were disappointing.  I had to put a sprinkle of salt on mine just so I can get a bit more taste to it.  We also shared a Pizza Magharita as appetitizer.  Again, it was just OK.  

I wouldn't recommend this place - there are so many other better Italian restaurants in North Beach, you're better off elsewhere.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
I have to say I LOOOOVEEEE this place!I went for lunch and I would stay there till dinner how great it was!Food is amazing,service is great,specially the hostess that works there!Very professional,friendly girl!Good move for the restaurant!

I'll be back for sure!
author: Mandy B.

description: This place was a'ight, I suppose.  We ended up here because we walked a significant amount to get there, and it was close and we didn't feel like walking. Plus Yelp was very helpful in the reviews so we figured it was ok.  What I ordered was very non descript, it's evident because I don't even remember what I ordered, it just didn't leave an impression.  A party of five of us were seated pretty quickly on a Saturday evening though.  On the flip side, the service wasn't all that stupendous.  I mean, we weren't drinking wine or anything but I ordered Pelligrino water for the table and it just never came.  :( We weren't able to flag down our waiter till it was time to pay and by then I just didn't care all that much.
author: Taryn C.

description:
The WORST service I have ever received. My girlfriend and I have been here twice, and each time we have been treated very rudely by the staff. I do not know if it is due to the fact that my girlfriend and I both look like college students, so maybe they assume we will not tip well; nonetheless, we would have received better service at McDonald's. 

The last time we were there, after being seated, we waited about 10-15 minutes before our server approached us. We had not received any bread or drinks, unlike many of the other tables that had arrived after us. When our server, Rosario, did finally arrive, he took our orders and rushed off. The rest of the night we saw our server only when the food came out, and when he wanted the check. When he brought the food out, he offered some pepper for the top. When we said yes, he gave one careless twist, barely putting on any pepper, and walked off (not asking how much we wanted). When my girlfriend asked for some Parmesan for her main dish, he gave her a rude look, and, after a two minute wait, he came back to give a quick two swipes of grated cheese, putting on very little, before turning his back and walking away (again not asking if she would like more). Additionally, I was forced to ask one of the bus boys for a refill on my diet coke because our server, Rosario, was too busy flirting for a good 5 minutes with women at all his other tables. 

Disregarding the terrible and disrespectful service, the food each time has been excellent. The bruschetta is a fantastic appetizer, with four slices (two with tomatoes and two with mushroom and mozzarella). Additonaly, the entrees are well presented and delicious. The first time I ordered the Chicken Parmesan, and my girlfriend the pesto ravioli. The second time I ordered Chicken Saltimboca alla Piemontese and my girlfriend ordered the Conchiglie con Broccoli e Salsicce. All of them I would highly recommend. The only food that was not that the greatest was the bread. It was very stiff and seemed stale. 

To summarize, the food at this place is well presented and tastes fantastic. This is the ONLY reason I will not give this place a one star rating. However, the TERRIBLE SERVICE that we received  is absolutely inexcusable. I am not an angry person, but each time I have walked out of the restaurant feeling disrespected and pissed off.  So unless you are a pretty woman that the servers will flirt with, or look like an extremely wealthy customer,  AVOID THIS PLACE.
author: Tagart S.

description: This place serves real Italian food made fresh. It's our second time here and we love it. Friendly staff too!
author: James J.

description: Nice spot. Enjoyable meal and hospitable service.
author: Heather S.

description:
We had the Roasted Leg of Lamb Panini w/ cucumber salad.  It was scrumptious.  The salad was so good that I failed to mention there was no cucumber in the salad.  One of the best Italian dressings I have ever had.

The Torta della Nonna (Lemon custard tart with pine nuts) for desert complemented a very nice meal.

This place was recommended by a housekeeper at the hotel we were staying at.
author: David U.

description:
great location
great service
great food
pricey by my standards for Italian food even in San Fran.
But if you want Italian I recommend.
author: Native D.

description:
On a wonderfully warm SF night, my parents and I decided to leave the Mission.  This was the first restaurant we stopped to read the menu at and quickly made a decision to stay.  Man, were we lucky.  

We had a great meal!  We all had pasta, I had the puttanesca, my dad an alfredo with prawns, and my mom the frutti di mare.  The portions were generous and each dish was so flavorful.  We were shocked at the amount of seafood in my moms dish.  Some restaurants tend to skimp on the amount of mussels/clams in the dish.  Not this place.  We counted something like 12 bivavles in her dish, plus the giant prawns and fish pieces.  

For dessert, we had the tiramisu and the apple crostata.  Both were diet-breaking deliciousness! 

Our waiter was so attentive and personable.  He made beer and wine recommendations for my dad, and my dad was very pleased with what was served.  We were very impressed with the flavor of the food, the staff and the atmosphere of the place.  The hostess was very warm and sat us immediately.  We will definitely return to try different items from the menu.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: This place is cute! Went here for our monthly dinner club and I had the greco salad and the eggplant parm.....best eggplant I've had in a looooooooooooooooog time. Salad could have been more plentiful....lettuce wise, all the goodies were the right amount in it but more lettuce would have been perfect! I did think it was a little bit pricey for eggplant $19.95....probably more of a 13-15 dollar value but it was awesome. We also got complimentary bruschetta but reading other reviews, it looks like something nice they do- keep doing it!!!
author: Ricquel N.

description: Excellent food and great atmosphere. I had the homemade lasagna and it was to die for! The Tirimasu was some of the best I have ever had.
author: Chris D.

description: Was meeting friends on a Sunday night and asked a number of locals where I could get the best casual Italian.  Everyone I asked recommended coming here, and they were right. Fast, friendly, attentive service. Decent wine list. My carbonara was very tasty,  although the sauce was a little thick. The gnocchi was light and fabulous. My favorite Italian ever?  No. But just fine for a simple meal with friends.
author: Fred K.

description: Good location, good service, good cheese pizza and pesto linguini.  Price seemed reasonable.  Not spectacular but good enough for a last-minute drop in.
author: Damon W.

description:
Wonderful surprise!  My girlfriend and I were spending the weekend in SF for her birthday.  We had tickets to the Cobb Comedy, the late show, and had plenty of time for dinner.  We were actually walking to a different restaurant, when we stopped in our tracks from the wonderful smell coming from this restaurant.  They had nice outdoor seating with great heat lamps.  The inside was nice too, but as the weather was so clear, and the heat lamps kept us warm (it was about 40 degrees outside) we chose to eat outside.  The wait staff was great.  I had the petrale sole.  It was AWESOME!!  My friend had gnocchi's, which was a large portion that she couldn't finish.  
I'm very excited to have found a new favorite North Beach restaurant.
author: Steffani T.

description:
A few tips for a higher rating: (1) Don't call it a panini if you're not going to grill it. (2) Buy bread more than twice a week - my roll was so stale and dry it was falling apart. (3) Roast the lamb for your roast-lamb "panini" more than once a week. When it starts to turn bad, no amount of cucumber relish can hide the sour taste of taint.  (4) Spend more time in the kitchen, less time yelling your specials to passing tourists on the double-decker bus.

To sum up, I think I may have found the worst excuse for an Italian restaurant in North Beach. Heed my warning or you will be wallet-raped and quite possibly get sick.
author: Stuart M.

description: I had a good meal here.  Pasta All'Amatriciana.  Had two real nice meatballs as well.  Sauce was not overpowering and amount was good.  A tad pricey for lunch at $20, but on the whole, the experience was a pleasant one, so worth the price.  Had a big mug of some Italian beer on tap, I can't recall, but it was good.  Bread assortment excellent and fresh.  Nice service.  A bit away from the madness further up Columbus, which is sort of nice.  Probably could get a better value elsewhere, but I'd recommend this spot.
author: Marc S.

description:
Mediocre food, dreadful service.  What else do you need to know?

We were feeling lazy and hungry a few weeks ago, and this place is 1 block from our apartment, so we decided to give it another try, although we weren't overly impressed in the past.

It was a Sunday evening, but just to be sure, we called to see if we could be seated if we came right by. Sure, the man on the phone said. I have a table ready.

Once we arrived, we had to try to convey this to the (new) (English-challenged) hostess.  After conferring with someone inside a few times, she came back to say to it would be 10-15 minutes.  We're irritated, but she's charming, and instead of walking away, we take a seat outside as she suggested.

After a bit, a waiter came by with menus. We explained we were just waiting for a table inside. He said, oh, you can't sit here.  Wait at the bar.  Are there 2 seats at the bar? we ask.  Yes, sure, he says. 

Are there? Of course not.  We really should have left at this point, but we see an empty table for 2 waiting to be set.  So I take the one seat at the bar and order a glass of wine.  We watch the table, watch the waiters come and go, and nothing happens.  No one looks at us, and no one sets the table. The wine?  $9/glass, it's a horrible cheap Pinot.  That is the final straw.  We pay for the untouched wine and walk out.

Down the street, we had a perfectly lovely, delicious meal with superb service at Pinoccho.  Morale of the story:  don't be so damn lazy.  There are much better restaurants than this within a a few blocks or less.
author: Martha M.

description:
Ok, so after months of frequenting this place, I decided to review it.  I have to give it a 5 to offset all the negative reviews.

First, if you come to a real Italian restaurant, don't expect the most attentive service.  They'll ignore you for a bit, and then treat you like you're family.  It's just the way it is.  Get over it, and be more aggressive when you need something.

Only order:  
- Bruschetta.  They usually put truffle oil on the mushrooms, but they haven't been doing so the last few times.
- Caprese salad.  This is tomato, mozzarella, and basil salad.  Something about the mozzarella cheese brine gives it a slightly salty flavor to it.  It might not be for everyone, but it's a total homerun for me.  
- Ravioli with homemade pesto sauce.  I've gone here with a group of 5.  We ordered 5 raviolis.  See my pictures.  Enough said.

Everything else, I don't know.  I haven't strayed from my normal.
author: Steve A.

description:
The food was alright. Not too bad. It was a bit pricey, the service was a bit slow and multiple times I honestly thought the waiter forgot about us, and he did once. He forgot to bring us a plate of olive oil, I had to find someone else to grab a plate for me. 

We ordered an appetizer, since it was all priced at 10.95, we just chose the most expensive once which was the clams and mussels. The mussels were tiny!!! Maybe because it wasn't in season but whatever. The sauce was pretty good tasting though.

Then we ordered the pizza magherita, it taste pretty good. A little bit too salty tho. 

I didn't eat the ravioli's but the girl at the table next to me sound mad when her plate of ravioli came out....because it was maybe around $20 and she only got 3 pieces.
author: Carmen P.

description: The tables here are tightly packed and the restaurant is kind of loud and bustling, but we had a good experience here.  The wait staff was very attentive and friendly, and the manager personally came to our table to check in on our experience.  I tried the chicken with prosciutto and the fettuccine with shrimp, peas, and scallions.  After a couple of glasses of wine I was too full for dessert.  The bread served alongside was just okay, it was a bit dry. Overall, we really enjoyed the food and attentive service.
author: Sara D.

description: This was the first place I ever ate at in San Francisco, and it is excellent! I had the crab ravioli, while the others dining with me had a pesto spaghetti and a pasta dish with "black noodles". All the food was great and service was great as well. Couldn't ask for a better Italian meal... Note: is a little pricy.
author: Cody R.

description:
The Good:
Wine list is great. We all shared a bottle of Pinot from Mendocino county (it was on the specials list so the name escapes me).
Antipasto Italiano -- eggplant, zucchini, olives, prosciutto, mozzarella. Mama mia!
Torta Caprese -- flourless chocolate cake with a light raspberry sauce underneath. The best part is the whipped cream!
Lobster Ravioli -- I only had a bite of this one but I loved it! 
Service -- waiters were friendly, welcoming and the Italian accent makes it all the better. You seem to enjoy your meal more when someone serves you and says "Cappellini para la ragazza."

The Not-as-good:
Cappellini with fresh crab meat -- it had generous amounts of crab meat, and two additional crab legs on top. I was provided with the tools to break them open and did so without hesitation. The pasta was dry and didn't have a lot of flavor. Give me some olive oil, lemon, butter, something!! Needless to say, i did take home the leftovers and played around with it the next morning so I could enjoy it.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
Holy Ravioli...

After a quick jont up to the Bay from LA for a weekend to meet the 'Rents I soon decided that Italian was in order after when they started talking chains for dinner.

Although I've never been, I asked around, Yelp'ed, and even scoped the 'hood before finally establishing that this joint would be the choice of the evening. 

The location as others say, is spot on. Fantastic North Beach location, prime outdoor seating, and flowing Italian accents.

The food is spot on, probably one of the best Caesar salads I've ever had, very tart dressing, mmmm.

The Crab Ravioli was right on the money too, fresh delicious homemade ravioli engulfed in a fantastic cream sauce packed with succulent crab that literally gives your mouth an orgasm. 

I'd be very willing to make this place a norm while in the bay however after viewing our bill, which was absurdly more expensive than we had figured, (high 1's) I'd opt for a slice of pizza somewhere.
author: Patrick O.

description: Their pizza was great! We had three servers, so I certainly can't complain about the service. We had a party of seven so I know we could use the extra help. The pasta dishes looked so fresh, my mouth was literally watering.
author: Lisa S.

description: Following our hike up to (and down from) Coit Tower, we were hungry and still searching for a SF cioppino experience.  We crossed Washington Park, and saw a pleasantly inviting eatery across the street.  After a quick check of the menu, and a Yelp "reality check" on the smart phone, we were seated indoors at Piazza Pellegrini.  What a fantastic place to stumble-upon!  The tables are tight, the noise levels elevated and the service (excellent and attentive) decidedly continental in its pace.  This simply added to the experience, and what an experience it was!  I believe that family, God and country are "to die for," rather than great food-- but the Dungeness cioppino definitely pushed the envelope.  Absolutely brimming with a half dozen crustacean varieties in a rich tomato base, the layering of flavors was both sublime and unrestrained.  This was clearly a lunch to savor on a sunny Sunday afternoon, and one to remember for years to come.  Highly recommended.
author: Steve G.

description:
Three out of four of my Bff's and I came here for dinner on a gorgeous Saturday evening.  We were indecisive about where to go, I mean North Beach has so many great places to eat and drink. After walking around a bit we decided to come to Piazza Pellegrini, what a great choice. We sat in a great place inside able to see all the people out and about in North Beach. We started with Sparkling wine delicious and everyone must buy a bottle, and their Marguerite pizza yum yum!

I ate the salmon with spinach and potatoes, must try. My friend had the meat lasagna which was given two thumbs up and the other two had pasta with a tasty creamy sauce with meat,  which was also a fave.  The staff were attentive especially that it took no time for every table occupied with hunger customers.  ¡Besos y Gracias, mu-ah!
author: Jennifer M.

description: I'm disappointed I can't give this a higher rating after reading good reviews but toinight's dinner was below par. We walked by today, looked at the menu, checked reviews & thought it looked good. The bread they brought to our table was cold & damp but even when warmed, was not good.  We ordered for appetizer the calamari & shrimp fritti- shrimp good, calamari we're bit rubbery, marinara sauce good but nothing special.  My husband (Italian) ordered his favorite Osso Buco- which came with a weird sauce that changed the entire flavor-too bad as it was cooked to perfection. The penne he got instead of risotto was undercooked-not even close to al dente. I tried the paparadelle with short rib ragu. I didn't care for the ragu -it had the same odd flavor as the Osso buco. It was reolaced by the angel hair Pomodoro-which was very good. The wait staff was very professional and friendly. They seemed to be concerned if our food was ok but when my husband mentioned the undercooked pasta to one of the staff, they seemed to go check but never returned. We decided nor to stay for dessert. Sadly, we cannot recommend this restaurant.
author: Gloria L.

description: Ten of us had dinner here Friday night.  Everyone had something different and we all enjoyed what we ordered, from scallops to prime rib to chicken parmagiana.  I had the insalata caprese, spaghetti alla carbonara and affogato.  My friend had one of the best desserts I've ever had, crostata di mele, which is similar to tarte tatin.  Service was impeccable and it had a great atmosphere.  Prices were not out of line; I will definitely eat here again the next time I am in San Francisco.
author: Kathy W.

description:
The outdoor seating drew my boyfriend and I into he restaurant on a Sunday afternoon. We were greeted pretty immediately and orders taken quickly. The stale bread was brought cold to the table with some oil, it was awful!

I ordered the eggplant parm, my fav italian dish! the eggplant came out steaming hot, in a dish surrounded by sauce and grease. I felt like I was eating a pile of mush that was flavored by eggplant. It also came with a side of penne pasta in a red sauce with peas. Although al dente, it was ice cold. My boyfriend chose the smoked salmon ravioli. They were ok, but not for the 29.00 price tag, he only got five (very small,) underflavored raviolis in a cream sauce. Unexciting!

Please note that I had thought about saying something about the pasta being cold, to see if I could get a fresh dish, however, the waiter did not return until our alrrady done plates had been sitting there for a good ten minutes. 

Fast forward to the check. We actually had to get up to find the waiter to ring our card because we waited so long. He was inside chatting with the other servers.

Less than thrilled with the food! Quite a shame too.
author: Amanda H.

description: We ate here for a Mother's Day lunch with a group of 7. The service was excellent. I loved that our waiter was Italian (imagine that!). I ordered the carbonara, it was ok (my homemade is waaaay better:). My boyfriend ordered the Papperdelle Ragu - it was excellent! Super yummy. Everyone else at our table enjoyed their food as well. I think it is a great place for a tradiitonal, moderately priced Italian meal in the heart of North Beach.
author: Deborah M.

description: The hostess and waiters were awesome.. always at our service.. was kind of disappointed because we had to eat outside and it was cold.. the heater outside kept shutting off and on... and i kept smelling propane.. yuck.. other than that .. Piazza Pellegrini was a very nice place to eat.. food was good.. ive definitely had better italian food.. bread was kind of dry tasting.. the mista salad was delicious.. and the short ribs with pasta my husband had was really delicious.. would come back.. but next trip would like to try another italian place.. it is street parking.. we got lucky and someone pull out in front of the restaurant.. just luck lol..
author: Elena M.

description:
This place is my favorite Italian restaurant in SF thus far.  Only because I order the same dish every time - Homemade Papperdelle Pelligrini.  It is so incredibly good,  I want to order two every time!  The Funghi Portabello con Polenta is a staple in my order as well. 

The service is friendly.  Although, it is better when you have a smaller group.  One improvement for them to consider?  Is their Cioppino. My friend ordered it one night, and it smelled rancid.  We asked the waiter to exchange it, but he said that is our it is supposed to be.  Growing up, my dad had an Italian restaurant, and his Cioppino smelled nothing like that!
author: Rachel B.

description: Had stopped in for pizza with a few friends.  A few minutes after ordering we were informed they were "out of pizza". The other two items, Meat Ravioli and Caesar Salad, were both horrible, almost inedible. We paid and bought a slice at Tonys across the street, which was delicious.
author: Chris L.

description:
The hubby and I ate here on a warm January evening and it was great!  We sat outside and it was a bit noisy and close to the street, but that's what you get when you sit outside.  We knew what we were getting into when we chose to sit there.  The gnocchi was delicious and the wine the waiter suggested paired very nicely with everything we chose.  

Food--good
Service- outstanding.  Friendly and attentive even though they were busy.
Atmosphere- noisy but I love people watching!
author: Susan C.

description:
This is definitely more of a tourist trap restaurant with all the Italian accents flying around and beautiful outdoor seating in prime North Beach location. With that said, the food itself should also garner PP some attraction because it is legit. 

Since I couldn't comprehend like half the menu, I ended up ordering the special since it was explained in English. During the 3 minute explanation of the specials, I pretty much just heard "steak" and "very big"--knew it was a winner then. 10 minutes later, the waiter walks out with half a cow on a plate (rib eye the size of my head). I was very impressed and so were all the bystanders walking along Columbus since I was sitting virtually on the sidewalk area. My fat piece of steak definitely caught more attention than the strip clubs down the street. The steak was grilled perfectly so it also tasted fantastic. I still can't believe I demolished this thing.
author: Ed L.

description:
I heard a horror story about Piazza Pellegrini, so I was skeptical about dining there. Luckily my fear subsided with my amazing meal. The atmosphere is festive, service is friendly, and the portion sizes are plentiful. They gave us complimentary bruschetta that they claimed was for making a rezzy. It was really good, garlicky with juicy tomatoes. We had the Salsicce con polenta: grilled spicy Italian sausage in a roasted bell pepper sauce, served over polenta. It was quite tasty, the polenta was some of the best I've ever had. We also had the Saltimboca alla Piemontese: chicken filled with prosciutto & mozzarella in cream sage sauce. This was delish. Large variety of sautéed veggies, crunchy seasoned potatoes & two large chicken breasts. The sauce on the chicken wasn't too heavy and was really flavorful. There was so much food, I was able to bring an entire chicken breast home for leftovers. Pellegrini is slightly pricey, but for the portion sizes and food quality it's worth it.

For a more detailed review visit:
http://consumingcolumbus.blogspot.com/2013/03/piazza-pellegrini-pleases.html
author: Elizabeth C.

description: You have to get a bottle of their spicy olive oil. Its worth stopping by just for that.  That bring said, the food and service are excellent!
author: John C.

description:
Awesome Italian food. Ate here the other evening and shared the Spaghetti ai Frutti di Mare and the Gnocchi. Both were excellent. The spaghetti was full of flavor and was full of juicy mussels, shrimp and fish. Probably the best Frutti di Mare I ever had. The Gnocchi was also excellent with chunks of Italian sausage, asparagus and snow peas. They also had half bottles of win and their merlot was excellent. 

The staff was running an efficient operation with 2 cooks, 1 waiter, 1 greeter and 1 person bussing tables. Service was firendly and the atmosphere could not be beat whether you were sitting indoors or along the sidewalk. Dessert consisted of a great chocolate canneloni filled with ricotta and candied fruits. Highly recommended.
author: Oscar C.

description:
The bread they serve is not very good, in my opinion.  But if you put enough balsamic on it, it is edible.

I ordered the polenta mushroom appetizer and a salad.  The salas was really great, but the polenta was mushy (I imagined it would be crispy or at least in a patty of sorts) and the mushrooms were too rich, oversalted.  I couldn't finish it all and left a little unsatisfied.

My husband had ravioli and he really liked it, it was the perfect amount of food too. 

I would have loved it if they served their pastas by the half size.  My perfect meal would be a half of pasta and salad.  Since I was on vacation with no fridge in my room I couldn't take leftovers back, so I didn't want to waste so much pasta.  I should have gotten one of their house made pastas though and I probably would have left a better review.
author: Taryn B.

description: The carbonara was sour and plastic-like, dry, all glued together in a big lump. A lot of onion.
author: Den P.

description: Despite living next to North Beach we've somehow avoided eating down there quite successfully, but on Christmas Night we were led like shepherds to the manger down to Chinatown and then on to NB for some Italian. We made a reservation but arrived a little early and were able to sit outside under a heat lamp and get our grub on with no waiting. The place was packed--according to our waiter no one wants to cook at home anymore on Christmas, but we were completely happy with the service, and the food was delicious. I had the dungeness crab ravioli with a splash of some of their secret pepper olive oil. Delicioso! And my date loved his dish, the fettucini alla amatriciana which won them the Yelp-endorsed "Boss of the Sauce" award for awesomesauce a few years ago.  It was still awesome.
author: Lesly S.

description: Recommended by a family member who lives in the Bay Area, this was one of our favorite meals we had during our stay in San Fran. In fact, it was one of the best Italian meals I've had outside of Italy. The home made gnocchi and tiramisu were ridiculously good!!
author: Allison M.

description:
I went here on a weeknight and sat at the bar. So I cannot comment on the ambience but I did like the small cozy bar. 
The food was excellent. A bit pricey for the place. Osso buco was awesome. Pretty good wine list.
author: V P.

description: We staggered into Piazza Pellegrini after a long day of sightseeing with our two kids (ages 7 & 10) in tow and we were treated wonderfully.  The staff was very friendly and welcoming.  Food was delicious and very fresh.  I love homemade minestrone and theirs is simple and yet so, so good.  Pastas were simply dressed with fresh ingredients that were well prepared.  A definite recommend.
author: Juliet G.

description:
Going to a new italian place in North beach is always a precarious adventure.

I mean.. there's so many good places I know about, and it's so damn easy to step on a grenade.  I swear it's every italian guys dream to move to SF and start an italian resteraunt.  Half of em can't cook for shit though.

I came wiht a decent sized group, and on milady's suggestion ended up here.  The ambiance was very nice, though I was wishing an outside table would open up for us (outdoor eating = joe's fantasy).

My woman was treating tonite so I let her handle the bulk of the order, and she went full blown vegetarian on me (ho!).  Veggie pizza, and the honey nut squash ravioli, of course with a verdechio wine to wash t all down. 

Food was surprisingly good.  The pizza was tasty and the veggie toppings actually added some nice zest.. but hte ravioli stole the show for me.  

Sweet sweet honey nut squashness in every bite, my only regret was how small the meal was.  We both eyed the last ravioli and after a split second of politeness we just split it.

Hard to compare this place to the rest of the italian spots around here, just because my order was so different this time.  I can say I liked the overall experience at viccolettos more, and that the pizza at Tony's was definately better, but this place was still really good (so you don't get 3 stars woohoO!)

I'll probably be back, and then i'll try for a protien meal and see how that goes.    Woohoo!
author: Joseph F.

description:
walking  by 10 years ago,the waiters pulled us in to a great meal with great service.
10 years later, they did it again, same as last time! octopus/greek beans were nicely
marinated and tender. house  cab and p grigio was good.bread could be more sf sourdoughyish. worth going there.
author: Jim R.

description:
I give this place a solid 4 stars, great food in a great atmosphere in a great city. I got the calzone and I think it was the best I've had, the dough was very crispy on the inside so that when you bite into it there is a nice crunch sound. On the inside, the dough was really tender so it wasn't like you had a difficult time biting and eating it at all. They were very generous with the stuffing, a lot of vegetables that were also crisp, which is surprising because its really easy to overcook the vegetables in the calzone because the vegetables get cooked much faster than the dough. So when the vegetables were crisp and not mushy, I think it made me really appreciate the dish. The meat was very flavorable and tender. It was a great dish and you got a lot of food for what you paid for, which I do not think is a lot for good Italian food. I have paid a lot more for much worse quality food.

I loved that all the servers had Italian accents, just makes the whole place seem more authentic. They would say, Chao Bella, to all the ladies as they left and who doesn't want to be called a bella after a lovely dinner. 

To top this place off, it is also a favorite of local SF celebrities. The night I went, Santana, yes the great latin guitar legend was dining there as well. Everyone chatted with him and it was very peaceful, and he seemed to be really good friends with the owners. 

I would definitely recommend this place, it was my first stop on my SF vacation and if I ever head back to SF I know I will stop by this place again.
author: sherry w.

description:
great service/ excellent food/ excellent wine recommendations (both within price and taste ranges that were requested).

Definetly will be back and pass this recomendation onto others!
author: Meg F.

description: Cozy spot with a nice ambiance. God food, nice wine with attentive staff.
author: Dustin W.

description:
I used to love this place but it's gone completely down hill in the last year.  We lived in the neighborhood and would come here once a week.  The osso buco was phenomenal!  Slow-cooked  served on the bone and with the best polenta.  They also have a sea scallop entree with cream risotto that used to be fantastic.  

Now the veal is cut into little pieces (there's about half as much for the same price).  The scallops have good flavor but are smaller.  And both are served with a tasteless vegetable risotto.  

We took my parents here when we were in town last weekend and were embarrassed that this used to be our favorite restaurant.  Pellegrini used to be a diamond in the rough, now it's just another over-priced tourist restaurant.
author: Tizzy P.

description: I recently was working on planning a birthday party for my mom and last minute the restaurant that I originally booked fell through.  My dad made a few calls and Piazza Pellegrini took us in and our large reservation.  The food was amazing, the service was outstanding and the atmosphere couldn't have been better especially with a Giants Win!  It is in walking distance to Beach Blanket Babylon.  Stop in before a show or just stop in to watch a game!  I couldn't recommend a better place in SF!!
author: Casey L.

description: I love love love this place. It's like walking into Italy and having the best food the Italians have to offer. The food is the best in little Italy and just about the best in the city. All the servers and cooks are from Italy and absolutely know how to cook authentic Italian food. Their specials are amazing, ie the lobster ravioli is to die for. Also, their wine list is amazing and reasonably priced. Perfect place for a date, meeting friends, and taking out-of-towners to a nice dinner. The best part about this restaurant is their fresh bread and 40-year aged balsamic vinaigrette. I tell all my friends to try this place at least once, cause once you do you'll want to go back again and again.
author: Hayley H.

description:
This review is only for the desserts and coffee.  I have never eaten here and cannot include the food.

**********************************************************

After dinner at one of my favorite restaurants (1550 Hyde) and then watching Jeanine Garofalo at Cobb's Comedy Club, we took a stroll up the block to find a place for desserts when we fell upon a cute restaurant with outdoor seating and heat lamps.
 
We peeked in and asked a random waiter (who was through and through Italian) if we could be seated just for desserts.  He was SO pleasant in welcoming us and told us to take any seat we wanted as he brought us dessert menus.  We opted for the affogado and tiramisu, and ordered two Cafe Americanos.  Our waiter would often come by to check on us, chit chat, and basically made this short visit memorable.  In fact, every waiter we dealt with while here was #1 Italian (which always helps making a place feel authentic) and #2 - SO FRIENDLY.
 
The AFFOGADO blew us away.  Excellent!!
The Tiramisu was OK - - I've had much, much better elsewhere, including House of Prime Rib (oddly enough) or Antica.
The coffee was spectacular... and spectacularly STRONG, just the way I like it.
 
After about 40 minutes, we paid the bill and were about to leave when I spotted a waiter out on the street watching us.  As we got up, he asked us if we needed a cab and when we answered to the affirmative, he proceeded to run into the street to hail us one himself.  
Wow.
Sure, we tipped him, but after he hailed us one, he was already walking away telling us to have a wonderful night, obviously not even expecting a tip.
 
I love places like this.
 
Mind you - after dinner, a show and sitting at this adorable restaurant, it was nearing midnight.  This means I drank an awesome cup of espresso and hot water at 11:30 PM.
 
....
............
.....................
.............................
 
I was up until 6:45 AM the next morning, laying awake in my bed, blinking at the ceiling, processing all sorts of random thoughts, and pondering the meaning of life.  
 
This is downside #4232622 of getting older - caffeine actually works when I don't want it to, and doesn't work when I need it to work.
 
Thank you, Pellegrini-men!
author: Grace K.

description: A quick lunch while on the way to do the tourist thing. Shared the caprese sandwhich which tasted fresh.
author: Ashley P.

description:
The boy and I were lured into this place by their awesome heaters on the sidewalk. We were headed elsewhere, but ended up here deciding that it looked like a pretty decent place.

And it was decent, but I wasnt in love. The service was okay, but the food was pretty "meh" for the price. My boyfriend had a pizza which was alright, but with pizza even when its bad its good, eh? I had the polenta with italian sausage. The polenta was good..the sausage not so much. For $17...yeah I wasnt so pleased.
author: Britney K.

description: We had a very good lunch there - not great but tasty and good. $15 each, free parking, and nice staff. We had a sidewalk cafe and it was a good experience.
author: G M.

description: I got the Carpaccio di Carne which was pretty good and flavorful, but the lobster ravioli wasn't that great unfortunately =( and that was the most important part since it was the entree! First time seeing ravioli pasta in black with aurora sauce....something was missing....and shared a small bottle of chianti which was good.
author: Diane L.

description: Very sweet & quaint restaurant. Wait staff was so friendly & wonderful. The food was excellent & service great. Free private parking behind restaurant in North Beach???? PRICELESS!
author: Mariam M.

description:
LOVED IT. LOVED IT. LOVED IT.

By no means am i an Italian food expert, but this place was bomb! A slight wait, but what else can you expect on a Saturday night?

I ordered a fusilli de pollo, and for something so simple (pasta, tomato, basil, and chicken), it was excellent! My boyfriend ordered another chicken dish (a more basil dish), and he was also pretty impressed.

A definite place to visit, if in the area. I mean, based on simplicity, and quality of food, this place is one to go to.
author: Vanessa A.

description: The wait staff is efficient and friendly and very friendly and helpful -- no complaints there.  But given how many restaurants are vying for customers in North Beach, how can any place get away with turning out mediocre food?  The food here is pretty expensive for what you get, too.  The bread was unremarkable, as was the salad.  I've had the spaghetti carbonara at Ideale, Sciue Sciue, and North Beach Restaurant, and what's served at Piazza P doesn't compare.  Even the pizza is a shrug.  Nevertheless, the restaurant was busy and very crowded, even on a week night.  Oh well...DANG but I miss Little Joe's on Broadway.
author: Lira K.

description:
My very first yelp review.  We had dinner over the labor day weekend. The Osso bucco (spelling?) served with creamy polenta was the best meal I have had in some time. Absolutely delicious! Super rich, so be prepared. My friend chose the lobster ravioli, which she was not as impressed with. I give it four stars as my meal was outstanding!  

We had a half bottle of cab, a beer, crostini starter and 2 entries for about $100.00
author: Michelle W.

description: My boyfriend and I stumbled across this restaurant last night as we strolled through North Beach. What a find! Everything on the menu looked well crafted and delicious. We both had the seafood special which was AMAZING. Great atmosphere and people watching. I highly  recommended it!
author: Courtney K.

description:
You know it's bad when you can smell your seafood dish before they put it on your table.

That's what happened to my bf and I.  We generally try to finish our meal, but it was sooo bad that we had to complain.  When we did complain, the waiter was shocked that we said the seafood was...inedible (and well, I'm a trash can...I can eat anything).  He didn't offer another dish to make up for the seafood.  

We left very unhappy and hungry.  

Next day was bad news bears for the bf.  Poor him.
author: nancy b.

description:
Walked around and randomly picked this place for dinner since it was close to Cobb's Comedy Club.  It's near the tail end of the North Beach area.

I had some sirloin steak cubes mixed in with a white cream sauce pasta.  It was yum.  It wasn't like WHOA!  Or a WOW!  I think I can reproduce it at home...a bit oily, but I suppose true, authentic Italian food doesn't use oil sparingly.

The staff was very wonderful.  The servers helped us take pictures and even suggested that the girls we were with sit on our laps.  Server with hardcore Italian accent, can you be my wingman?  Or at least my closer?  Although, afterward I went into a 2-minute depression as I lack a very, cool accent.  Sigh.  

So in a nutshell..if there's one takeway for this review:
Italy
Other N. Beach Spots
Piazza Pellegrini
Buca
Macaroni Grill
Olive Garden 

(Apparently, yelp doesn't allow greater than signs/arrows!)
author: Yup S.

description:
Shockingly good food!!

My husband, his friend and I were walking to find a place to eat on New Years Eve, prior to the hour of serious imbibing, and walked past Piazza Pellegrini declaring it a "tourist trap".  Then out of the corner of our eye, we saw a couple with a gorgeous platter of fresh pasta and we decided, heck, why not?  It was a wonderfully surprise.  

The service leaves a little to be desired.  The girl at the front of the house coudn't even understand enough to understand we were ready to order.  And the little Italian guy in the suit sat us but just left us without menus.  Our main waiter was good, and even remembered to bring my husbands vino with his main meal.

Which is a great segueway into the actually food.  We all had appetizers:  i had a minestrone soup, Hubs had some lasagna looking thing, and Friend had cesar salad.  Thumbs up on Cesar Salad.  HUGE thumbs up on minestrone soup.  And Thumbs sideways for the lasagna thing.  Hubs made up for it though with his Cioppino which was SUPER delicious:  tons of seafood, great broth, huge portion.  I enjoyed the house made lobster ravioli, and Friend enjoyed the house made crab ravioli.  Very good dinner.  And we ate outside, got to enjoy some people watching, and weren't cold at all.  It was a great experience overall.
author: Ria D.

description: I've been here twice on visits to San Francisco and perhaps it is because people who live there are blessed to have such amazing food on every corner that they are slightly more critical than I am (Note:  I'm from Los Angeles, also a culinary mecca but not quite as amazing as SF for its italian food), but I have to say that the food here really hits the spot.  I don't recall my experience with the service so I can't speak to that, but I do know that every dish tasted fresh and was full of flavor.  It's been a long time since I've been here so it may have changed.  I hope not!
author: J M.

description:
There seem to be quite a few prima facie reasons to like this place: it's a nice space on a nice corner on a nice boulevard in a nice part of town, Yelpers seem to appreciate it on the whole, the restaurant will get you a reservation even on short notice (actually, I'm still on the fence if this is a positive, i.e. there must be a reason reservations are easy to come by), menu looks good--all standard Italian cuisine, not too pricey, and a nice, loud atmosphere where myself and Amanda F. and another couple of red-blooded American twenty-somethings could gingerly talk about how one of them is getting treatment for cancer (I know...).

But, having trudged through the meal, and lingering over the space where we might have ordered dessert but for our issues with body image, a nagging feeling of absence, that something had been missing all along from our little sortie, refused to abandon its testicle-crushing hold on my insulin addled consciousness.  And then, it struck me, as I split the bill with the other alpha male of the dinner party.  I knew what had been missing.

Quality.  

The food just was not good.  Was NOT GOOD.  You thought to yourself as you were eating it that it was good, but in fact it was not good.

How is this possible?

I don't know.  Some things are born as they are, and cannot be changed. I will never be the first black US President.  I will never menstruate.  I will never find "The Hills" or "The City" of even marginal value.

And the food of Piazza Pellegrini just isn't good.  My antipasta? Two slices of dry mozzarella, three kinds of forgetable sliced cured meat, a couple of flavorless olives, a canned artichoke heart.  Not good.

My veal chop? More fat than veal, supposedly stuffed with salami but more likely cat vomit, and decent vegetables and roasted potatos.  At least they didn't screw up the potatos.

Service? Unimpressive.  Location? Yeah, it's on Columbus, but there are nicer places on the street. 

Maybe it was the cancer.  Maybe it was the noise from our table's proximity to the kitchen.  Maybe I was indeed menstruating.  I can't tell you why I didn't hate the place when I was there.

But I do now.
author: Donny S.

description: We really enjoyed this restaurant A LOT! The service was really fantastic, the pasta was definitely house made, the bolognese sauce was exceptional and I enjoyed, quite honestly, one of the best lattes that I've ever had in my life. If you're looking for a quaint romantic little place with great good, definitely give Piazza Pellegrini a try! We'll definitely be back!
author: Sheila R.

description: Excellent service, but food was not  up to North Beach expectations.  Saltimbocca was not tender. Recommended Chianti immediately produced headache. The Pappardelle Pellegrini (short rib ragu) tasted like a beef stew. There are better choices only a few blocks away.
author: Mark L.

description:
Huh.

After a Friday night of browsing Open Table for a last-minute Saturday night reservation for four, I decided on Piazza Pellegrini as it seemed most perfectly to meet my necessary criteria: Italian, central, interesting menu with lots of options, good atmosphere, moderately priced. Check, check, check, check, check.

At crunch time, we were pleasantly surprised by the hustle and bustle, and the fact that we'd been given a pretty good table. The specials menu also looked great (although obviously had already decided what I was having 24 hour prior via online menu. Roasted chicken.)

I was a little disappointed that, after a warm welcome from the host, it took them a good 15+ minutes to take our drinks orders, and another 10 or so to take our meal orders. There was also no bread on the table, and after requesting some to accompany our antipasto dish, it came rather stale and unappetizing. But bread alone maketh not a meal, and so I continue...

The wine list is pretty pricey, and we ordered a bottle of Prosecco because it was the cheapest option and I'm classy like that. As far as Prosecco goes it was pretty nice: slightly sweet, clean refreshing taste. The aforementioned antipasto selection was simple yet nice, and the bruschetta dish was tasty. Promising start.

When the main dish arrived, however, I was sadly disappointed. I was expecting a gloriously juicy half-chicken and a plate of fresh vegetables. What I got was a rather small half-chicken where the preparation emphasis had clearly been on the skin, which I wasn't too interested in eating. As birds go, it offered very little meat, and the breast was really, really dry. The vegetables had a strong butter taste that detracted from their flavors, and the potatoes were a little mealy.

As we pitched in for the menu, I calculated that my meal had cost me $50, AND I grabbed a snack later that evening as that mealy bird was less than filling. Bottom line: good atmosphere, waiters are very nice but perhaps less attentive than they might be, and the food was pretty mediocre. I probably could have done a better job at home for much cheaper.

And FYI, offering your customers good bread from the get-go is a pretty cheap way to raise the bar a little, AND it covers your bases for your meagre chicken meal. Just a thought...
author: Amanda F.

description: Great location to people watch, however, there is the occasional waft of urine converging from the park across the street. I suggest sitting indoors. Servers were friendly & prompt. Went during lunch time, not too busy during the weekdays so we were seated immediately. On to the food, complimentary bread was cold and stale. They had decent selection of antipasti & insalate. Fettucine, pizza & panini dishes were average. Crab ravioli was pretty tasty, no imitation crab used here. My personal favorite would have to be the smoked salmon pasta -farfallette al salmone affumicato. Would I go again? Yes. Are there better places in sf within the same price range? Yes.
author: Joanne M.

description:
Crab Ravioli is pretty good (4*), although it's $25 for 6 ravioli
Ahi Carpaccio is okay (3*), $13
Sea Bass was awful!  Fishy and dry, we barely ate any and the waitstaff didn't seem to notice (0*), $30
Never order fish on Sunday!!
author: JP C.

description: This place has been here for 30 years! The food is awesome, my favorite is the Lobster Ravioli, The best I have had... I have taken lot of people here and everyone like it. Outside sitting is great for couples and people watching... The place looks old, in my opinion needs a remodel. other than that The food is great, Friendly staff and reasonable prices.
author: Arash H.

description: Lobster ravioli was really good, quattro formaggio pizza was good too.
author: A S.

description:
Everything I eat here is so freakin' good. I have been here many times w my boo and friends and they all love it. Love the authenticity of the place, and the food is delicious. My favorites are the salads, spinach, and for dessert, the home made bon bons. A MUST! 

Oh yeah, and try their authentic Italian beer. Forgot the name (sorry) but its their most popular import and its good.
author: Francisco R.

description: Food was superb!! Waiter was very informative and friendly! Also happened to see Carlos Santana!!! Perfect night!
author: Andi B.

description:
I would not have selected this place on my own volition.  As part of a larger group there to celebrate a couple of birthdays, we were lucky enough to find nearby street parking fairly quickly. 

Bottomline: average North Beach tourist fare, though the folks running the restaurant were nice enough to accommodate our unwieldy party of 16.   

I ordered the scallops and risotto - a dish on their "Specials" page that cost $29.  The scallops were large - 4 generously-sized monsters but seemed to have been breaded in a mixture of flour and baking soda? The resulting metallic taste the coating imparted did nothing for these normally sweet morsels from the sea.  The accompanying risotto: mushy.
author: Claudine C.

description:
I love the salmon bow tie pasta!  The short rib ragu is great, too.

Service is good - we get seated immediately. Customers are always here so the place must be good. Price is moderate. It's in North Beach so parking is hard to find.
author: Kit S.

description: Had an extremely difficult day with the Federal Agency of EEOC. After having to walk several blocks to bail my car out, my neice and I were famished. We were looking for the Stinking Rose and ran across this place thinking we would get some great Italian food but that was not the case. My pasta with shredded bbq ribs were so bland that I had to ask for extra cheese to improve the flavor to no avail. My neice ordered the chicken pasta dish and only ate the chicken and left the rest. My bread was very dry and the container for dipping our bread in the olive oil and balsamic vinegar was in the size of a teeny tiny shot glass where the bread had to be a tiny piece to fit for dipping. My dessert Tiramisu was very soggy, the worst I ever had and I sent that back. Never again will we ever eat at this gone to the dogs place again. The entire bill came to $70.00. Such a rip off. Our elderly waiter got a $5.00 tip for being so nice to us
author: carol j.

description:
Decided to stop by here for dinner and overall, it was a good experience. The food was very tasty, from the bread they served to their entrees along with dessert. We ordered two dessert, the cannoli and bread pudding. The cannoli was def worth it!! The bread pudding was good but nothing too special. Go with the cannoli for a true italian dining experience. Our wait time was not too long, about 10 minutes. Then again I think we had good timing because others after us were waiting outside. We were seated outside which did have overhead heaters which helped with the chilly evening. 

Prior to us even ordering, we requested separate checks. When we got the bill, it was not separated us we requested and when I asked the waiter about it, he asked I separate the charges for him. Kind of odd he asked us to do that, but other than that one thing...the overall dining experience was great.
author: Foodie O.

description:
Food was Ok, waiter I had (Dec 2) was awful.

The menu is nicely balanced and the roast rabbit was alright. The problem here is one that plagues a lot of North Beach restaurants--uneven, loopy service. My waiter ignored me almost completely, even failing to notice that I got up to close the damn door five times since it won't shut by itself. I was never offered a second glass of wine or even a dessert menu. He managed to get to know the pretty Asian girls at a nearby table, however, spending more time getting his picture taken with them than checking on how I was doing.
