We also asked for separate checks, which most restaurants don't like and our waiter gladly complied.  The location was great and we had a window seat that made for great people watching.   I had the crab ravioli, which was delicious.  Both friends with me said they enjoyed their meals as well.  The prices were reasonable for the city.  I would definitely go back.
author: linda d.

description:
We vacation in San Francisco once or twice a year and this is one of our  favorite places to eat. From the decor to the exquisite wait service, we love everything about Pellegrini's, especially the food. The experience is almost like going to an Italian friend's house and eating really good food and being taken care of. Most of the staff speaks Italian, so the accent is an added delight and certainly adds to the ambiance. We have sat outside on warmer days and inside on cooler ones. Both venues are quaint and inviting. The service is top notch regardless of where you are seated. Your water glass will never be empty. 

The food is amazing - rich, saucy, al dente pasta, fresh fish selections with saffron risottto and fresh crisp-tender vegetables. Honestly, I have dreams about the food because it tastes so good. My favorite for lunch is the Italian sausage sandwich. Spicy and rich on a crusty roll. For dinner, I favor the spinach salad with beets and goat cheese, simply dressed with olive oil vinagarette and fresh pepper. This followed by pasta shells in garlic butter sauce served with chunks of broccoli and Italian sausage. My husband likes the giant sea scallops dish with the saffron risotto and veggies and our son enjoys any of the delicious ravioli's on the menu - his favorite is the butternut squash ravioli with fried sage leaves. We usually enjoy wine with our dinner meal and take whatever recommendation the waiter makes for us. Be sure to save room for dessert, even if you share. The apple tart with vanilla gelato goes nicely with their rich, fresh brewed coffee. Our son prefers the extra-generous helping of creme brulee with thick, crunchy caramel coating on top. 

Don't let the fancy look fool you into not trying it - yes, the wait staff is dressed nicely and the tables look pretty with all the stem ware and place settings, but it's really a casual place. Before you leave, your waiter will be on a first name basis with you. Just like old friends.
author: S. M.

description: Having been to Italy I have been comparing pasta and Italian food to what I had there. Piazza Pellegrini would fit in on some back street where tourists don't go in Rome or Assisi. The food was fantastic - made with care and quality ingredients. We started with salads - the Bella Mia was so good. We also split a couple "antipasti" items... An anti pasto plate and some procitto e melone. The main courses were equally delicious. The menu was extensive and there were at least 15 specials. The staff was friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and fun!  I could go on and on... But I won't. There are restaurants with more stars, somehow, but this one is the best! Great for birthday or special occasion or a random Tuesday.
author: Chase P.

description: I went to this place for my birthday dinner and as usual, being a skeptic about Italian food, I kept an open mind about what the food is going to taste like. I ordered the Melanzane Alla Parmigiana, which is usually a classic Italian appetizer but here, it is served as a main dish. I really liked it because you can tell that they don't stiff you on the mozzarella. There's a lot of it in the dish! My friends were also really happy with their food and the Maitre D' from Luca was also really entertaining and helpful. The tiramisu, though, was a little disappointing. Too fluffy for my taste, but then again, I'm a real snob and make really good tiramisu, so...
author: Trish C.

description:
Awful.
Awful, awful, awful.

I give 2 stars because I saw no bugs, didn't get sick off my food and service was okay for a busy Friday night.  The crab ravioli was crusty, as in the corners were too hard to cut through and the rest crunched between my teeth like cereal.  Dry cereal.  The crab and sauce were bland.  My date's chicken parm tasted like left overs- dry, cold and chewy.  A barely edible, rather pricey meal.
author: i would love another ..

description: Two problems eating there last night:  The restaurant is extremely noisy and four of us were seated at a table that was at least a foot too wide, making it very hard to talk.  In addition, despite the fact that it was cold outside, they insisted on leaving the door open and we had to wear coats the entire dinner.  It was not a pleasant way to enjoy a dinner out.  The food was fine but we won't go back.
author: R S.

description: This was one of our favorite experieces while in San Francisco. Nestled in the LIttle Italy neighborhood, the menu features great fresh seafood specials with an extensive wine menu. We sat outside at dusk, which was made even better with the heaters for the cool air that came in. Only downside if the price, but otherwise a great dining experience.
author: Brian E.

description: Randomly dropped in before a meeting. Try the calzone! Delicious!
author: Marcus O.

description: this is a fabulous place to eat any time of the week .. they even accomodated a take out for us one evening when i needed to go paint but really needed to fill my belly too! The pizzas are yummy with the thin bases and not too much tomoato sauce and they always make sure your glass is full! The staff are so attentive and friendly ... and what i really like is that they remember me !
author: Amy W.

description: Cute atmosphere, friendly service, decent selections and tasty food.  The night I was here, they had butternut squash ravioli and dungeness crab ravioli as specials.  The crab ravioli was good (didn't try the squash, though was tempted).  Also seafood spaghetti was good, though a little light on the sauce (i like lots of tomato sauce!).  There's a lot of restaurants around here, but I could definitely recommend this place to a friend.
author: Jeremy S.

description: This place was extremely crowded, but I think that was only because they offer validated parking. Overall, mediocre and overpriced. There are so many places that are much better for Italian food in the city.
author: Andria M.

description: Solid, classic Italian food. Nothing special, but reasonably priced and flavorful. Gorgeous interior.
author: Mark A.

description: Comfortable and festive atmosphere with cute Italian waiters, and a guy with an accordian passing through to get the party started. The menu was extensive and I had a hard time choosing just one entree. I finally settled on the seafood risotto, but I think I made a bad choice because it was pretty bland and a little heavy. The salmon tasted very fresh, though, and the barbecued prawn on the top was a nice touch.  I'll definitely be back to give them a second chance and to try some of those items I passed up.
author: Alyssa S.

description: Piazza Pellegrini is a gem in North Beach. Across from Washington Square Park and at the end of the overly crowded tourist trap area sits this fine authentic Itallian establishment. Upon your arrival, expect to be greeted by the Itallian waiter who calls every woman "bella" and asks ur date if you are the wife. Nice way to start the evening! Our favorites - Short rib pasta, carbanara and scallop risotto! You really can't go wrong with anything on this menu. Did I mention their bread is delicious too?
author: Nettie K.

description:
I went for a quick dinner before a show at Cobbs.  Easy seating since we were eating at like, grandma/grandpa time...around 6pm.  Ordered a nice cold Moretti and snacked on the bread and balsamic vinegar/OO.  Ordered a salad to start/split which I should have know wouldn't be very good because it had fontina cheese on it.  Whatever.  When it came out it was over-dressed spinach with strange candied walnuts and big big hunks (I mean like little bricks) of cold fontina cheese.  YUCK.

Then my friend ordered the salmon bowtie and I ordered the ricotta gnocchi.  I think she liked hers, I personally am not a fan of smoked salmon in my pasta.  But mine was pretty horrid.  I noticed a few bites into it that it was missing the second ingredient-- sausage.  When I brought it to the attention of a nearby server he said he would let our server know.  5 minutes later our server came by and I pointed out the problem.  He says in his oh-too-cute Italian accent, "Oh, the kitchen messed it up and they're cooking up some sausage now."

Uh, whaaaa?  It comes out on a little plate.  This pile of sausage.  I dump it into my pasta and proceed to try and salvage the meal.  Two mins later I bite into a big fat gnocchi and realize, uhoh!  It's Doughy.  Floury.  Thick.  Dense.  Heavy.  Yuck.  Tried a few more of the larger ones, same deal.

I gave Pellegrini's TWO stars only because our server was accomodating and took it off our bill and seemed genuinely sorry that it had happened and offered to substitute something else.  But the Kims of Comedy were waiting.  

Kinda left a bad taste in my mouth overall.  Probably will never again revisit.  Not when there are so many better places with same or cheaper prices...
author: erin k.

description:
The location is extremely attractivie.  Great day in the city and wonderful location sitting on the sidewalk.

The rest was bad!
The waiter complettely messed up the order.  The service was horrid.
The food was right out of a can (Red Baron?).
I should have bought a fishing rod with me, for I was trying to find the salmon in my $20 salmon pasta dish.

I should have guessed that it was a rip-off by the quality of the bread served at the start.  Advice; save your money and go anywhere else.
author: Robert R.

description: Decent meal, but not extraordinary. Bread was meh. I had the pappardelle which was quite good. My wife had the lobster ravioli which she was not impressed with. Service was not bad, but not great. Good espresso to close the meal, but we skipped dessert.
author: Dave H.

description: I didn't find our waiter to be friendly. And I wanted to have a pleasant afternoon lunch with chamagne outdoors. But he could have cared less about the enjoyment of our italian dining. Anyway, the pasta alla puttanesca was pretty good, pizza only okay and salad was okay.
author: Oanh N.

description: Great new restaurant away from the hussle and bussle of central Columbus Ave.  Amazing atmosphere, super friendly staff, and authentic food!  The waitress was trying to convince passerbys to change their Stinking Rose type plans, "it's so Americanized."  Their loss, I totally enjoyed my time at Piazza!
author: Debbie Y.

description: This is the cutest little Italian restaurant ever!  I haven't even tried any other Italian restaurant in Little Italy because my boyfriend loves this place so much we always go back when we're in San Francisco and he's turned me into a fan too.  All the servers are Italian and they hesitate with their words sometimes but they're always really really nice.  We always start of with a caprese salad with their 18 year aged balsamic vinegar.  I had the minestrone soup and my boyfriend always gets their version of cioppino with mussels, clams, fresh fish and a mixture of other seafood in a light tomato broth.  I will definitely be coming back on my next trip!
author: Elaine K.

description: Being in Rome ... Or, more accurately - being in North Beach, get Italian ...  And when you do at this little outlet, you will not get disappointed.  Pizza Calzone was delicious. I was also glad I had that moment of reason, when my stomach did not took over controls and my thinking abilities entirely, driven by half-starving urges, and I was brave to say no to appetizers. I found plenty to struggle with on my plate and delighted each bite. If you add a great company to that, what else you can be asking for? Glad to be back ...
author: Rob R.

description: Super friendly staff and a great atmosphere combined with good food. Reasonable prices, expect 15-20 for a main course. Wine selection is good and they keep it well.
author: Paul G.

description:
This restaurant was recommended to us by a friend who lives in the area. We went last night for the first time and had a very good experience.

There is a small parking lot next to the restaurant and we were able to park there for $10.00. Not bad considering the area.

There were four of us in our party. We had a reservation for 6:30pm on a Saturday night . We were greeted warmly and  were seated immediately. 

Three people in our party had salads which were very fresh and tasty. I had the minestrone soup and it was excellent. 

For our entrees two of us had the crab ravioli in a tomato cream sauce and the other two had fresh pasta. We all agreed that the food was very good. The portions are a bit small but quite adequate.

In conclusion, we really enjoyed our evening at Pellegrini's. The food was very good and the service was excellent. We look forward to dining there again soon.
author: Don D.

description: Getting right to the point. The waiter was extremely rude. We came to restaurant and while waiting to be seated, I walked to use the bathroom. However, the waiter told me that we needed to sit down before he can allow me to use the bathroom. I don't know how the food is, but for me the service starts at the entrance, and these guys failed.
author: Gaurav R.

description:
My husband and I went to Piazza Pellegrini to celebrate Valentine's Day. We went on Saturday, Feb. 13th. We had an early reservation at 6pm. The restaurant was surprisingly empty when we arrived, but still a nice atmosphere. Our waiter was very friendly and VERY Italian. It was difficult to understand him at times, but it made the experience that much better! My husband had the veal and I had the same as last time, the gnocchi and the food was once again AMAZING! I absolutely love this place. The wine was great too! Of course my favourite was the tiramisu dessert. I had no room for it, but once I took one bite I had to finish the whole thing... and it wasn't a small piece. The best tiramisu I've had in my life (and I've had a lot in Italy). 
We keep recommending this restaurant to friends. 
We live in Los Angeles and drove all the way to San Francisco to celebrate Valentine's Day here. A great night!
author: SR K.

description: I pick where I'm going to cheat on my diet very carefully.  After reading the reviews of this place, I was excited to go.  My group arrived early enough for the early bird special ($14.95 for your choice of soup or salad; an entree of either cornish hen, lamb shank, pork chop or salmon; and a slice of bread pudding).  If the meal is good, then I feel guilty the next morning for cheating but feel ok because it was worth it.  However, this morning I woke up with resentment, regret, and indigestion.  Perhaps I should have gotten pasta instead of the lamb.  Piazza seems to do a good job with carbs - their focaccia was excellent, I loved the grilled polenta, and the bread pudding was pretty good...and it was a cute trattoria kind of atmosphere...so, three stars it is.
author: Tabatha Y.

description: My cousin was a chef in Italy and knows authentic Italian food when he sees it. He LOVES Pizza Pellegrini...and the staff. He says it's the first "real Italian" food he's had since his days in Italia and we're all in agreement that it's da bomb! The "Funghi Portobello con Polenta" appetizer will send your taste buds into the stratosphere!!! The prices are great, the staff is sweet and the location is fun; lots of people watching if you sit by the windows. Can't wait to go back. :)
author: Czechic C.

description: Acting as a tour guide to cousins from Vancouver and Chicago, I sought to take them to North Beach and have some good Italian food, although I'm not too familiar with the restaurants closer to Washington Square. We saw street parking available for all 3 of our cars (amazing in itself!), got out of our cars, and just happened across Piazza Pellegrini. And believe me, we were all pleased! We all had different dishes, and no one was left dissatisfied, even the 2-year-old in our party! The owner was surprised to see such a huge party in the middle of the day (I think there were 12 of us), but that didn't affect the service at all. Overall, we had a great time. I'm definitely going to take out-of-towners and some of my local friends there whenever I can get a chance!
author: Margaret P.

description: Ate lunch here with a group of friends. Not a lot of people around on weekdays so the owner chatted with us for a while. I was craving ravioli and thought that an Italian restaurant would be the ideal place for ravioli. I should have gotten some other pasta dish because I felt so ripped off. My raviolis had next to no filling. Definitely not a good deal.
author: Maggie L.

description:
Great location

Great food

Friendly staff

I went there for lunch and was impressed.  Price was moderately high, but reasonable.

Desert was divine.
author: Matt D.

description: This was the worst food I've eaten, I think ever!  I ordered gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce (my favorite dish) and it was inedible.  It smelled and tasted like dirty dish water.  My husband had the vegetable plate and that wasn't much better.  I am shocked at the excellent reviews people have given.  Maybe I have to try it again???  I am hesitant.
author: Jocelyn C.

description: I took my family here for dinner one evening thinking it would be appropriate for children and adults. The food was soooo salty, I am pretty sure they brined EVERYTHING. The service and wine was decent. Although I am positive 90% of our bill was alcohol related. Sadly you would think this might make the food taste better. I prefer Ristorante Gondola if I am forced to be in North Beach. Missionites should try Il Cantuccio. Nice ambience and delicious food.
author: Courtney I.

description: Service slow. Waiters nice, friendly. Fettuccine with shrimp okay. Thought it was small, turned out to be just right. Tiramisu too damp.
author: Yan Biao B.

description: Not good. Typical tourist trap. The food was below average and overpriced. The service was OK. I would not eat here again.
author: Nelson G.

description: This is definitely either number 2 or 3 for me as far as Italian restaurants go. To use one of my favorite phrases: "If you like Italian food, you'll like this place, a lot." It's a tiny little place, but don't let that fool you. We were walking by on our way somewhere else. I smelled something extraordinary. Being on a time schedule, we didn't have time to stop. I took a picture, so I would remember the name/address. Boy, am I glad I did. Anyplace that smells that good, is worth trying. The restaurant is very nice inside. Not upscale, but quite comfortable and a big open floor plan, for a tiny place. Seating is limited. We sat at a four person table with another party. They moved the tables apart 1" to designate they were two tables, funny. But at a place like this, who cares? Had the gnocchi, which was to die for. Very light and fluffy with a tangy cream sauce, asparagus, peas and spicy sausage. Good eats. I don't even like asparagus. Also had the sausage and mushroom pizza. Very good, reminds me of thin crust pizza from the east coast. A little touch too much sauce for me, but I hate sauce. The sauce was a little spicy and sweet at the same time. Good stuff. Crust could have been a touch thinner, but most will think it's quite thin. Anyway, everything balanced out on the pizza for an extraordinary meal. I also loved the fresh fococcia bread, which I am sure I misspelled. Service was quick and attentive. They obviously have a lot of regulars here. I'd come here again and again and again. Wouldn't think twice about recommending it. I loved the wood wine cases on display. Gives it a great 'Italian' feeling. Highly recommended. So proud of myself for stumbling upon it.
author: Matt R.

description: Me & a few friends went here for Italian food.  We even ate family style to try everything.  But even tho' the meal presentation was exceptional, the flavor was lacking.  The scene was absolutely beautiful & cozy; I can see how u can get caught up in the attractive wait staff & italian decor.  We tried the basic spaghetti, salad, shrimp with cream sauce, and ricotta.  The rice was too crunchy & the cream sauce was rather soupy.  I'm not a good cook, but I coulda made the salad from home & saved quite a few bucks.  This watered down Italian is good for the types who dont really want to experience true cuisine.  Too tasteless to return.
author: McCracken C.

description:
I was incredibly disappointed with this place.  We went there for Thanksgiving after wandering around for a while.  We got in and sat at the bar for about 10 minutes.  We got our table and waited a while for our server to get to us.  After studying the menu at the bar we were ready to order.  He showed up and laid out a bit of oil and a ton of balsamic vinegar for the bread.  He had crab ravioli and i had linguini with tomatoes and asked for mushrooms as well since there were so few vegetarian dishes (nothing on the special menu was vegetarian).  Two baskets of bread later the meal came.  About 6 raviolis and a small bowl of linguini - no mushrooms - just linguini, tomatoes, and garlic.  He cleared the plates quickly and left us for a while.  About 10 minutes.  When he finally came back to our empty table he asked if we were interested in dessert.  Hell no!  We got the check and a nonfunctional pen.  I was so ready to leave by now and this was almost comical.  I got a better pen and got out as soon as I could.

To recap: POOR service, small plates, no selection of vegetarian dishes, so-so food,  and a loud Tony Bennett on the huge plasma TV behind the bar.  We won't be back.
author: Lindsay D.

description: With a mere forty minutes to grab a bite before heading to Cobb's, the darling owner of this trattoria suggested we hit McDonald's.  Never fear, he attended us to himself to ensure that were well taken care of... and were we ever.  My friend had the fresh crab ravioli, which she swears was pure melt-in-your-mouth heaven.  I had the best carpaccio I've ever tasted.  We left promising to return SOON!
author: Lorraine F.

description:
three and out ... visit disappointing.  on previous visits, food okay, trying hard for new restaurant.  now that they have hit their stride, the food has fallen off and has become just one of many in north beach italian places.  decor is the focal point and will continue to be for a glass of wine, small talk, and the plasma screen;  the trend now,a good thing?

I HAD NO CHOICE, ANOTHER DIASTER.  flies, old food, extremely helpful serivce ... delist this place ... first time i have demoted a place, health inspectors please stop by
author: tim y.

description: This is my neighborhood go-to for dinner.  They are super friendly, always send out a little something on the house, and the fresh crab ciopinno, when they have it, is out of this world.  The space is a tad generic, but the service and food more than make up for it.  Highly recommend!
author: nicole l.

description: Cool place. Enjoyed the outdoor seating. Food is good. Angel hair pasta is boring, but the clams and mussels are tasty. Service was one was the highlights. Normal, nice, attentive waiters. We didn't make reservations and only waited approx. 5 mins for a table. Food isn't 100 percent authentic italian tasting, but close enough for me to revisit Pellegrini for another dining experience. Happy eating!
author: Food L.

description: We came here for lunch and had a lovely experience with the service, patio seating, and fresh Italian food. The arugala salad had a nice light vinaigrette dressing with some tossed beats and fresh goat cheese. The pizza had a crust good enough to finish entirely, and the pasta alla puttanesca was al dente with a tasty olive flavor yet not overdone with the anchovies. I would recommend this place to anyone i the area looking for a nice Italian meal.
author: Madelyn Y.

description: Delicious North Beach lunch spot - feels like a vacation in a small Italian Village, if you squint your eyes.
author: Amy J.

description:
I went here for with a friend and my girlfriend for the Italian Heritage parade on the 11th.  They said for lunch they'd be serving a fixed meal for $40, which I thought it was a bit steep for lunch, but my friend was starving so we sat down.

The food had to be the biggest disappointment I've ever had for a meal that pricey.  

The antipasto was so-so and very forgettable.  

The fried calamari, however, was excellent and had a delicious sauce, but thats where my praise ends.  

The salad was about 7 leaves of lettuce, my friends and I looked at each other with a "thats it?" look.  

Then after waiting maybe 15 minutes, the waiter plops a plate of spaghetti in front of us.  I can easily say I make better pasta, the spaghetti wasnt tender, my girlfriend said hers was a little crunchy.  The sauce was on par with something I'd pick up from Safeway, and one solitary meatball was a huge disappointment.

Another 15 minutes pass and we get served our main course, chicken and lamb, no sauce, no flavor, again something I could have made better myself.

This place was awfully disappointing, and should be ashamed of itself for trying to pass of that piss-poor pedestrian meal for 40 dollars.  I really hope their non-holiday meals are much better, but I'll never know as there is no way I'd eat here again.
author: Tim C.

description: I took my girlfriend here for our Valentine dinner and we had a good time. Somehow, when we arrived at the restaurant we immediately found a parking space right in front of it. What a stroke of luck. Otherwise, finding parking space around that area is like finding gold. We came there just before the dinner rush hour and were able to get a table by the window. The view of the street and the church across the street was great. The waiters were attentive and polite. We were able to get our dish in less than 10 minutes. But we notice for the people who came in 15 minutes later, they had to wait close tgo 25 minutes for their food. The food was alright. We had the Pollo and the Seafood Pastas.There are better Italian food out there. But we enjoyed it because of the romantic atmosphere and the lively crowd.
author: Mark H.

description:
This was my second visit. First had been a weeknight last year, was impressed by the decent house wine, olive oil and soup. This time we ended up at Pellegrini at 11pm on a Saturday night and they were more than welcoming at such a late hour. Good service, the ever present basket of bread placed on the table quickly. The olive oil still good, house red surprisingly good. Had a gorgeously simple bowl of angel hair pasta with flavorful tomatoes and fresh basil. My boyfriend ordered the pesto pasta but asked for fusilli instead of linguine and to have some spinach added to the dish. The waiter was happy to oblige and the dish was really good.

Reliably tasty food, good service and reasonable prices. I'd definitely go again.
author: Amy K.

description: They are great! So good to us and attentive! The food is always good and sometimes outstanding!! the grilled vegetable plate is so wonderful! They also have a good sense of wine parings and the owner truly cares and listens to suggestions.  Pellegrini should be your go-to spot for a casual dinner or lunch when in North Beach
author: Jess S.

description: I was hanging out at the printers when the restaurant owner came by, before it opened, and got some business cards done. When I asked him what he was opening, and he said "an Italian restaurant," I was worried, I mean, we have enough of those! But I was not disappointed in any way, when I went there for the first time. I ordered a kind of putanesca pasta, and it was good. More impressed, though, by the fact that they are carting out gelato during sunny days. We DO need more of that!
author: Anna B.

description:
Don't listen to anyone who claims this place is better than Trattoria Contadina. It's not even half as good. These dishes are the outtakes from TC! We started with a mixed salad with pears and gorgonzola. This was the best part of the meal...very tasty. But then again, a mixed salad is hard to screw up! Next we split the Pasta Carbonara. This was really awful. The sauce was too runny and the pancetta, which is supposed to be the highlight of the dish, and supposed to be crispy, was instead rubbery and tasted like bad salami. For our second course we had the Thanksgiving turkey special. The turkey was a little dry but well seasoned, and the accompanying plethora of root vegetables, including a tasty truffle mashed potatoes, were nicely done. My daughter and I split on the cranberries, she didn't like them, I thought they were fine. However, it was hard to recover from the atrocious Carbonara.

The service was a bit slow, but not totally out of the realm of "European".

From the front patio, where we ate, you have a great view of the church at 666 Filbert Street (curious address for a church!).

If you're in North Beach, you can do way better for Italian food than Piazza Pelligrini. Start off by going around the corner to Trattoria Contadina!
author: Ira L.

description: The food was excellent, the prices were low, and the waiters were charming.  What more could you ask for ?
author: ellana f.

description: Had dinner here earlier tonight and my dining experience started with me taking a gulp of water only to discover a HUGE hair in my drink that ended up tangled in my mouth. Safe to say, I was disgusted. I alerted one of the workers. He gave a half-assed apology and made a "cute" remark how the hair wasn't from him (because he has a bald head). I'm not one to demand some kind of freebie because I recognize accidents happen, but come on, you have to make some kind of gesture to make this situation right other than making some lame joke. The meal didn't get any better - stale bread and a pasta with chicken dish (tiny cubes of chicken - it's embarrassing that they even say it has chicken in it) that was blah at best. I'm no chef but I could make this pasta dish better. My buddy wasn't impressed with his meal either. At least we didn't find anymore hairs in our drinks or food.  Too many good places in North Beach to bother with this one. This is my first review on Yelp and I've been using Yelp for years so I think that says all you need to know about my experience here.
author: Brian K.

description: This is one of those Italian restaurants in North Beach. The food is good, and sitting outside on a nice sunny day is also good. nothing was really earth shattering, but it was good.
author: Eric P.

description:
I'm no foodie, but I've definitely had better Italian food. This place is overpriced and overrated because of it's great North Beach location.

The service was painfully slow and inattentive. Upon arriving, it took 10 minutes to get menus, 20 minutes to get water and bread, 40 minutes to order drinks, and a full hour to order dinner.

We ordered a 2003 bottle of red wine, particularly for that year. It was $80 and one of the less expensive bottles on the menu. When it came out, it was a 2004 bottle which any wine person knows is a huge difference. However, the price didn't go down any on our bill.

I was excited for the butternut squash ravioli since this is one of my favorite dishes, but I was very disappointed. This was officially the worst ravioli ever. The edges were not cooked all the way - still a little too firm. And even thought I knew it was prepared in a brown sage butter, it looked like it was drowning in oil - gross! My boyfriend ordered the spinach ricotta ravioli which is usually a safe bet at any Italian restaurant, but it was pretty bland. They didn't even offer us fresh parmigiana cheese.

The only redeeming thing was they way they catered to the toddler with us. They brought her out some polenta with cheese as soon as she woke up from her nap.

If you're hard pressed for Italian food in North Beach, you'll probably have better food and service at a chain like Pasta Pomodoro.
author: Charlotte P.

description: We had dinner here last night after the comedy show down the street and were greeted right away. My friend and I decided to eat at the bar instead of waiting for a table. I ordered the special Squash Ravioli which I found was absolutely delicious. My friend had the Fettucine Bolognese and she said it was good. We shared a tiramisu for dessert and it was YUM! Their staff was friendly and attentive. I'll definitely go back.
author: L H.

description: this place rocked the gnocchi that i ordered.  not only was it super soft and perfectly textured, it also came with a delicious gorgonzola cream sauce.  Normally gorgonzola and i aren't always friends (though I blame that on my stomach and not my taste buds) but this time, it didn't bother me at all.  this is the second time I have been here and i love it.
author: P. G.

description: After reading the reviews,  I decided on going here on Monday.  The wine list is a bit limited, but the food was pretty OK.  So so Gnochi and good appetizers.  Three stars it is, as compared to other restaurants in the area.  The yelper was way off when he stated it is better than Trattoria Contidina.
author: MEK O.

description:
Thx Yelpers you came thru again!
Went there Friday v busy so sat at the bar & had a wonderful ragu pappadelle & my guest had the Osso Buco (Lamb shank!) she didn't feel the luv for the polenta but loved the meat.
Reminds me of a piece of Italy in SF esp as you are overlooking the park.

Will be back.
author: dawn w.

description:
Update: (6/18):
Ok, I have to revise my earlier review. After my last (positive) experience here, I took my friend here who was visiting here from Germany.  It took us 25 minutes to get seated, even though we had reservations. Then we were seated in an awkward configuration where they pulled two tables together, leaving my other friend sitting off by himself.  The part that didn't make sense was that they seated a table of two that came in AFTER us at a table for three in the corner next to the window before creating our awkward table. No explanation was offered for the delay nor any apology. This would have all been forgiven had the food made up for it. Unfortunately this was not the case.  My friend started with the bruchetta, which was odd and flavorless (cold mushrooms and tomatoes with cold blocks of cheese -nothing toasted- on slices of bread).  Both of them then had pizzas, both of which had soggy crust that tasted undercooked and a bit like styrofoam. It is unfathomable how bad both of the pizzas were. My vegetable platter was fine, but the rest was just too bad to warrant a return visit. I'm giving it two stars because the waiter was at least friendly and happily accomodated a special request I made regarding my salad. I'll definitely be heading to Cafe Delucchi instead next time I'm in the neighborhood.

This place was DELISH! I'm only knocking a star off because the wine we had wasn't so great (we tried 3 different kinds, so we didn't just get unlucky).  The food, however, was fabulous! Being vegetarian, as you know, we can often get the shaft at many restaurants, with most "chef's choice vegetarian options" seeming more like an afterthought than anything else. Not so here. Not only did they have numerous veggie pasta options, they also had a full fledged vegetarian platter.  And, even better, you almost feel like you're in Italy when you're eating here..untll you get slapped in the face by that cold SF fog as soon as you walk out the door.
author: SL N.

description: We had dinner 2-12-11 and was very disappointed in the lack of service we got. Not once did the waiter ask how we were doing or if we needed anything at all and the Resotto was crunchy. We complained about it and the employee didn't even care. As we exited there was a friendly older waiter that we both commented to each other that could of made our experience a little better. The tip we left for the waiter reflected the service we got  which is 38 cent and that was being generous.  For good service this is not the place to go to and the food was okay.
author: Lisa M.

description: We had dinner there Christmas Eve and even though the place was packed the service was attentive and friendly. The food is amazing. I had a porck chop with gorgonzola sauce that was truly tremendous.
author: Christopher J.

description: This place is so good.  I went there last night with a couple of girlfriends and we had a really nice dinner.  The service was great, the place was full at 5pm (always a good sign) and the food was delish.  I had the Farfalette al Salmone Affumicato...unbelievably good.  I was full but ate it until it was all gone.  Our waiter was quite entertaining and the atmosphere was really nice.  I'll definitely go back!
author: Suz N.

description: My boyfriend and I went here a few weeks ago, overall we had a nice time.  I was pleased with the atmosphere and table by the window.  The food and service, however, could be improved upon.  I felt the eggplant and pepper topping for the salmon was far too overpowering and could hardly get past the smell of the Gorgonzola cheese coating the pork chop to enjoy it.  They never once offered to refill our water or wine glasses when they ran low and they only have one bathroom for all the patrons.  I had to leave my date alone for a ridiculous amount of time while I waited in line and saw another woman sitting alone for what seemed to be an eternity waiting on her date to return from the facilities as well.
author: Cristina S.

description: Mama Mia ! Piazza Pellegrini is delicious! Strolled up the hill on Columbus looking for a place for dinner and decided to step into this restaurant with no reservation on a busy Saturday night. They were able to seat us immediately. The place was packed with large parties and couples sitting outside under the heat lamps. They have a large specials menu that we ordered from. I had the capellini with fresh crab meat and my dinner mate had the ravioli with fresh pancetta, peas in a cream sauce. Absolutely delicious. The wait staff is very friendly and there to make sure you have a great meal. Even the house table bread with oil and balsamic vinegar was excellent. Ordered a half bottle of merlot that went down very easily and ended our meal with Afogato dessert (gelato with hazelnuts and espresso poured over the top). Piazza Pellegrini certainly did not disappoint and I always love finding new places on a whim. Bellisima !
author: Meredith O.

description:
I was so looking forward to the rabbit. not too many restaurants offer it.
well, it was as dry as Pat's Thanks Giving Dinner.
what a dissapointment.
author: ines c.

description: Sat outside and had a coffee looking towards the church and park.  The food looked great but did not order food there.  A place with a good deal of character and a good location to people watch.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I, too, was dining at P.P. during one of our unusually hot SF nights. Based on being a regular at this restaurant, I can guarantee the restaurant is more comfortable than the last reviewer's experience on that warm SF night.

Although I'm certain tourists eat here, this is a neighborhood restaurant with authentic, quality Italian food. Crab ravioli is outstanding, as is the osso buco. It seems the owner is there every day and night, assuring that everything runs as smooth as possible.

Menu is very well priced for the quality of food.
author: Melissa M.

description: My favorite Italian in North Beach. Very good food, excellent service and a nice atmosphere. The manager is really friendly and the staff do little things to make you feel special. It always has a good vibe to it when I walk past, and I've heard they have an excellent value "early bird" menu before 6 p.m. With all this, and the fact that the people are genuninely nice, you could do a lot worse if you're looking for an Italian in North Beach. Well located on the edge of Washington Square too.
author: Ellen H.

description: Ate here friday night, antipasto plate was good. I had chicken parmesan which was very dry and i thought you pounded the chicken for this dish, which they didnt do. Lack of flavor was covered up with a ton of sauce. I barely ate any of it. Glass of pinot noir was 10 bucks and not good. Boyfriend had osso bucco, he liked it. the polenta was very tasty. good service.
author: Dee L.

description: It's a rainy November night in the city, and we're starving but looking for a choice parking space we can pop from right out of the car and into the front door. That space happens to be in front of Pellegrini. It's late at night and half empty, so we're seated immediately by the extremely gracious and warm waiter. I have the salmon and the featured cabernet, my husband has the chicken parmagiana and a Moretti-- we skip the antipasto and dessert, as what we had was quite filling for so late at night. This came to $60, which is a tad pricey to have gone without soup, salad or dessert, as well as having only gone for what was actually the house wine and beer. But the food was pleasant enough (my husband's parmagiana tastier than my salmon, my spinach tastier than his plate's side pasta) and the portions were not at all skimpy. I wouldn't recommend it for a foodie, however, as it's only pretty good not amazing-- and the bread was colder than room temperature, their balsamic vinegar was peculiarly loaded with sugar, when we both would have preferred more olive oil, a drop of balsamic, a dash of pepper and rosemary. At any rate, we weren't tempted to stuff on bread and wine, which is trivial a point enough. We were certainly satisfied with the atmosphere, the excellent service, and the romantic vibe of low chatter, low lights (beautiful light fixtures), and the rain pattering outside. The evening was 5 star largely because of our mood, the service at least 4 and a half if not 5 star, and the food 3 stars as it's A-OK for the price. Again, the portions are generous. Would I go back? I'm not really a creature of habit, it's not crazy wildly delicious, and so I can't really say Yay, I'm a fan. Next time I'll try something else in the plethora of great spots on Columbus. I say it's well worth it when convenient.  I wouldn't wait for a table here, but I'm impatient when hungry so this last comment is no harsh reflection on the establishment.
author: Kali D.

description: came in at 130 pm on a tuesday... the service was slow, the bread was ok, but the food and atmosphere werent spectacular.... the panini wasnt toasted and came on a hoagie... it was flavorless... the calamari / shrimp appetizer consisted of two shrimp, and a bunch of calamari.... anyways the app, panini, two blah pizzas, and two cups of soup... 80 dollars...+ tip to a guy who gave us 20 minutes before asking wat we were drinking, while he took an order from a table that came in after us ..save your money..
author: Jordan s.

description: i have only been to piazza pellegrini once, but i wasnt too impressed.  the service was fine, but the food was nothing special.  i didnt see that many items on the menu that i even wanted to try.  the pasta i got - linguini with pesto and shrimp, was fine but i could make better at home.  and i also thought that it was a little expensive for what it was - not really worth it.
author: Carolyn B.

description: i have lived here a month and ate out every day for every meal and this is by far my favourite place, amazing food excellent service ( especially the irish waitress) i will be sad to move back to england just because i wont have there gnocchi.
author: Pete K.

description: Fabulous cioppino and a really great atmosphere. Adorable park across the street you can look at while you dine outside.
author: Darby A.

description: We came here with a bottle of  Veuve to dine outside on a chilly night for my husband's birthday.  Our waiter met us with a champagne bucket and two glasses and corked our bottle immediately.  The heat lamp was fired up and we were cozy sipping champagne and people watching.  We ordered a grilled veggie and mozzarella stack for an appetizer, it was amazing!  The pesto drizzled on this really added to the flavor.  I have since created my own version at home (thanks for idea!)  For entrees, I had the crab ravioli and it was really the best I have had, ever.   I can tell it was homemade, not frozen or prefab pasta. My husband got the osso-bucco which he enjoyed although I did not sample it as this is not my favorite type of dish. What I really liked about this place is the service, location and the fact that everything was served really HOT- nothing worse than lukewarm Italian food.  We will be back here on our next trip to try out  new dishes (and perhaps draw inspiration for a recipe at home).
author: Tammy D.

description: Great for Lunch.  I had a great salad and pizzette.  I was looking forward to their penne arrabiata but apparently they had made it far too spicy that day.  I'll be back for sure.  The outdoor seating is very comfortable.
author: B B.

description: I came here with some friends before a show at Cobb's. No reservations, full-on dinner time, crowds everywhere. And yet they were attentive and cordial, did not laugh in our faces, and invited us to sit at the bar while we waited for a table. Now we're sitting there, the three of us, perusing the menu and constantly changing our opinion on what each one wanted to order. There were too many attractive things on the menu. The sausage must have been great, but I didn't get to try it. The pizza looked amazing, but I didn't get to try that either. Because what I REALLY wanted that pork ragu.  Not a bad choice at all, I must add. My friend's pork chops with polenta apparently were very good also, or maybe she was just very hungry. In any case, the guys serving were very friendly (as nobu points out, no waitresses...), and the place itself is nicely laid out with an open kitchen and big bar in the back. However, there's still something about it that makes it look cheaper than it is. Most places on Columbus have this thing going where they try to lure people into their restaurant. I don't remember a thick layer of makeup at the door, but there was a larger-than-life menu outside, and other attention-grabbing devices. I'm always a bit hesitant about going into a place like that, it makes me feel like I'm walking into a tourist trap and it lowers my expectations for the food. Wait a moment, is that why I liked the food so much?
author: Cris L.

description: I love Piazza Pellegrini! I've gone with a friend or with my parents and it's a wonderful atmosphere. The staff is friendly and the food is AH MAY ZING. Some of the greatest pizza and pasta I've had, even in Little Italy. I've only eaten dinner there, so I don't know how they are for lunch but I always have a good time and enjoy my food.
author: Mollee P.

description: Went here back in February and presented a restaurant.com coupon that we'd been holding onto and asked our waiter at the START of the meal if it was still valid. He went away for a while, then came back and said it would be no problem. Since we thought the coupon was a good deal, we ordered extra appetizers and drinks in addition to our main courses. Then, AFTER we were already served our appetizers and our main courses were on the way, the manager comes up to us and says the coupon is INVALID? Even though we explained our waiter told us it was ok, he said in a hushed voice that because it was an "older coupon" he would not honor it then left us just like that. No apologies. No compensation whatsoever. Some manager!! He was lucky we are not the type of people to make a scene or walk out without paying because we surely thought about it. We finished our meal, paid the full price, and left. To their only credit, the food was decent, but the manager's attitude completely ruined my appetite.  If this was the last restaurant in North Beach, I would never go back.
author: Jen S.

description: Love this place... Great food, friendly service! We go here a lot! Would definitely recommend Pellegrini if you are looking for good food in North Beach.
author: Rebecca L.

description: This place has a lot of potential. When I looked at the menu, there were so many things I wanted to try. However, the execution seems a bit off as if the combinations of flavors clash a bit. We had the parpadelle with beef ragu and the dungeness ravioli. The beef ragu was tasty although a tad bit on the salty side. The dish would have done better with a different pasta or perhaps even a rice. The pasta was also a bit overcooked and would have fared better in an al dente fashion in my opinion. The dungeness crab didn't seem too fresh and the green spinach ravioli again didn't seem to pare well with the crab. Overall, I would venture back there to try some of the other menu items and give this place another chance. There isn't really much good italian food in north beach anyway.
author: Luke F.

description: I thought this place was just okay.  We were swarmed by employees as we walked in looking for the rest of our party which was kind of off setting.  Items on the menu were good, but over priced I thought.  I probably would not go back.
author: Jo M.

description: Frankly I don't know what everyone thinks is so great about this place. Yes, it has the cute factor that makes women happy, but really. The portions are small (salmon in a vodka sauce was a literally tablespoon size portion (laid my spoon over it and there was no over hang) of salmon for $20 + !!!, worse yet the vodka sauce had no flavor, they modified the Alfredo sauce to make into the their "special" vodka sauce and the pasta was over cooked. There are better Italian places in North Beach. I tried this place on a Monday night because my favorite, Franchino on Columbus was closed. I'll never go back to this clip joint again.
author: jack w.

description: Food was nasty. Breads were super stale and hard, and I threw up when I ate the breaded veal entree. Worst creme brulee-super bitter and sugary. The staff was super flirtatious and aggressive. His annoyance ruined my dining experience with my friend.
author: Ali K.

description:
OMG! Just had dinner at Piazza Pellegrini in North Beach; San Francisco. We are well traveled, eat at many very upscale, fine restaurants across the US and we just found a true gem here. This is a small but lovely Italian restaurant with incredible food. Hubby ordered the Crab Cioppino (one of the specials for the night) and I ordered the homemade gnocchi. Both were fabulous!
We also ordered the tomato/mushroom bruchetta which was very good. Although we were quite full, we couldn't help but order dessert - good as well. BUT - more importantly - the service!...the attention to detail...AMAZING! Every little detail was well thought out and attended to. I could go on and on and explain all the little details but suffice it to say that it was very impressive. It was comparable to being at a five star restaurant. The good news? Prices were more comparable to being at a small, family, local restaurant - extremely reasonable for such quality in both food and service.
Also - small/comfortable enough to go casual if you'd like. CAN'T SAY ENOUGH GOOD THINGS ABOUT THIS PLACE!
We will definitely come again when visiting SF
author: mary-margaret s.

description: We had a great table that faced Washington Square and the Church. Heat lamps rock! It has welcoming and clean decor. However the food was okay. The highlight was the prosciutto and melon. Yummy. However the Spaghetti Carbonara was too runny and eggy. One of us had a bad stomach ache after. The other dish was the lobster lasgna which was good but on the average side. The service was good. We didn't have to wait for the outdoor table but we saw a family wait for well over 45 minutes for an inside table.  Unfortunately we may have caught them on an off-night.
author: Seymour S.

description: Definitely the best Italian restaurant in North Beach (and that's no easy feat)! The service is always exceptional, and if you're lucky, the Crab Ravioli will be on the specials list. It's the best ravioli I've ever had (and I consume a considerable amount of carbs in this form). It's slightly further up Columbus than the cluster of other Italian restaurants, so it's usually easy to be seated, often at the table of your choice. Do it, do it, do it! Or don't do it... so I can continue to be seated quickly.
author: Ali B.

description: the italian guy that was the first shown on the video was my server. he was really nice and friendly and even sung songs. noone was really in the restaurant during the time I went. i ordered pizza and salad. the pizza was thin crust which I like. it was ok. could have used a bit more sauce but i like more sauce on my pizza than most. crunchy crust. that was good. salad was good too. overall it was pretty good. wasn't the best or worst pizza i ever had. it was ok. again, the waiter was very very friendly and nice and made you feel at home. maybe their pasta dishses were great. I do not know. as a tourist, i kept hearing that san fran has amazing food. well honestly i didn't experience it during my stay. i think just like everywhere else, there are good restaurants and mediocre ones. you just have to know the difference. i knew north beach was italian, but when I got there I started asking people around there what was a good place to eat and no one seemed to have a clue. finally one local said he liked piazza pellegrini and it was opened so I decided to go tehre and stop walking around aimlessly. sadly i do not think this is one of the better restaurants in the area.
author: Food C.

description: We went here on a Saturday night. The wait was only 5 minutes, not a good sign. Nice deco, though a bit noisy and the floor is dirty. The place was under staffed or not well managed, quite crowded and looked hectic. We ordered prosciutto and melon, mozzarella with tomato and basil, and seafood spaghetti. It's surprising that you can go wrong with simple things like prosciutto and melon. Unripe  melon was cut into ugly shaped big chunks. The mozzarella was good, but there were only sprinkles of chopped basil. The spaghetti was so so, but the seafood, mainly clams and mussels, were not that fresh. There are so many choices around. We'll try somewhere else next time. btw, our waiter did speak with Italian accent.
author: Melody M.

description: It was a beautiful day out so we decided to hit up north beach for some food and people watching.  Found a parking spot right out front of Piazza Pellegrini.   My fiance and I said "looks good let's give it a shot."  The hostess was very nice and seated us right away.   5 minutes goes by, the waiter comes to the table next to us, chats up the people eating there, walks right back to the kitchen.  No acknowledgment what so ever.  2nd time same thing.  3rd time again.   I was starting to feel invisible.  To get to the point, my fiance and I were there for at least  15 minutes,  no water, no bread no acknowledgment.  Nothing.   Seeing how horrible their service was we decided not to wait for what could be horrible food.   If you like sitting down, watching people eat and getting ignored then this is your place.  Thanks Piazza Pellegrini for inspiring me to create a yelp account!
author: John V.

description: This was the worst meal I've had in San Francisco.  Went there to check it out since one my favorites, Da Flora, was closed.  Had a spinach salad that was mediocre.  The spinach was tough and chewy.  Guess I am used to organic baby spinach.  Not sure they use the best quality produce.  The pappardelle with short rib ragu was almost inedible.  The pasta was tough and not what you expect when they say they make their own pasta.  I guess they worked the dough too much.  The beef was all fat and gristle with very little meat.  I let the waiter know how bad the pasta dish was and he comped me on my dessert and expresso.  I shouldn't even have ordered the Sicilian Cannoli as it also was horrid.  Tasted of grease and had this unpleasant looking chocolate sauce thrown all over the plate along with globs of whipped cream.  I would never go back there though the service was nice and friendly enough.  There are just too many other North Beach restaurants to choose from.
author: Amy D.
